loans.name: María Margarita

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 40 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en el sector Licapa del distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace cinco años tiene instalada en su casa una pequeña bodega en donde ofrece a sus clientes productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite), abarrotes, bebidas y golosinas. Ella nos comenta que la idea de su negocio nació debido a que los ingresos que su esposo percibe como trabajador eventual no eran suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares.

El negocio de María tiene buena acogida debido a la calidad de trato que brinda a sus clientes. Ella está pensando en ampliarlo con la compra de más mercadería, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por ese motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Su más grande anhelo es ampliar poco a poco su negocio para hacer mejoras en su vivienda. Ella es una mujer responsable, amable y muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
María is the mother of a family. She is 40 years old and lives together with her husband and 4 children in the Licapa sector, Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region, located 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo. For 5 years she has a small grocery store in her house where she offers her customers essential items (rice, sugar, oil), grocery items, drinks and lollies. She told us that the idea for her business was born owing to the fact that her husband's earnings weren't sufficient to cover the household costs. María's business is well-known owing to the quality that she tries to give her customers. She is thinking about expanding with the purchase of more products, but doesn't have sufficient capital to realise this action, and for this reason for the first time she is seeking a loan of 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternative, which she is thinking of using to achieve her objective. Her greatest wishi is to little by little expand her business to make improvements to her house. She is a very responsible woman, friendly and very hard-working.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for local store

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 50 años de edad, es viuda, y vive junto a sus cuatro hijos en el sector Pilar Nores del distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de sacar a su familia adelante hizo que utilizara el dinero que le dejó su esposo al morir en la instalación de una pequeña bodega en su vivienda. Allí ella ofrece a sus vecinos y clientes productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite), abarrotes, golosinas y bebidas.

El negocio tiene aproximadamente un año de establecido y les ha brindado los ingresos suficientes para salir adelante. Rosa está planeando ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos para vender pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por eso se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Rosa es una mujer luchadora, ha sabido salir adelante a pesar de las dificultades y ahora su más grande anhelo es seguir trabajando para sacar a sus hijos adelante y brindarles la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera superior con la que puedan asegurarse un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Rosa is the mother of a family and is 50 years old. She is a widow and lives together with her 4 children in the Pilar Nores sector, Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region, located 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo. The need to move her family forward made her use the money her husband left her when he died to install a small grocery store in her home. Here she offers her neighbours and customers essential items (rice, sugar, oil), grocery items, lollies and drinks. The business has been established for nearly 1 year, and has granted her sufficient earnings to move forward. Rosa is planning to expand her business with the purchase of more products to sell, but she doesn't have sufficient capital to realise this action. For this reason for the first time she is seeking a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 600 nuevos soles which she thinks of using to achieve her objective. Rosa is a born fighter, and has moved forward notwithstanding the difficulties she has faced. Now her greatest wish is to continue working to move her children forward and give them the opportunity to study for a good career with which they can be assured of a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grocery items to expand business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana P. C. tiene un negocio de abarrotes llamado “Las Juanas”  este ya tiene 3 años, aunque es pequeño tiene muy buenas ventas por el trato que le da a los clientes ya que es una señora muy amable. Se le dio un crédito hace unos meses el cual ya término de pagar donde ella agradece ya que le dio buenos resultados por que fue para comprar mercancía y ya todo se le acabo es por ellos que quiere volver a surtirlo para tener ese resultado y así obtener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
The señora Juana P. C. has a grocery business called 'Las Juanas' which she's had for 3 years. Although it is small she has very good sales because of the way she treats her customers, as she is a very friendly woman. She received a loan a few months ago, which she finished paying back and which gave her good results as she purchased products which have now all been sold. For this reason she now wants to resupply the shop to have a good result and obtain more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the business

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Mrs.Trinidad O. is from the village of Calaran in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. She is married and blessed with only one school-aged child. Trinidad is a church worker earning 500 Php per month. Trinidad and her husband are also busy working in a farm in their own cultivated riceland. She has been engaged on her business activities for more than 10 years now. She earned 7,000.00 monthly from the said business. In 1999, Trinidad joined PMPC to access the programs and services of the said Coop. Trinidad is requesting a new loan of 30,000.00 PHP which will be used for additional capital of her existing project. This loan will be the 14th loan taken out by Trinidad from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase of farm inputs for her rice fields

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Mrs. Alma G. is from the village of Lusot, in Baliangao Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 38 years old, married, and blessed with 2 school-aged children. Alma owns and operates a business of planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earned 3,000.00 monthly. In 2007, she joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to access the Coop's programs and services. Alma is requesting a new loan of 30,000.00 PHP, which will be used to purchase housing materials. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Alma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: House Renovation

loans.name: Noem

texts.en:
Mrs. Noem U. is a villager in Kor village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectar field of land where she cultivates rice to earn her living.

With her farming she now has a problem because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and fuel to support the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy these items.

Her husband, Mr. Vong Chek, is a construction worker. Mrs. Noem U. is a mother of two children; one is employed in a garment factory and the other attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and fuel to support her field.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Mrs. Thol L. is a villager in Royak village in Takeo Province. She is a mother of 8 children. Two work in a garment factory, one is a soldier, and four attend the local school. The youngest child is two years old. Her husband and her daughter are also shown in the picture

Mrs. Thol L. is a farmer who owns a .6-hectar field of land where she cultivates rice to earn her living. Her husband, Mr. Loeng Chhorn, helps her on the field. Although they work hard they still earn little income to support their family.

Thus, Mrs. Thol L. is applying for a loan to buy one cow and one piglet for breeding. She hopes to increase their income and improve the family’s living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy one cow and one piglet for breeding.

loans.name: Mrs. Yorn Heab Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Y. Heab is the group leader of five members who all live in Chrouy Chey village in Kandal province.

Mrs. Y. Heab and her husband, Mr. Sou Sorn, are farmers who own a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) piece of land on which they cultivate rice to earn a living. On this farm they have a problem so Mrs. Y. Heab decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and fuel for her farm.

This couple has two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study being only two years old.

Although this family tries to work hard, they still earn less income than needed to support their living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fuel for her farm

loans.name: Mrs. Ouen Chea Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ouen C. is a group leader of five group members who all live in Preak Char village in Kandal province. She is a widow with 4 children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory and two attend the local school.

Mrs. Ouen C. is a famer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. In this farming, she now has a problem because her field is infertile so Mrs. Ouen C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support her field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the field.

loans.name: Phoung

texts.en:
Phoung S., 43, is married and lives with his five children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia in the Mean Chhey District. 

S. and his wife have been involved in growing morning glories for sale since 1998 and are able to earn an income of $9 per day. The family is also assisted by two of his children who are currently working at a restaurant. Each earns an income of $5 each per day to help cover the family expenses. 

S. and his children try to work hard every day to ensure a good standard of living for the family. And they are seeking to improve their businesses. 

As a result, he is requesting a loan of $1000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. He wants to use the loan to purchase seeds to grow more morning glories for his existing customers at the market. This is S.’s first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy morning glory seeds.

loans.name: Mrs. Korng Neang Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Korng N. is the group leader of a group of four members who all live in Speu village in Takeo province. She is a widow with a child who is employed in a garment factory.

Mrs. Korng N. is a cow breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing another cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Moeun C. is a villager in Neasar Kiri village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Aside from this, she raises pigs.

Since her pig business is going well, Mrs. Moeun C. wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy another piglet to raise.

Mrs. Moeun C. is a widow with two children, one of whom is a traditional medicine seller while the youngest one is a farmer.

loans.use: To buy another piglet to raise

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophea E. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She is the mother of four children: one is a construction worker while the others are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Hor Hing, helps her with the farm. They live in Chambak Tuem village in Takeo province. 
Mrs. Sophea E. faces an obstacle with her plantation because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizer or gasoline to pump water to support the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy these materials. She wants to use the rest of her loan to buy pesticides to kill the insects. 
Her husband is present on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline and pesticides

loans.name: María Isidra

texts.es: María Isidra L. D. E. D. 46 años D. edad, resiD. en el barrio D. San Jacinto, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Ella es una persona la cual vive sola y que debe trabajar muy duro por poder tener una vida digna. María posee un comedor en el mercado municipal del Barrio San Jacinto, en el cual elabora y venD. desayunos y almuerzos, así mismo comercializa bebidas frías y calientes. Debido a que ya posee muchos años D. tener este negocio, cuenta con una amplia clientela, la cual asiste a su comedor ya que la consideran como una persona D. mucha confianza, así mismo les agrada el buen trato que ella les brinda. María solicita un préstamo con el deseo D. poder aumentar sus ventas, ya que ella espera poder comprar, verduras, arroz, frijoles, maíz y una mayor cantidad D. bebidas. Esto debido a que ella cuenta con la ilusión D. aumentar sus ventas en este nuevo año, es por ello que desea poder brindarles un mejor servicio D. comida a sus clientes y así mismo obtener nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
María Isidra L. D. E., 46, lives in the San Jacinto neighborhood in the San Salvador department. She lives alone and must work very hard to be able to have a decent life. María has a restaurant in the municipal market in the San Jacinto neighborhood. She makes and sells breakfasts and lunches. She also sells hot and cold drinks. Because she has so many years in this business she has a lot of customers. They come to her restaurant because they have confidence in her, and they like the good treatment she gives them. María is asking for a loan to be able to increase her sales. She hopes to be able to buy vegetables, rice, beans, corn, and a greater quantity of drinks. She hopes to increase her sales in this New Year. She wants to be able to offer her customers better food service. That way she will get new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables and basic grains

location.town: San Jacinto , departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhon N. is a villager in Mreah Prov village in Takeo province. She has one child who is a silk weaver. Her husband is shown with her in the photo.

Mrs. Sokhon N. owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Nget Thy, is also a farmer. Although they work hard they still earn little income to support their family.

In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. Sokhon N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase her income when she sells the cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Rosa Gladys

texts.es: Rosa Gladys B. D. M. D. 52 años D. edad, resiD. en el Barrio D. San Jacinto, vive junto a su esposo, el cual ya es jubilado y junto a su único hijo el cual es mayor D. edad y trabaja. La señora Rosa posee una tienda llamada “El Mercadito”, el cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual tenga la capacidad económica D. surtir su negocio, esto debido a que La señora Rosa no cuenta con el dinero necesario para hacerlo, y es muy necesario tanto para ella como para su esposo, ya que es este el negocio que les permite solventar todos sus gastos familiares. Ella desea poder surtir su tienda con productos como detergente, comida enlatada, pan, golosinas, bebidas y otros productos más, los cuales son D. primera necesidad en un hogar y que también son los que se solicitan más en una tienda.
texts.en:
Rosa Gladys B. D. M., 52, lives in the San Jacinto neighborhood with her retired husband and only son. Her son is grown and works. Rosa has a store called “El Mercadito”, which is located in her home. She is asking for a loan to stock her business. Rosa does not have the money to do so. It is much needed for herself as well as for her husband. The business allows them to pay all of the family expenses. She wants to stock her store with products like detergent, canned food, bread, sweets, drinks, and other products that are basic needs items for the home. These are the products most requested in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perishable items for her store

location.town: Barrio de San Jacinto, departamento de San Salvado

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem T., 43, and his wife have been growing morning glories to sell since 2001. He is married and lives with his five children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. He earns US $8 per day. The family is also supported by two of his children who currently work for a private company earning US $7 each per day to help cover the family's expenses. 
T. and his children try to work hard every day to secure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of US $700 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. He wants to use the loan to purchase seeds to grow more morning glories for his regular customers at the market. This is his first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy morning glory seeds

loans.name: Mirna Amalia

texts.es: Mirna Amalia Z. E. de 48 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador. Ella vive sola, y posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad. Desde hace ocho años Mirna emprendió su negocio propio, viéndose en la necesidad de hacerlo, ya que perdió su trabajo y le fue imposible encontrar uno nuevo. Es por esto que para Mirna es de mucha importancia poder surtir la tienda, razón principal por la cual solicita el préstamo, ya que su mayor deseo es poder equipar su negocio con todo lo necesario, de manera que sus clientela aumente y así mismo sus ventas. Ella espera poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, a través de las ventas que obtenga, ya que la tienda es la que le permite contar con todo lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
Mirna Amalia Z. E., 48, lives alone in the San Salvador department. She has a store, and she sells perishable basic needs items. Mirna started her own business eight years ago. She saw the need to do so because she lost her job, and it was impossible to find a new one. That is why it is so important to Mirna to be able to stock her store. It is the main reason she is asking for the loan. Her greatest wish is to be able to equip her business with everything that is needed so that the number of customers she has will increase and that will increase her sales. She hopes to be able to improve her living conditions with the sales that she will get. The store is what allows her to have the necessities of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perishable products for her store

loans.name: Rosevilla

texts.en: Mrs. Rosevilla Y. is from the village of Mitacas, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. She is married and blessed with three adult children. She operates a hog-raising business. She has been engaged in her business for more than five years. She earns 5,000 Philippine pesos monthly from the said business. In 2005, Rosevilla joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosevilla has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Rosevilla is requesting a new loan of 12,500 PHP, which will be used for hog raising. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Rosevilla from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for hog raising

loans.name: Florentina's Group

texts.en:
Florentina C. is from the village of Macatal, Aurora, Isabela. She is 39 years old. Florentina is the group leader for an eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Florentina C.'s Group.

Florentina is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Florentina owns and operates a business raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Florentina has been engaged in her business for over 27 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Florentina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florentina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Florentina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Florentina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young plants to raise

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es: Ana Cristina Q. Ávalos de 54 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de San Marcos, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Ella es soltera y vive junto a dos nietos menores de edad, los cuales dependen por completo de ella. Ana Cristina posee un a venta de tamales, pan francés, nombre que se le da al pan tipo bague, el cual se come a diario en desayunos y cenas,  y pan dulce, este es un tipo de pan hecho a base de harina, azúcar o miel, el cual es bastante típico en este país y es muy parecido al sabor de las galletas. Esta venta la posee desde hace bastante tiempo atrás, y es el cual le permite día con día obtener las ganancias necesarias para poder brindarles el alimento y todo lo necesario a sus pequeños nietos. Es por esto que Ana Cristina solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de pan y así mismo la materia prima para la elaboración de tamales, ya que estos últimos ella los elabora en su casa. El mayor deseo de Ana Cristina es poder brindarles todo lo necesario a sus nietos, ya que es esta la mayor razón por la cual ella espera poder mejorar las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Cristina Q. Ávalos is 54 years old and lives in the municipality of San Marcos, located in the department of San Salvador. She is single and lives with her 2 minor grandchildren who are dependent entirely upon her. Ana Christina has a business selling tamales; French bread, baguettes and rolls which are eaten daily at breakfast and dinners; and sweet bread, which is a type of bread made from a base of flour and sugar or honey that is very typical in this country and is very similar in flavor to cookies. She has had this business for some time now, and it allows her day by day to obtain the income she needs to be able to provide her small grandchildren with food and everything else that they need. For this reason Ana Christina requests a loan through which she can buy a larger quantity of bread and also the raw materials needed to make tamales, because she makes these in her home. Ana Christina's biggest wish is to be able to provide everyhing that her grandchildren need, and this is the main reason that she hopes to be able to improve the conditions of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy bread and the raw materials needed to make tamales

location.town: San Marcos, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Marlith

texts.es:
La señora Marlith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Siempre Unidas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 35 años y 03 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Marlith, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, es una mujer que poco a poco, fue incrementando su negocio y haciéndose mas conocida por sus clientes. Las ganas de salir adelante le dieron buenos resultados. En la actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien. Vende sus productos de belleza de la línea Esika y se siente muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,800.00, comprará productos de belleza para aumentar su stock como: perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo otra vitrina para exhibir  sus productos. 

Marlith, es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Marlith is a member of the “Siempre Unidas” (“Always United”) Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district of the province of San Martín. She is 35 years old, married, and has 3 dependent children.

Marlith sells cosmetics and is a woman who, little by little, has developed her business and made herself well-known by her customers. Her desire to get ahead has had good results, and she tells us that her business is currently doing very well. She sells Esika brand beauty products and is very satisfied with her work.

She will use this loan of 2,800 Peruvian nuevos soles to increase her stock of beauty products. These products will include perfumes, colognes, lotions, compact powders, lipsticks, and fingernail polishes. She will also purchase another case to display her merchandise.

Marlith provides a good example for other woman, as she has started her own business and persevered to achieve her dreams. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her own business and for helping other women grow into entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Martha Julia

texts.es: Martha Julia R. F. de 47 años de edad reside en el municipio de Ilopango, junto a su compañero de vida, el cual trabaja como motorista del transporte público y sus dos hijos. Debido a que el sueldo de su esposo es muy poco, ella decidió hace ocho años iniciar su propio negocio, el cual le permitiera contribuir junto a su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar. Es por lo cual Martha invirtió sus ahorros en una tienda de productos perecederos, la cual nació con la iniciativa de tener una estabilidad económica. Martha solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir más en su tienda comprando productos como embutidos, detergentes, pan y otros productos más, esto lo espera lograr a por medio de dicho préstamo, ya que a pesar que cuenta con varios años de poseer la tienda no ha contado con el dinero necesario para invertir más en ella debido a que la mayoría de las ganancias las invierte en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Martha Julia R. F. is 47 years old and lives in the municipality of Llopango along with her life partner, who works as a public transportation driver, and their 2 children. Since the salary of her husband is very low, she decided 8 years ago to start her own business, which allows her to help her husband with the household expenses. For this reason Martha invested her savings in a store that sells perishables, which came into being as a result of her drive to have more economic stability. Martha requests a loan to invest in her store, buying products like sausage, detergent, bread and other items. She hopes to achieve this through the means of this loan, since in spite of having the store for a number of years she has not had money to invest in it, since the majority of the earnings have been used to pay the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sausage, detergent and other products to stock her store

loans.name: Nervith

texts.es:
La señora Nervith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Siempre Unidas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 56 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Nervith, lleva 25 años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos, ya que teniendo conocimiento en este tipo de actividad, no dudo en implementar su propio taller de costura, ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde diariamente atiende a sus clientes fijos, que ya la conocen y necesitan el servicio. Trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan y siempre regalando una sonrisa y con amabilidad sus clientes se sienten muy contentos y satisfechos. En la actualidad, esta muy contenta y orgullosa por lo logrado. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes grande y de variados colores, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Nervith is a member of the “Siempre Unidas” (“Always United”) Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district of the province of San Martin. She is 56 years old, married, and has 2 dependent children.

For 25 years, Nervith has been a dressmaker. She has her own sewing studio in a very well-appointed area of her home. Every day she attends to her regular customers, who know her well and need her services. She takes orders for garments in advance and her customers always smile happily upon delivery, very satisfied with her work. She is currently very pleased with and proud of what she has achieved.

She will use this loan for 3,000 Peruvian nuevos soles to purchase lengths of fabric in a variety of styles and colors as well as sewing supplies, including scissors, thread, needles, pins, and buttons.

Today, Nervith feels very fulfilled, and really wants to get ahead and realize the rest of her dreams. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her begin her business and for helping other women who want to be entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sewing supplies

loans.name: Lily

texts.es:
La señora Lily, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Siempre Unidas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 42 años  y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su casa, a comprar porque en ella  encuentran todo los productos que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,100.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Lily, se siente muy bien para continuar trabajando y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Lily is a member of the “Siempre Unidas” (“Always United”) Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district of the province of San Martin. She is 42 years old, has 2 dependent children, and lives with her partner.

Her character and her desire to achieve her dreams motivated her to begin her own business selling groceries from her home. The income from her business helps support her household. Since she began her shop she has steadily gained customers, and today she counts on many regulars who come to her daily to purchase merchandise, as she carries all the products that homemakers need and she is known for her charming service.

She will use this loan for 1,100 Peruvian nuevos soles to purchase bags of rice and sugar, crackers, pasta, salt, milk, cases of canned fish, eggs, and personal hygiene products so that she can continue providing excellent customer service.

Lily feels very good for being able to continue her business. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for providing women like her with opportunities for personal and professional development.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries to increase her stock

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es:
La señora Sarita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Siempre Unidas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 43 años  y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su casa, a comprar porque en ella  encuentran todo los productos que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Sarita, se siente muy bien para continuar trabajando y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Sarita is a member of the “Siempre Unidas” (“Always United”) Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district of the province of San Martin. She is 43 years old, has 2 dependent children, and lives with her partner.

Her character and her desire to achieve her dreams motivated her to begin a business selling groceries from her own home. The income from her business helps support her household. Since she began her business she has steadily gained customers, and today she counts on many regulars who come to her shop daily to purchase merchandise, as she carries all the products that homemakers need and she is known for her charming service.

She will use this loan for 3,000 Peruvian nuevos soles to purchase bags of rice and sugar, crackers, pasta, salt, milk, cases of canned fish, crates of eggs, and personal hygiene products so that she can continue providing excellent customer service.

Sarita feels very good for being able to continue her business. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for providing women like her with opportunities for development in their chosen fields.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries to increase her stock

loans.name: Norminia

texts.es:
La señora Norminia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Siempre Unidas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 33 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Norminia, lleva 08 años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos, ya que teniendo conocimiento en este tipo de actividad, no dudo en implementar su propio taller de costura, ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde diariamente atiende a sus clientes fijos, que ya la conocen y necesitan el servicio. Trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan y siempre regalando una sonrisa y con amabilidad sus clientes se sienten muy contentos y satisfechos. En la actualidad, esta muy contenta y orgullosa por lo logrado. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes grande y de variados colores, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Norminia is a member of the “Siempre Unidas” (“Always United”) Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district of the province of San Martin. She is 33 years old, has 2 dependent children, and lives with her partner.

For 8 years, Norminia has been a seamstress. She has her own sewing studio in a very well-appointed area of her home. Every day she attends to her regular customers, who know her well and need her services. She takes orders for garments in advance and her customers always smile happily upon their delivery, very satisfied with her work. She is currently very pleased with and proud of what she has achieved.

She will use this loan for 3,000 Peruvian nuevos soles to purchase lengths of fabric in a variety of styles and colors as well as sewing supplies, including scissors, spools of thread in a variety of colors, needles, pins, and buttons.

Today, Norminia feels very fulfilled, and really wants to get ahead and realize the rest of her dreams. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her begin her business and for helping other women who want to be entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sewing supplies

loans.name: Norith

texts.es:
Norith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Siempre Unidas”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 55 años y es madre D. 04 hijos, 02 que aun dependen D. ella.

El carácter emprendedor y las ganas D. salir D. cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio D. venta D. venta D. joyas confeccionadas en metales finos, D. esta manera aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desD. su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que  solicitan su producto y es quien personalmente les atienD.  con el carisma que le caracteriza. En la actualidad, cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada. 

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00, comprará joyas como aretes, cadenas, dijes, sortijas confeccionados en metales finos, para venderlos al por mayor y menor y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Norith, esta preparada para todo y aun se siente con muchas fuerzas para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento D. sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Norith, 55, is a member of the "Siempre Unidas" communal bank, which is located in Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is married and has 4 children, two of whom still depend on her. Her will to get ahead in life and her enterprising spirit pushed her to start her own fine metals jewelry sales business. She hopes to contribute to family expenses this way and, to date, has seen her client base grow. She works out of her own home. She has regular customers who ask for her product and it is she, personally, who tends to them with her characterictic charisma. She can count on regular, faithful customers. With this 2000 sol loan she will buy earrings, chains, charms and rings, maD. from fine metals, to sell at both wholesale and retail, to proviD. better customer service. Norith is ready for whatever comes and feels strong to continue working and getting ahead. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to her seeing her dreams come true and to reach her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fine metals.

loans.name: Hishigtogtoh

texts.en: Hishigtogtoh is a single mother who lives with her five children in Khovd province, Mongolia. Her children all help with the family business in their spare time. She and her family live in a traditional Mongolian tent called a "ger". She currently operates a metal product making business as well as a broom making business in her town. She produce a variety of traditional Mongolian household goods. Her products are very popular among her many customers because of their good quality and unique style. Hishigtogtoh started her business in 1994 and has built a successful operation over the years. Her earnings have enabled her to hire two more assistants who were unemployed and helped them improve their lives. Hishigtogtoh is focused on the future and has many new ideas for her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She says, "All I want is to save enough money for my children's education." She is requesting a 900,000 tugrug loan to purchase metals and materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase metals and materials for her business

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: Khun K., 25, is married and lives with a five-year-old child in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. K. and his wife have been involved in the agriculture sector, growing morning glories for sale, since 2000 and are able to earn an income of US $8 per day. He is also a skillful fisherman using traditional fishing tools to catch fish. These activities help generate better income for the family. K. and his wife try to work hard every day to ensure a good standard of living for the family, and they are seeking to improve their businesses. In order to do this, he is requesting for a loan of US $1,000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. He wants to use the expected loan to purchase a motorbike and seeds to grow more morning glories for his existing customers at the market. This is his first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and plant seeds

loans.name: Dulam

texts.en: B. is 33 years old and lives his wife and six-year-old son in Zavhan, one of western provinces of Mongolia. He and his family live in a "ger", a traditional Mongolian tent. His son attends a local secondary school. B. operates a livestock-related raw materials trading business in his province with the help of his wife. He usually purchases animal skin, unprocessed goat cashmere, etc. He has been conducting his business for many years and has had much success over the years. B. hopes to continue to expand his business in the future. He says, "With continued growth, I hope to improve my quality of life." He is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase raw materials to sell for his business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Boli

texts.en: Boli is 48 years old and lives with her husband and three daughters in Dornogobi Province, Mongolia. Her husband works in a private company while her oldest daughter Nomintuya is in university. Her youngest two, aged 15 and 17, are in a local secondary school. Boli operates a grocery trading and felt product making business. During summer she plants vegetables to sell in her little grocery shop while in winter she makes felt products such as shoes, souvenirs, etc. to sell to her neighborhood residents. Boli started her business in 2000 and has built a stable operation over the years. She is a very hardworking businesswoman and is focused on the future. Her business has provided her family with financial stability and has enabled her to improve her quality of life. Boli has many plans for the future and says, "With continued success, I hope to buy equipment for my felt product business." She is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan to purchase more products to sell in her grocery business and to build a greenhouse for her vegetable growing.

loans.use: To purchase more food products and build a greenhouse

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda T. is from the village of San Jose. She is 32 years old. Criselda is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Criselda grows and sells corn. Criselda has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 50,000 PHP per harvesting season from her farm.

Criselda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Criselda is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. This will be Criselda's sixth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her immediate family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Mrs. Lourdes P. is from the village of Bigaan in Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old. She is married and is blessed with 2 adult children. Lourdes buys and sells copra (dried coconut) in the local community.She has been engaged in her business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 10,000.00 PHP each month.

In 2003, Lourdes joined PMPC to access its programs and services. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 30,000.00 PHP to use as additional capital for her business.This will be Lourdes's 10th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina R. is from the town of Quirino. She is 41 years old. Gina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Gina plants, harvests, and sells rice. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 24 years and earns approximately 70,000 PHP per harvest from these activities.

Gina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina is requesting a new loan of 28000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. This will be Gina's sixth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her immediate family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Baatarhuu

texts.en:
Baatarhuu is 56 years old and lives his wife and three children in Khovd Province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a "ger," which is a yurt or traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His oldest son, who is 27 years old, works to help with the family's earnings. His second son, who is 22 years old, attends the university. His youngest goes to a local secondary school. 

Baatarhuu and his wife sell meat in their town. He started his business in 1998. After growing his business and stabilizing his income, he expanded his business by starting a taxi service with the car that he bought. 

Baatarhuu is a very hard-working businessman who is focused on achieving his goals. He says, "I will be happy if I can give my children a good and happy life." He is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (~$1050 USD) loan to purchase meat to sell in his business.

loans.use: To purchase meat to sell

loans.name: Sumya

texts.en:
Sumya is 32 years old and lives with his wife in Khovd Province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a "ger". Sumya manages a transportation service in which he transports baggage and luggage for residents of his province. He also sells firewood, an important household heating fuel in Mongolia. 

Sumya started his business in 2003 and has been quite successful over the years. He takes pride in his work and feels that he provides an important service for his customers. Sumya is focused on improving his business in the future and says, “I am working hard to feed my family.” He is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug (~$2100 USD) loan to purchase fuel and a part for his truck.

loans.use: To purchase fuel and a part for his truck

loans.name: Narsumbe

texts.en:
Narsumbe is 26 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Khovd Province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a "ger," a yurt or traditional Mongolian housing tent. His two young daughters both attend kindergarten. 

Narsumbe and his wife sell cosmetics in their town. He sells a variety of cosmetic from a rented stall in a local goods market. Narsumbe started his business in 2005. At first, he conducted his business from a small, rented stand at the market, but he used his earnings to buy a working space at a trading center that is located in the market. Today, his business operates at a stable level and he has a good reputation among his customers and suppliers. With his earnings he was able to buy a car and is planning to buy an apartment soon. 

In the future, Narsumbe hopes to continue to expand his business and earnings. He says, "My wish is to educate my children and expand my business." He is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (~$1050 USD) loan to purchase cosmetics from Ulaanbaatar to sell.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Mandal

texts.en:
Mandal is 54 years old and lives with his mother and 24-year-old daughter in Arkhangai Province, Mongolia. His daughter attends the university.

Mandal operates a taxi service in which he transports people between the countryside and the center of the province. He started his business in 2008 with working capital of 100,000 tugrugs (~$70 USD). In addition to his taxi service, he makes wooden furniture to supplement his family's earnings. He makes a variety of furniture to meet his customers's demands. Now, his working capital exceeds 300.000 tugrugs (~$210 USD).

In the future, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~$350 USD) loan to repair and maintain his taxi so that he can continue to support his family.

loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es: María Santos L. S. de 47 años de edad, reside en Nahuizalco, ubicado en el departamento de Sonsonate. Su grupo familiar esta conformado por su esposo y su hijo de 17 años de edad, el cual se dedica a estudiar. María posee un puesto de frutas y verduras en el mercado de Nahuizalco, en el cual vende su producto por unidad y al mayoreo, ella cuenta con muchos clientes sobre todo  las personas que poseen comedores en el mismo mercado las cuales compran ahí porque María vende las verduras a muy buenos precios. Es por esto que María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de frutas y verduras, ya que ella quiere comprar al por mayor para poder comprar a precios menores y vender aún más barato. Esto es de mucha importancia para ella ya que le permite percibir mayores ganancias lo cual beneficia a su familia.
texts.en:
María Santos L. S. is 47 years old. She lives in Nahuizalco, Sonsonate District with her husband and son, who is a 17-year-old student. María has a fruit and vegetable stand in the Nahuizalco Market. She sells individual items and also prepares bulk orders for a number of customers. The people who operate kitchens in the same market are especially good customers. Maria does her best to give them a fair price. María has asked for a loan so that she can buy fruits and vegetables at lower wholesale prices and give her customers an even better deal. She considers it important to increase her earnings and help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Sandra Elizabeth H. de 43 años de edad, reside en Cuscatancingo, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador, Su grupo familiar esta conformado por su esposo y sus dos hijos de 8 y 4 años de edad. Ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos, la cual le deja muy buenas ganancias, debido a que es una de las tiendas más fuertes del sector. Sandra solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más productos para surtir la tienda, así mismo desea comprar frutas y verduras al por mayor para poder vender otro tipo de productos en su tienda y de esta manera mejorar sus ganancias, las cuales serán de gran beneficio para su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra Elizabeth H., 43 years old, lives in Cuscatancingo, located in the San Salvador department. Her family is composed of her husband and her two sons, aged 8 and 4. She owns a store in which she markets perishable goods, which gives her a good profit, since it's one of the most solid shops in the area. Sandra asks for a loan with which she can buy more products to stock up the store. Likewise, she wants to purchase fruits and vegetables wholesale so she can sell different kinds of products in her store and this way increase her profit, which will be very helpful to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perishable products

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es: Rosa Lidia M. P. de 37 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Soyapango. Su grupo familiar esta conformado por su esposo y sus dos hijos de 9 y 7 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee una venta de jugos y licuados, la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace 20 años. Este negocio le ha permitido poder brindarle la ayuda necesaria a su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar como los estudios de sus hijos y el alimento. Rosa solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más frutas y leche para la elaboración del los jugos y licuados, así mismo desea poder comprar dos licuadoras nuevas, debido a que las que posee ya están bastante usadas. Rosa espera poder mejorar las ganancias de su negocio, ya que dentro de sus planes de inicio de año es superarse en su trabajo y así mismo brindarles una mejor vida  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa Lidia M. P., 37 years old, lives in the municipality of Soyapango. Her family is composed of her husband and two sons, ages 9 and 7, that are studying. She has been selling juices and smoothies from her home for the last 20 years. This business has allowed her to be able to offer her husband the help he needed with the household expenses such as the children's education and food.

Rosa asks for a loan with which she can purchase more fruits and milk for the juices and smoothies, as well as purchasing two new blenders, because the ones she owns are quite well worn already. Rosa hopes to increase the business' profit, since one of her new year's resolutions is to excel herself in her job and to offer her children a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruit and two blenders

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en:
Odgerel is 41 years old and lives with her husband and six children in Bayanhongor Province, Mongolia. Her oldest son operates a cell phone repair business to help with the family's living expenses. Odegerl and her family live in a "ger," a yurt or traditional Mongolian tent.

Odgerel operates a bakery and ice-cream business in her town with the help of her husband. Odgerel spends most of her time baking and her husband is responsible for making and selling ice cream. Odgerel and her husband started their businesses in 2001 and have steadily made progress over the years. Their earnings have enabled them to buy tools and equipment for the bakery. They have many plans for the future and hope, one day, to open their own store where they can sell their baked goods and produce ice cream.

In the future, she wants to have her own store, so she has already begun to build a stall in a local market. She says, "All I want is for my children to be well-educated." Odgerel is requseting a 3,200,000 tugrug (~$2250 USD) loan to purchase milk and flour for her ice cream business.

loans.use: To purchase milk and flour for her ice cream business

loans.name: Marvin Edgardo

texts.es: Marvin Edgardo M. E. de 41 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Delgado, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a sus dos hijo de 12  y 5 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Marvin es doctor de medicina general el cual tiene su consultorio, en el cual da consultas a mitad de precio a los miembros de la iglesia católica de Ciudad Delgado, así mismo hace visitas a domicilio a las casas de sus pacientes. Él ya posee 15 años de brindar su servicio a las comunidades más pobres del lugar y así mismo brinda sus servicios a personas con recursos económicos. Marvin solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar medicamento y equipo medico, de manera que posea la capacidad de brindarles más ayuda a las personas de las comunidades más pobres del lugar y así mismo a los pacientes de la iglesia. Marvin es una persona con muy buenas intenciones y con muchos deseos de ayudar a las personas que más lo necesitan, es por ello que solicita el préstamo para poder seguir brindando ayuda a los demás.
texts.en:
Marvin Edgardo M. E., 41 years old, lives in Ciudad Delgado, located in the department of San Salvador. He lives with his two sons, aged 12 and 5, which are studying. Marvin is a doctor, a general practitioner. He has his own office in which he offers consultations at half price to the members of the catholic church in Ciudad Delgado. He also pays home visits to his patients. He has been offering his services to the poorest communities in the area for 15 years. He also offers his services to people of means.

Marvin asks for a loan with which he can purchase medicines and medical equipment, so he can be able to offer more help to the people of the poorest communities in the area and also to the church's patients. Marvin is a person with very good intentions and full of wishes to help those who need it most, which is why he asks for the loan, to be able to continue helping others.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of medicines and medical equipment

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Guillermo De Jesús

texts.es: Guillermo de Jesús S. B. de 44 años de edad, reside en Tonacatepeque, departamento de San Salvador. Su familia esta conformada por su esposa la cual se dedica al trabajo del hogar y sus tres hijos los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Guillermo posee una venta de tortas mejicanas y hamburguesas, las cuales las comercializa en uno de los lugares que más se vende este producto, ya que esta frente a una universidad, en la cual hay varios puestos de estos debido a la gran demanda por parte de los estudiantes que transitan por el lugar. Cada día Guillermo se dispone a preparar las tortas en su cocina móvil, con la esperanza de obtener muy buenas ganancias, lo cual beneficie a la economía familiar, esto debido a que es la única fuente de ingresos que poseen.Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar la materia prima para la elaboración de su producto, así mismo comprar más tambos de gas propano. Guillermo se destaca por se alguien muy amable y trabajador el cual vela por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Guillermo de Jesús S. B., 44 years old, lives in Tonacatepeque, departament of San Salvador. His family is composed of his wife, who does the housework, and their three children, who are studying. Guillermo owns a stall in which he sells sandwiches and hamburgers. He sells them in one of the places where these products sell best, in front of the university, where there are many of these stalls due to the great demand from the students that walk past. Every day Guillermo readies himself to prepare the sandwiches in his portable kitchen, in the hopes of obtaining a very good profit which will benefit the family economy, since this is the only source of income they have.

He asks for a loan with which he can purchase the raw material he needs for his products, as well as more propane gas canisters. Guillermo's outstanding qualities are being kind and hard working and looking after the well being of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw material for sanwhich and propane gas canisters

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago C. G. de 41 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Goteras, ubicado en el departamento de Morazán. Vive junto a su esposa, y sus tres hijos todos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Santiago, es un hombre muy trabajador el cual vela por el bienestar de su familia, es por ello que se dedica a varios negocios como la compra y venta de ganado, vende maíz y así mismo posee una tienda de productos perecederos, negocio el cual esta ubicado en su casa y recibe la ayuda de su esposa. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de poder obtener mayores ganancias. Santiago solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir su tienda, de manera que pueda tener mayor clientela quienes prefieran su negocio. Él es una persona que se destaca por ser muy trabajadora el cual siempre esta buscando una alternativa más para poder obtener mayores ganancias y así brindarle una mejor vida a su esposa e hijos.
texts.en:
Santiago C. G., 41 years old, lives in San Francisco Goteras, located in the Morazán department. He lives with his wife and his three children, all underage, who are studying. Santiago is a very hardworking man who looks after the well being of his family. This is why he works in various businesses such as trading cattle, selling corn, and he also owns a general store. This business is located in his home and his wife helps him with it. He does all this so as to obtain a better income.

Santiago asks for a loan with which he can stock up his store, thus attracting a bigger clientele and earning their patronage. He stands out as a very hard working person who is always looking for a new way to obtain a bigger income and thus offer his wife and children a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory

location.town: San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán

loans.name: Bathangai

texts.en: Bathangai is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two-year-old infant in Arhangai Province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a "ger", a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Bathangai operates a shoe making business in his town. He specializes in making a variety of traditional Mongolian shoes such as the "Buriad" and the "Mongol". His business is especially busy during national holidays, celebrations and the wedding season in Mongolia. Bathangai started his business in 2004 with a working capital of 200,000 tugrugs (~140 USD). He has worked hard to grow his business over the last five years, but it has been difficult at times to lead a normal life. As his business is the only source of income for his family, he is focused on improving his skills as a shoemaker and growing his business. The most important thing to him is being able to provide for his children's education. Now that his working capital has reached 700,000 tugrugs (~490 USD) with his years of saving he has been able to buy a car for his family needs. Bathangai is requesting a 600,000 tugrug loan to purchase leather, glue, thread and other necessary materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase leather, glue, thread and other necessary raw materials

loans.name: Tuyasaihan

texts.en: Tuyasaihan is 44 years old and lives with her husband and six children in Arhangai Province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a "ger", which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her oldest son, Tumendemberel, works in order to help with the family earnings. Her second daughter is in university while the other two daughters attend a local secondary school. Tuyasaihan operates a dairy product selling business in her town. She started her business in 2006 with a working capital of 80,000 tugrugs (~56 USD). After years of successful business operations she has used her savings to educate her children. Over the years she has built a great reputation among her many customers and has been able to increase her working capital to 200,000 tugrugs (~140 USD). Tuyasaikhan attributes her success to her good accounting skills. She has many plans for the future and says, "I want to expand my business and improve our quality of life." She is requesting a 300,000 tugrug loan to purchase dairy products to sell in her business.

loans.use: To purchase dairy products

loans.name: Badampurev

texts.en: Badampurev is 30 years old and lives with his spouse and three children in Khovd Province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a traditional Mongolian housing tent called a "ger". His oldest two daughters, aged four and five, are in a local secondary school while the youngest one, aged one, stays home. Badampurev has operated a taxi service in his town since 2005. He transports people around his town as well as to different areas throughout Khovd Province. He has gained much experience over the years and is a trusted driver for his many customers. Besides his taxi service he also herds livestock in the countryside. Badampurev is a very hardworking person and is known for his good character. He is working hard to maintain his success and has much hope for the future. He is requesting a 500,000 tugrug loan to purchase mechanical parts for his car.

loans.use: To purchase mechanical parts for his car

loans.name: Altanbagana

texts.en: Altanbagana is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Uvs Province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a "ger", which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Both of his sons, aged 14 and 17, are in a local secondary school. Altanbagana operates a business making wooden products in his town. He designs and produces a variety of wooden furniture, focusing mainly on making doors. Altanbagana started his business in 2000. Using his experience, he has built a stable business over the years, and his many customers are very satisfied with the quality items he produces. As a young, business-minded entrepreneur, Altanbagana has developed good taste in making unique and stylish furniture that is in demand. He is focused on the future and has plans to open his own work place soon. He says, "I want to improve my business so I can build my own factory in the future." He is requesting a 1,800,000 tugrug loan to purchase wood, glue, lacquer and other necessary materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood, glue, lacquer and other necessary materials

loans.name: Turmunh

texts.en: Turmunh is 45 years old and lives with his wife and five children in Uvs Province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a "ger", a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest daughter, who is 19 years old, is in university and the other children all go to a local secondary school. Turmunh and his friend operate a car repair business in their town. He began this business in 2008 while working as an employee at another car repair business. He is planning to buy a truck in order to provide a transportation service to supplement his earnings. Turmunh says, “I am planning to have my own auto repair building in the future.” He is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase paints and spare parts for his business.

loans.use: To purchase paints and parts for his business

loans.name: Davaasambuu

texts.en: Davaasambuu is 50 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Uvs, one of western provinces of Mongolia. His oldest two daughters, aged 22 and 25, are employed, while the youngest two sons, aged 15 and 19, go to a local secondary school. He and his family live in a "ger", a traditional Mongolian tent. Davaasambuu operates a flour and noodle trading business out of a rented stall at the local market in his town. He started his business in 2000 and has built a stable business over the last nine years. Today he has much experience as a businessman and has a great reputation among his many customers and suppliers. His earnings have enabled him to improve his living situation and purchase a car for family use. Davaasambuu hopes to continue to expand his business in the future. He says, "My goal is to one day own the shop I'm working at now." Davaasambuu is requesting a 2,100,000 tugrug loan to purchase flour and noodles to sell.

loans.use: To purchase flour and noodles

loans.name: Erdenetogtoh

texts.en: Erdenetogtoh C. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Uvs, one of the western provinces of Mongolia. Her family lives in a "ger", a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. All of her four children attend a local secondary school. Together with her husband, Erdenetogtoh operates grocery a trading business and a meat and livestock retail business in their town. She runs the family grocery store while her husband purchases meat and livestock from the countryside and then transports and sells them through their store and in the center of the province where the meat fetches higher prices. She started her business in 2006. Erdenetogtoh is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase a large number of livestock for the upcoming winter months which her husband can sell at a high profit margin in the center of the province.

loans.use: To purchase a large number of livestock

loans.name: Tsendsuren

texts.en: Tsendsuren is 43 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Khovd Province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a "ger". His daughter and son currently attend a local secondary school. Tsendsuren operates a clothing trading business at a local trading center in his town with the help of his wife. Besides his business he works as a doctor in a police department in his province. Tsendsuren started his business in 2003. It has quickly grown over the last years and he has built a strong customer base. With his business earnings he was able to buy a car and a shipping container where he sells his clothing. Tsendsuren hope to build on his experience in the future and says, "I want to expand my business and have my own shop." He is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase clothes for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes

loans.name: Neil

texts.en: Neil is 39 years old and lives in South Cotabato where he operates a hog raising business, which he started in 1997. He is a family man with three children. He works hard in his piggery to provide for the basic needs of his family. Aside from the piggery, he also manages a two-hectare rice field. His eldest child is twelve years old, and he wants his children to finish their studies. He's now requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to fill the needs of his business. He needs it to buy feed for the pigs and farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and farm supplies

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert W. is a 31-year-old married father of two children. They live in Likoni, Mombasa where Robert operates a pharmaceutical shop. Robert has been in the pharmacy industry for four years now and his business has been a success.

Robert is currently accessing his first KADET loan and plans to purchase more medicine stock and to do some renovations in the shop. His customers are mainly the surrounding households, who enjoy his services.

He hopes to open more pharmacies in other parts of the coastal city of Mombasa in future.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine stock and to do some renovations in the pharmacy

loans.name: Marcelina De Jesús

texts.es: Marcelina de Jesús A. de 47 años de edad, reside en Mejicanos, junto a sus tres hijas. Ella posee una tortillería desde hace 10 años, en el cual ha trabajado arduamente por el bienestar de sus hijas, ya que Marcelina es madre soltera, razón por la cual debe esforzarse el doble por poder brindarles todo lo necesario  a sus pequeñas, las cuales se han convertido en la razón principal de todo para ella. Marcelina solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda compra maíz para la elaboración de las tortillas, esto debido a que cuenta con muy buena clientela, y ella desea poder atender a más clientes, puesto que en muchas ocasiones por falta de masa no ha podido atender a mas personas, es por ello que solicita el préstamo el cual le permita comprar más materia prima y así vender más y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Marcelina de Jesus A. is 47 years old. She lives in Mejicanos with her three daughters. She has had a tortilla shop for 10 years. In it, she has worked arduously for her daughters' wellbeing. Marcelina is a single mother, so she has to make twice the effort to be able to give her little girls everything they need. They have become the main reason for everything for her. Marcelina is asking for a loan with which she can buy corn to make tortillas. This is because she has very good customers, and she wishes to serve more customers. Sometimes for lack of dough she hasn't been able to serve more people. This is why she is asking for the loan which will allow her to purchase more raw materials and thus sell more and make more profit.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa de Jesús R. A. de 43 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a esposo y tres hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee una tienda de productos perecederos, la cual es de mucha ayuda para su familia, esto debido a que el sueldo de su esposo no da abasto con todos los gastos del hogar. Teresa solicita un préstamo por medio del cual cuente con la capacidad de poder comprar granos básicos, verduras, pan. Golosinas y otros productos más los cuales son muy solicitados en el negocio. Ella alberga la esperanza de que este sea un año diferente en el cual pueda mejorar sus ganancias y de esta manera poder brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús R. A., 43, lives in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband and their three young children, all of whom are in school. Teresa has a food store, which helps the family, as her husband’s income is not enough to cover all the household expenses. Teresa is seeking a loan to buy grains, vegetables, bread, candy, and other products, which are popular in the store. She hopes that this year she can increase her earnings and be able to offer everything necessary to her children.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grains, vegetables, bread, and candy for store.

loans.name: Metabel

texts.en: Metabel A. O. is thirty-nine years old, married, and has a four-year-old child. Her husband is a driver and they hope to purchase a Nissan matatu (minibus) some day. Her business is located at Aga Khan, an open air market in Kisumu, where she sells second-hand shoes. She has been doing this for the last three years and the major challenge has been so many people engaging in this kind of business and weather problems making it hard for her stock to move as fast as she would like. She is using her loan to add stock and she sees herself opening a boutique in future. She is tolerant, hardworking, creative and ambitious.

loans.use: Buying second-hand shoes

loans.name: Astrid Lorena
