texts.es: Astrid Lorena P. L. de 20 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Arce, en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su madre y su abuela de 90 años de edad. Astrid trabaja junto a su madre vendiendo pupusas, jugos, café, chocolate y golosinas, en las afueras de La Unidad de salud de Ciudad Arce. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima para la elaboración de las pupusas, ingredientes como maíz, arroz, queso, frijoles entre otros, lo cual le permita poder vender mayor productos. Astrid desea poder mejorar sus ventas, ya que de estas depende la estabilidad económica de su hogar, ya que su negocio es la única fuente de ingresos que posee.
texts.en:
Astrid Lorena P. L., 20, lives in Ciudad Arce in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her mother and her 90-year-old grandmother. Astrid works with her mother selling pupusas [Salvadoran stuffed dumplings], juice, coffee, chocolate and candy outside the health clinic in Ciudad Arce. She is seeking this loan to buy more ingredients for pupusas, such as corn, rice, cheese, and beans, among others. This will enable her to sell more products. Astrid would like to improve her sales, as the income is necessary for the economic stability of her home. This is their only source of income.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for pupusas

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Hishigdulam

texts.en:
Hishigdulam is 24 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in Uvs province, Mongolia. Her two young sons both attend kindergarten. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian tent. 

Hishigdulam is planning to operate a milk-trading business with the loan that she is requesting from Xacbank, a Kiva partner. Previously, in 2006, she managed a consumers-goods trading business at a local market. In 2008, she had to stop her business operation because of her pregnancy. She has worked hard and today she has gained much experience in conducting business. 

Hishigdulam is a very open-minded and hardworking businesswoman and she has many plans for the future. She hopes to continue to increase her earnings and improve her family's quality of life. Hishigdulam is requesting a 600,000 tugrug loan to start her milk-trading business.

loans.use: To start a milk-trading business

loans.name: Myagmarjav

texts.en:
Myagmarjav is 46 years old and lives with his wife and 21 year-old-son in Uvs province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His son, Lhagvadorj, attends university while his wife helps with the family business. Myagmarjav operates a meat trading business in his town. He started his business in 1997 and has made progress in his years of business operation.

As the winter months are quickly approaching, he is currently busy preparing his meat products for a successful season. Myagmarjav is a very hardworking entrepreneur and is of very good character. He is focused on growing his business in the future and providing a quality life for his son. Myagmarjav is requesting a 1,200,000 tugrug (~850 USD) loan to purchase meat to sell this winter season.

loans.use: To purchase meat for sale

loans.name: Marta Beatriz

texts.es: Marta Beatriz M. M. de 44 años de edad, reside en Colón, departamento de La Libertad. Su grupo familiar esta conformado por su esposo y su hijo. Ella posee una tienda de productos perecederos en su casa. Este negocio ha sido de mucha ayuda de manera económica para ella y su familia, es por ello que Marta desea poder invertir más en el, ya que lo considera como un negocio rentable. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar más productos como verduras, pañales desechables para bebé, comida enlatada y otras cosas más las cuales le permitan poder brindarles mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes y de esta manera ser la tienda más fuerte del lugar, la cual le genere mayores ganancias. Todo esto lo hace Marta con el fin de brindarle todo lo necesario a su hijo el cual es su mayor incentivo para ser mejor en la vida y mejorar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Marta Beatriz is 44 years old and resides in Colón, La Libertad Department. Her family includes her husband and her child. She operates a store selling perishable products from her home.

The business has been of much economic help for her and her family. For that reason, Marta wishes to increase her investment, as she considers it a profitable business.

Marta is soliciting a loan that will enable her to buy more products, including green vegetables, disposable diapers for babies, canned goods, and other things that will allow her to offer a greater quantity of products to her customers. In this manner, her store can become the strongest in that locality, generating the most earnings.

All this Marta does with the goal of offering all that's necessary to her child – a major incentive to do better in life and improve her work.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY A GREATER VARIETY OF MERCHANDISE FOR HER STORE

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo O. H. de 62 años de edad, reside en Colón, departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposa, la cual se dedica al trabajo del hogar. El señor Ricardo posee un negocio de estructuras metálicas, negocio en el cual le va muy bien ya que se destaca por ser una persona muy responsable en su trabajo, el cual entrega todos los pedidos a tiempo y se esmera mucho por brindar el mejor servicio. Debido a que es gracias a este negocio como él junto a su esposa sobreviven, el solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de metal, esto debido a que cuando las personas le hacen los pedido Ricardo debe poseer la materia prima para la elaboración del producto. Es por ello que él espera poder mejorar su negocio a través de dicho préstamo y de esta manera contar con una estabilidad económica, la cual es tan necesaria para todo ser humano.
texts.en:
Ricardo O. H. is 62 years old and resides in Colon, in the department of La Libertad. He lives with his wife, who is a homemaker. Ricardo has a metal workshop business, a business which is doing very well since he stands out as a person who is very responsible in his work. He delivers all of his orders on time, and he takes great pains to provide the best service possible. Since this business is the sole economic support of Ricardo and his wife, he is requesting a loan to buy a large quantity of metal, so that he will have the raw materials on hand to make products when people come with orders. He hopes to be able to improve his business as a result of this loan and thus have economic stability, which is so necessary for every human being.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy metal

loans.name: Margaret Mwaka

texts.en:
Margaret K. is aged 35 years, is married and has two daughters. She lives with her family in Mariakani where she runs a children's wear store. She has been in this business for four years now and she confesses that her business has been doing well. She also tailors new African clothes to supplement her income.

Margaret has been in KADET for several years and is now accessing her third loan. With the money, she plans to purchase more children's wear and to also purchase garments to make some African clothes called vitenges.

Having only reached primary education, Margaret hopes and believes that through working in her business, she will be able to educate her children up to college level.

loans.use: To purchase more children's wear and also to purchase garments to make African clothes

loans.name: Karen Patricia

texts.es: Karen Patricia L. D. B., D. 25 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad, vive junto a su esposo y su hija. Karen posee un comedor y pupusería, negocio el cual le permite solventar junto a su compañero D. vida muchos D. los gastos del hogar. Esta es una D. las mayores razones por la cual Karen desea poder invertir más en su negocio. Es por ello que solicita un préstamo el cual le haga posible el comprar maíz, queso, frijoles, chicharrón, arroz, y así mismo bebidas frías y calientes. Es como a través D. esto ella espera mejorar sus ganancias, D. manera que tenga más que ofrecerle a su pequeña hija la cual esta próxima a iniciar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Karen Patricia L. D. B. is 25 years old and lives in the Department of La Libertad with her husband and daughter. Karen manages a diner and pupuseria, which enables her to work with her husband in meeting several of their household expenses. For this reason, she wants to invest more into her business. She has requested a loan with which she will purchase corn, cheese, beans, pork, rice, and both hot and cold beverages. Karen hopes to improve her profits so that she can proviD. an education for her daughter, who begins school next year.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, cheese, beans, pork, rice, and beverages

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid N. is a married father of four children. Rashid owns a workshop where he makes windows for houses and furniture. He has been doing this business for the last 11 years. He also owns a dairy cow and sells milk, thereby supplementing his timber income.

Rashid is now accessing his third loan from KADET and was able to service the previous two without a problem. With this loan, he plans to purchase timber, nails and turpentine. He also plans to buy cover materials to make sofa sets. He mainly serves the surrounding community and also makes tables and chairs for schools nearby.

Rashid hopes to build another workshop on a plot he owns and to also employ other people in his workshop.

loans.use: To purchase timber, nails and turpentine and to also purchase cover materials to make sofa sets.

loans.name: Maira Iveth

texts.es: Maira Iveth A. H. de 30 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Libertad. Su grupo familiar esta conformado por su esposo y sus hijos de 14 y 3 años de edad, de los cuales el mayor se dedica a estudiar. Maira es una esposa y madre muy responsable, la cual se esfuerza mucho por brindarle todo lo mejor a su familia, así mismo por ser la ayuda idónea para su esposo, razón por la cual hace dos años inicio su negocio en su propia casa en el cual comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual espera poder invertir más en la tienda, surtiéndola con productos como pan, jugos, golosinas, embutidos, y más. Todo esto con el fin de poder obtener mayores ganancias y así mejorar la económica fam
texts.en:
Maira Iveth A. H. is 30 years old and lives in the Department of La Libertad. Her family consists of her husband and her two children, ages 14 and 3. Her oldest child is enrolled in school. Maira is a responsible wife and mother who tries hard to provide her family the best. In order to help her husband with expenses, she started a business two years ago selling perishable items and basic necessities. Maira has requested a loan because she hopes to restock her store with more products such as bread, juices, candy, sausages, and other merchandise. She does everything within her power to generate better earnings and improve her family’s finances.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bread, juices, candy, sausages, and other merchandise

loans.name: Susana Xiomara

texts.es: Susana Xiomara M. L. de 34 años de edad, reside en Lourdes, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Ella vive únicamente junto a su esposo. Susana posee un taller de corte y confección, el cual elabora prendas de vestir para hombres, mujeres y niños. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero para poder comprar tela para la elaboración de uniformes escolares, esto debido a que este es el mes de inicio de clases, y Susana desea poder contar con todos los recursos necesarios para poder ofrecer su servicio a sus clientas, y así mismo poder obtener mayores ganancias las cuales sean de beneficio para su hogar, esto debido a que tanto Susana como su esposo se esmeran mucho por contar con todo lo necesario para tener una vida digna para ambos.
texts.en:
Susana Xiomara M. L. is 34 years old and a resident of Lourdes, which is located in the Department of La Libertad. She and her husband live alone. Susana has a sewing workshop where she produces clothing for men, women, and children. She is requesting a loan so that she can have money to buy material for producing school uniforms, since classes begin this month. Susana wants to have all the necessary resources available so that she can provide her services to her customers. At the same time, she hopes to improve her earnings which will benefit her household. Like her husband, Susana strives hard to have all the necessities so that she can have a decent life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric for making school uniforms

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en: Ganbaatar lives with his wife and three children in Uvs province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His two sons, aged 14 and 16, attend the local secondary school while the youngest, who is 1 year old, stays home with her mother. Ganbaatar operates a raw material  and meat trading business in his town. He sells animal skins, primarily sheep and goat skins during spring time. During winter, he mainly sells meat and meat products for which the price is higher than any other season. He started his business in 1997. Over the years, Ganbaatar has become quite experienced in raw materials trading and has built a stable operation. He is now planning to expand his business in the near future. Ganbaatar's business is very important to him and his family. He says, "All I want is to provide for my children's education and raise them to be good people." He is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (~1050 USD) loan to purchase sheep and goat skins to sell for his business.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goat skins

loans.name: Esperanza Yolanda

texts.es: Esperanza Yolanda V. R. de 44 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Sonsonate, vive junto a su esposo y su hija de 15 años de edad, la cual se dedica a estudiar. Esperanza posee una venta de tortillas, jugos, y así mismo elabora y vende comida en las afueras de su casa. Este negocio nació debido a la necesidad que tenían de poder solventar todos los gastos del hogar y así mismo los estudios de su hija, es así como hace tres años Esperanza se decidió por poner un comedor en su hogar. Ella tiene muchos clientes ya que es muy responsable y dedicada a su trabajo. Esperanza solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar verduras, granos básicos y otros productos más para la elaboración de la comida y de las tortillas.
texts.en:
Esperanza Yolanda V. R. is 44 years old, and lives in the department (administrative region) of Sonsonate. She lives with her husband and her 15 year-old daughter who studies in school. Esperanza has a business selling tortillas and juices, and she also makes and sells meals in the vicinity of her home. She started this business as a means to help cover the household expenses and also the educational expenses of her daughter. Three years ago Esperanza decided to put a place to serve meals in her home. She has a lot of customers since she is very responsible and dedicated to her work. Esperanza requests a loan to buy vegetables, staple grains and other products to use in the production of food and tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy vegetables and staple grains

loans.name: Sot

texts.en:
Mrs. Sot S., 56, is a widow with one son. She lives on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her son has full-time employment.  


Sot has been a farmer for twenty-four years. She grows banana and tomato plants on her farm in the village. She doesn’t have capital to maintain her farm, so she is requesting a loan of the amount of $100 to purchase fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Pin's Group

texts.en:
These three women have jointly requested a group loan. One of these women, Mrs. Pin T., age 50, has been selected by the other members to be the leader of this group loan. Pin T. owns a piece of farmland that she uses to either farm rice or to build a stall for raising a few pigs, from which she earns a living. The farming work is assisted by her husband, who helps to plant the crop. Pin T. has been married many years and is blessed with seven children. Two grown children are working as garment employees. Pin T. needs a loan to purchase more pigs to raise. The other two borrowers:
S., a rice farmer, asks for a loan to purchase a cow for her farming business. 
S. is a rice grower and requests a loan to order rice in bulk from farmers to resell.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to raise.

loans.name: Amarzaya

texts.en: Amarzaya is 31 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Khovd province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His two daughters, 8 and 10, both attend a local school and his wife helps with the family business. Amarzaya operates a clothing retail business in his town where he imports products from China and sells the items at the local market. He started his business in 2006 and established both reliable customers and suppliers. Besides his clothing trading business he manages a raw material trading business in order to supplement his earnings. For the future he is planning to expand his clothing trading business and have his own shop. He says, “I work hard in order to save money for my children’s education.” Amarzaya is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD) loan in order to import more products from China.

loans.use: To import more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Hak

texts.en:
Mr. T. Hak, age 34, and his wife, Mrs. Koeun Khut, age 35 (pictured together), were married in 1989 and have two children: one son and one daughter. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

T. has been operating his business producing furniture for two years, while his wife has been selling flowers in Phnom Penh market for two years. He wants to purchase materials for his business because he doesn’t have enough. He is asking for his first loan of $500 to use for this purpose.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for operating his business

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha B., 45, and her husband, Mr. Dy Nhean, 47, have been married since 1981. They have four children: two sons and two daughters. Their two daughters weave silk at home and the two sons assist their father in a farming business. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River.

Chantha has been a silk weaver since 1980, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Dy Nhean is a fisherman.

Chantha is requesting a loan of $500 in order to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: 025 -Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Hạnh N. Thị (1) is a 41 year-old woman who lives in the town of Thanh Hoá. Hạnh is the leader of a 6-member group loan sponsored by the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 025-Quảng Hưng (18.7.025).

Hạnh is married. To making a living, she raises and sells chickens. Hạnh has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, Hạnh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hạnh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3079800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women that she used to purchase chicks to raise and sell.

She is now requesting a new loan of 6000000 VND to purchase more chicks. This will be Hanh's 4th loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hạnh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

The other borrowers in this group have livestock businesses and are requesting loans of 6000000 VND loan each to support their businesses. Hà Thị Xuân (7) is a 57 year-old woman. N. Thị Bình (4) is a 34 year-old woman. N. Thị Tiến (3) is a 48 year-old woman. P. Thị Dung (2) is a 55 year-old woman. N. Thị Bích (6) is a 27 year-old woman.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Hạnh N. Thị (1) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở tH.nh phố Thanh Hoá. Hạnh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các tH.nh viên. Mặc dù mỗi tH.nh viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các tH.nh viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 025-Quảng Hưng (18.7.025). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán. Hạnh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Hạnh kiếm được khoảng 2000000 VND. Vào 2009, Hạnh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Hạnh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Hà Thị Xuân (7) là 57 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. N. Thị Bình (4) là 34 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. N. Thị Tiến (3) là 48 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. P. Thị Dung (2) là 55 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 5. N. Thị Bích (6) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase young livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mr. Sok N. (pictured here), age 32, and his wife, Mrs. Leangkim Khim, age 22, were married in 2008 and have a young son. Besides his son, his mother also lives with him. They live approximately 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sok and his wife have been farming for five years. They grow cauliflowers on their farmland in the village. In addition, Sok hopes to supplement his income with a new business raising pigs. When the pigs grow big enough, he will be able to earn extra income by selling them. 

Therefore, he is applying for his first loan of $600 to buy piglets to raise. He also will use some of the loan to purchase fertilizer, seed and pesticide to maintain his cauliflower farm.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and to buy fertilizer, seed and pesticide to maintain his cauliflower farm.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is a 47-year-old widow living with her three children. After the death of her husband, she opened a lingerie and clothing shop in her town in order to raise her family and to pay for her children's schooling. Today, Marie is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy additional merchandise for her clients to purchase.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise

loans.name: Sovannarith

texts.en:
Mr. Sovannarith S., 44 and his wife, Mrs. Chantha Bo, 44, were married in 1986 and have four daughters. One of them is a garment factory worker and another two attend school. The family lives in a village along national road number one, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. Sovannarith was not in the photo, his wife in pictured instead.

Sovannarith has been a construction worker for four years. He now wants to launch his own business as a construction contractor but doesn’t have enough materials. Therefore, he is asking for a first loan of $400 to purchase construction materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Bella's Group

texts.en:
Bella B. is from the village of Namnama, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 37 years-old. Bella is the leader of a five member group loan offered by Kiva partner ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Bella is married and has two school-aged children. Bella owns and operates a business preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Bella has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 500 daily.

In 2009, Bella joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bella is requesting a first loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital.

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en: Ziad has worked as a furniture maker since 1999 after seeing a need for such services in the region..He is 46 years-old and married.  He is the father of six children, three of whom are unemployed. Ziad is requesting a loan of $500 in order to expand his business by buying a special compressor to better cater to his clients.

loans.use: To purchase a compressor.

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Mrs. Saret S. (pictured here), 42, and her husband, Mr. Vong Oun, 43, have been married since 1992 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Three of them are attending school. The family lives along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Saret has been growing corn, tomato and papaya for 30 years, while her husband has been a house builder for 20 years. Saret doesn’t have enough capital to maintain her farm, so she is requesting her first loan of $500 to purchase fertilizer, seed and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seed and pesticides

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is a 24-year-old single woman living with her parents. In 2006, she decided to work by offering clothing sales from home to help her father with the family income. Today, Diana is requesting to borrow $1,000 to expand her inventory for the winter so she can propose a wider choice of clothes to her clients.

loans.use: To expand her inventory for the winter

loans.name: Veang

texts.en:
Veang T. T., 25, is a determined and hardworking woman who resides in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Currently, she owns a hand cart which she uses to hawk (sell) meatballs around her community, typically earning approximately $3 per day which is used to meet her family’s needs.

Her husband helps cover the family's costs by selling ice blocks and also working in construction. The couple now have two school-aged children. Veang T. T. will be using her first loan to increase the financial capital of her business.

loans.use: To increase the financial capital of her business

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Miss Sopheap N. (photo above), 33, is single and lives with her mother and sister along National Road 20, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sopheap has been a full-time employee in a company for 10 years. She doesn’t have her own well and restroom to use. This is difficult for her as she needs to frequently ask her neighbors. Therefore, Sopheap is requesting her first loan of US$400 to dig a well and build a restroom for her family's use.

loans.use: To dig a well and build a restroom for her family's use

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en: Sanaa is a divorced woman with two young children. She has been working as a private teacher since 2005 to earn income for her family. Today, Sanaa is asking to borrow $1,200 to prepare an adequate study room for her students, including buying chairs and tables for this purpose.

loans.use: To prepare an adequate study room, including buying chairs and tables, for her students

loans.name: Soung

texts.en:
Mrs. C., age 35, is a good mother caring for five children. Her one grown son has a job, buying and selling used goods, while the remaining four attend school. C. has a store in front of a garment factory where she sells a variety of food to the sewing workers or passers-by. She normally starts selling her items in the morning and finishes in the late evening. She is generating approximately $3 income per day to help solve her family’s problems.

Another source of family income is from her husband’s taxi service. C. will be using her loan to repair her old house which frequently needs repairs.

loans.use: To repair her old house

loans.name: Ilere

texts.en: Illere I. sells groceries at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a super market in the future. She is a LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) client.  LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Imada is 43 years old and married with 6 children. Her husband is a welder and he also supports the household. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 120,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sothea D., 30, has been selling grocery for more than four years. She lives on an island on the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

She previously applied for a Kiva loan through Maxima. She is now requesting another loan in the mount of US$1,000 to add to her own savings to build a kitchen and restroom for use by her family.

loans.use: To add to her own savings to build a kitchen and restroom for use by her family.

loans.name: Davlatmurod

texts.ru: Давлатмурод Нозимов проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст 51 год. Женат, имеет 6- ых детей. Давлатмурод более 10 лет работает "Шофером", по специальности. Помимо этого он более 3 лет занимается животноводством, т.е. откармливает и продает скот. Кредит просит для закупа крупного рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Davlatmurod N. lives in the Rudaki district. He is 51 years old, married and has 6 children. Davlatmurod has been working in his field of specialty, as a driver for over 10 years. Besides this, he has been involved in animal husbandry, i.e. raising and selling livestock, for over 3 years. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Owadis

texts.en: Owadis is a 30-year-old single man. He has owned a beauty salon since 2005, with 12 years of experience in this field. He caters to a wide range of clientele in his village and its neighborhoods. Today, Owadis wishes to improve the decor of his salon and expand his business. In order to do so, Owadis is requesting $1,200.

loans.use: To improve the decor of his salon and expand his business.

loans.name: Gnor

texts.en: Gnor S., 39, was married many years ago but she doesn’t have children and she plans to have a child next year. She lives with her husband in a wooden house located in Phnom Penh city, where she earns a living by working in the field of construction for a small firm. Gnor S. is married to Mr. Romlor, who is 43 years old, and currently assists his family by working as a building foreman. Gnor S. has requested a loan to buy a used motorbike, which will allow her and her husband to commute to work.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Mrs. Yan K., age 52, and her husband, Mr. At Vat, age 57, have been married since 1979 and have five sons and two daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family home, one works in a garment factory and another two attend school. The family lives approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Yan has been farming for thirty years; she grows cucumbers and tomatoes on her farmland in the village. Her husband has been a fisherman for thirty years as well. She doesn’t have enough capital to purchase fertilizer, seeds or pesticides to maintain her farm. Therefore, Yan is applying for her first loan of $500 to help buy capital.

loans.use: To grow cucumbers and tomatoes.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 29-year-old single man living with his parents. In 2007, he opened a clothing shop for men in his town. He helps his father with the family income. Today, Ahmad is requesting to borrow $1,200 in order to add new inventory to his shop to attract more clients with his new collections.

loans.use: To dd new inventory to his shop.

loans.name: Oghogho

texts.en: Oghogho sells clothes at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She is a LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She is 35 years old and married with 2 children. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports the household. She is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao R. is 32 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh, where she earns a living selling Khmer noodles to neighbors in the village. She always buys the ingredients on credit and she returns the money after she finishes selling. She is married with four children, all of whom are teenagers and school-aged. Her husband works as a construction foreman and uses his income to help cover the family’s financial crisis. Mao R. hopes to earn extra income as a mushroom grower. Due to the lack of capital, Mao R. requests a loan of $1,100 from Kiva’s partner HKL with which she will buy seeds and essential material to begin growing mushrooms.

loans.use: To buy seeds and essential material to begin growing mushrooms.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Mr. Tom T., 49, and his wife, Mrs. Vanna Nheak (pictured together), 41, have been married since 1984 and have eight children: seven sons and one daughter. One of the children is married and lives in a separate home, four help their parents in their farming business and the three youngest sons are in school. The family lives on National Road number one approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
 
Mr. Tom T. and his wife have been growing rice and cucumbers for more than 25 years. Besides farming, Tom is a fisherman as well. He has applied for a Kiva loan one time already. He now is requesting his second loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for commuting. He also will use a part of his loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and fuel oil for his farm to continue increasing his productivity.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle, fertilizer, pesticides and fuel oil

loans.name: Kimsor

texts.en:
Mr. Kimsor B., age 48 and his wife, Mrs. Pov Soun, age 47, live in a small village along national road number four approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penn City.  They have been married since 1982 and have three sons. One of their sons is married and lives outside the family home. Kimsor is not in the photo; his wife is shown instead.
 
Kimsor has been selling cows and oxen for 20 years. He buys them from other provinces far away from his house and sells to a middleman who comes to buy it at his house. His wife stays at home and does housework. 

Kimsor hopes to expand his business, so he is applying for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase additional cows and oxen for resale.

loans.use: To purchase additional cows and oxen for resale.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en: Anwar is a 36-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Anwar has been working as a taxi driver since 2004. When he first started his business, he had to face the competition, especially since he didn’t have a lot of networking. He also had some financial issues. Anwar is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and because he is punctual. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car. This is the first time that Anwar has requested a loan. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by working in the surrounding villages.

loans.use: To do maintenance work on his car.

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en: Mostafa is a 19-year-old single man. He has been working as an aluminum worker for the past 7 years when he has too young; in 2008, he decided to open his own shop and began his career. Today, Mostafa is asking to borrow $1,200 to invest in his business.

loans.use: To invest in his business.

loans.name: Nadim

texts.en: Nadim is a 36-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Nadim has owned a restaurant since 1982. He makes all type of sandwiches, as well as mankoucheh (which looks like a folded pizza). The most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. Mouhamad is special in his work because he is known for his good and tasty mankoucheh. He does chicken, meat, escalope and all type of other sandwiches. When he first started his business, he passed through some financial difficulty. Nadim is special in his work because he knows how to meet his clients' demands; he is known for making the sandwiches on demand. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw material for his restaurant. This is the first time that Nadim has requested a loan. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase raw material for his restaurant.

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en: Ghassan is a 41-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Ghassan has been working in constructor since 1989. When he first started his business, he had to face competition, especially because he didn’t have a large network, as well as had some financial issues. Ghassan is special in his work because he is known for his good work. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and wood for his work. This is the first time that Ghassan has requested a loan.  His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by working in surrounding villages.

loans.use: To purchase tools and wood for his work.

loans.name: Khaldoun

texts.en:
Khaldoun is a 28-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Khaldoun has been working in agriculture since 1998. He plants olives; afterward he is able to make oil or to sell his olives. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to pay for the harvesting of his olives. This is the first time that Khaldoun has requested a loan.

Khaldoun is special in his work because he does his best to produce the best quality of olives and oil. His clients are people from his region, as well as people from different regions. When he first started his business, he didn’t produce as much as he does today. Khaldoun got into this business because he took on his family’s business. In the future, he plans to keep on expanding his work by producing more.

loans.use: To pay for the harvesting of his olives.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter sells building materials at retail prices to his customers. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He is 45 years old and married with 4 children. His eldest child is 14 years old. His children are still dependent on him and they go to school. He is a hard working man and an honest and faithful LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Peter has been in this business for a long time. He is requesting a loan amount of NGN 120,000 to purchase more building materials to sell. He says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell.

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.en: Marguerite is a 37-year-old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with her husband and their child. Marguerite has owned a grocery store since 2000. She sells candies, roaster, beverages and lots more. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is her second cycle and she has always paid on time. Marguerite is special in her work because she is welcoming. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t have enough cash to diversify her merchandise. Marguerite decided on doing her business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie is 38 years old and married with four children. She sells cooked foods and drinks in a location that is very favorable for most of her customers. She has been in this business for about four years. With this business, she has been able to assist her husband with the family needs. She lives in Delta State. She loves cooking and enjoys her business because of the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She wishes to make the business become bigger. For her children she simply wants good education for them. She needs a loan of N10,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks for her business. She says thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuff and drinks

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en: Moussa is a 28-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Moussa has been working as a builder since 1998. When he first started his business, he had to face the competition. He also had some financial issues. Moussa is special in his work because he is known for his good work. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his work, as well as his financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Seba

texts.en: Seba has worked in cosmetics and beauty products sales since 2008 to earn income to help her family. During this period, she was able to make a good number of customers. Today, Seba is requesting to borrow $700 to buy more products for her clientele and to increase her sales and thus, her income.

loans.use: To buy more products

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 52-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. He has owned a grocery store since 2004, where he sells candies, canned food, home cleaning products, etc. Hussein requested a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase merchandise for his store. He has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him improve his business by diversifying his merchandise and offering more products.
Hussein is successful in his work because he opens early in the morning and closes late in the evening. His customers are friends, neighbors, and traders. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to purchase a lot of merchandise, and had difficulty finding the proper place to open his store. Hussein started his business because he has experience in trading. In future, he plans to improve his store further.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Yorn M. is a villager in Mreah Prov village in Takeo province. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is a laborer. Her husband, Mr. Nop Puoy, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. He is shown on the left of the photo.
Mrs. Yorn M. is a silk weaver who makes a small income to support her family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it and has asked for a loan to buy more silk and another raw material to weave.

loans.use: To buy more silk and another raw material to weave

loans.name: Mich

texts.en: Mr. S., 29, is a married man who is blessed with school-aged children. He currently lives with his family in a wooden house in Phnom Penh city, where he has also built a medium-sized workshop from which he provides an invitation publishing service. His wife tries to earn money to meet the family’s financial crisis by sewing clothes from home. S. hopes to purchase more necessary equipment in order to provide a good service, and has therefore requested a loan from Kiva partner, HKL.

loans.use: To purchase more necessary equipment

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 28-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. He has been selling good quality furniture since 2001. Mohammad is successful in his work because he does his best to offer his customers what they want and tries hard to meet their requests. He also has good experience in sales. His customers are people from his region.
Mohammad set up his business because he had experience. He is an active man who does his best to improve his work and increase his income. He requested a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase new furniture for his business – for example, he wants to start selling desks with chairs. This is his fourth loan cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loan helped him improve his shop by expanding his range of merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase new furniture for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima owns a chocolate shop where she makes special designs and decorated chocolates to customer request. She has been involved in this business for the past 15 years. Over the years, she has become well known in her town and the surrounding area. Rima is asking to borrow $1,200 USD to buy more accessories and products in order to increase her business productivity.

loans.use: To buy more accessories and products for her chocolate business

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is a widow with six children who lives in Delta State, Nigeria. She sells bread to earn a living and meet her family's needs. She is a focused, hard worker who puts in long hours in order to keep her business sustainable. Patience is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more bread to sell and increase her stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 62 years old and married with eight children. He is a client of Kiva partner, Lift Above Poverty Organization. Samson has been selling groceries for a long time. He hopes to be able to support his children's education with the profits from his business. He is requesting a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell. He is grateful to all Kiva lenders.

About Lift Above Poverty Organization
Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 51-year-old married man and the father of one child who is at university. He has owned a pastry shop since 2004 from which he provides delicious sweet products to customers in his town and the neighboring villages. Today, Hasan is requesting to borrow $1,000 USD to buy a shop window to present his products and attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy a shop window to present his products

loans.name: Mrs. Han Horn Group

texts.en: Mrs. Han H. is the leader of a group of four members who all live in Roliek village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Kuch Mon, helps her on the farm. The couple has two children who both attend the local school. Mrs. Han H. faces a problem because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizer to support her field. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her rice field

loans.name: Chroek

texts.en:
Mrs. Chroek S., 49, is a humble widow and the mother of two children, both of whom are studying in the local public school.

Every day, Chroek S. sells clams and vegetables that she either orders from her supplier or finds from the private ponds around her community. She is also a good mother who helps do housework and care for her children when she finishes operating her enterprise.

Chroek S. wants to earn extra income by requesting a loan to purchase a boat and equipment for fishing.

loans.use: To purchase a boat and equipment for fishing

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en:
Loveth is still single and lives in Delta State. She sells groceries and foodstuffs which she buys from other distributors and returns home to sell. She has been in business for the past four years and uses the proceeds of her business for savings and also to take care of herself. 

With the aim of improving her business, Loveth needs the loan of N150,000 to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell. This will help to improve her finances. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Nut Naem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of twenty people and they all live in Praviney village in Takeo province. Mrs. Nut N. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members.

Mrs. Nut N. sells vegetables. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to sell. She is also a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living.

Mrs. Nut N. is the mother of two children, one of whom is a laborer while the other is a construction worker.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Miss T. Anna is a salon owner along Jubilee Street in Ibanda town. She has been in this business for over seven years.

Anna is a promising businesswoman whose future hope is to expand her salon so that she can employ more workers to help her work on more customers. More so, she is willing to attract as many customers as she can for better profits. She wants to use the loan for purchasing hair extensions, hair crème relaxers, jelly, and so forth for her salon.

Anna is thirty-years old. She is married and has four children of whom three are schooling. Her husband is a businessman who sells tiles.

loans.use: To purchase hair extensions, hair crème relaxers, jelly, and so forth

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Mrs. Sauda K. is a committed lady of thirty-three years. She owns a drug store located in the Kabwohe trading center. She has worked and lived in the area for over fifteen years. She is using the loan to purchase and stock more medicine in her drug store in order to meet her customers’ demands.

She is a married woman, blessed with four children. She is doing her best to provide the best for them. In her absence, her husband helps her run the business. Mrs. Sauda’s future plan is to increase her business for more profits.

loans.use: To purchase and stock more medicines.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice E. is a member of Osaromwenyeke Union in LAPO. The Kiva field partner, Lift Above Poverty Organization, is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She is 35 years old and married with four children. She sells groceries and drinks. She has been in this business for a long time, and she hopes to expand and own a supermarket in the future.

Eunice needs a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell, and she appreciates Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Noun

texts.en: Mrs. Noun P. is 50 years old, and she lives in Prey Buy village in Takeo province. She lives with her husband, Dy Vong, and five children. One of them works in a garment factory; the other four are students. Mrs Noun P. is a farmer who owns a small field on which she grows rice. Her husband is a laborer who can make a small income to support the family. She is asking for a loan from the Kiva field partner, AMK, to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for cultivating rice.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer for cultivating rice.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: The grocery business has been very good. Vivian, who is from Delta state, has been in this business for the past ten years. She is 32 years old and married with two children. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 NGN. She will use this loan to invest in her business, buying in bulk to get a better price. She hopes that this loan will help her build a business that will be profitable and provide benefits for her children. She says thanks to Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia O. is married to a commercial driver and they have seven children. She is 49 years old, and her youngest child is ten.

Felicia sells plantains, cooking oil, garri (cassava flakes) and tubers of yam in a major market in Benin City. She hopes to expand her business and provide her children with the basic necessities of life, including their education.

She needs a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 45 years old and the mother of six children. She sells cooked foods in a location which is very accessible to most of her customers. She is a focused, hard worker. She puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers.

Comfort is requesting the loan of 120,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Ndeye Soce

texts.fr:
Madame Ndeye Soce S. est une femme de 46 ans qui habite dans le quartier de Ngaparou dans la localité de Yoff. Elle est mariée, mère d’un enfant  âgé de 14 ans, ayant a sa charge 5 autres personnes. Elle est membre  de  la  caisse de l’U-IMCEC  Yoff depuis février  2004 et a déjà bénéficié d’un prêt antérieur Madame S. évolue dans le commerce de glace et de petit déjeuner depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle dispose d’un étale  situe en face et a quelques mètres de la caisse de Yoff. Elle a choisi cette activité car elle a toujours voulu vivre hors de la dépendance des autres. Ainsi avec ses bénéfices elle sera capable de résoudre ses propres besoins personnels. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus dans son activité c’est le contact avec la clientèle avec qui elle sympathise, mais aussi la recherche du profit. Elle sollicite un crédit de 50 000 frs et cherche à renforcer son fond de roulement pour l’achat de quelques produits destines au petit déjeuner qu’elle vend. Elle envisage aussi d’aménager son étale en achetant quelques bancs et tables locaux  pour permettre a sa clientèle de bien s’installer. Par conséquent elle sollicite un crédit de 50 000 frs et l’augmentation de ses revenus lui permettra d’assurer une petite assistance financière sur les dépenses quotidiennes à son mari.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ndeye Soce S. is a 46-year-old woman who lives in the Ngaparou section of the Yoff area (Dakar). She is married, the mother of a 14-year-old, who also supports five other people. She has been a member of the U-IMCEC bank since February 2004 and has already received a loan. Mrs. S. has been developing an ice cream and breakfast business for ten years. She has a stall facing the Yoff bank. She chose this business because she has always wanted to live without depending on others. Thus with her profits she would be able to take care of her own personal needs. What interests her most about this business is interacting with her customers whom she enjoys, but also making a profit. She is seeking a loan of 50,000frs and looking to build up her working operating in order to buy several products for the breakfasts she sells. She also plans to equip her stall by purchasing several local benches and tables which would allow her customers to sit comfortably. Thus she is asking for a loan of 50,000frs, and the increased income would give her a bit of help with the daily expenses of her husband. Continuing with its focus on active participation in the fight against poverty, with the positive backing of lenders the U-IMCEC succeeds in supporting populations in operating profitable, income-generating businesses, which promotes valued socio-economic development.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth sells dried fish and crayfish from her stall. She also owns a grinding machine which she uses to grind tomatoes, peppers and beans. With these combined businesses, she sells for long hours to enable her to support her family.

She hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more dried fish and crayfish to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

Elizabeth is 50 years old and married with seven children. Her youngest child is fourteen years old. Her husband works with a government firm, and he also supports the home. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish and crayfish to sell

loans.name: Vero

texts.en:
Vero sells flour and charcoal at the market. She has been in this business for five years. She lives in Warri, Delta State. She is 53 years old and married with six children. Her husband is a civil engineer.

Vero hopes for a loan of 100,000 NGN which she will use to invest in her business, buying in bulk to get a better price. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more flour and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is a widow and the mother of seven children. She is 50 years old. After the death of her husband she has taken on the responsibility of raising her children. Today, she is proud that some of her children are already in the university.

Elizabeth is a LAPO client. The Kiva field partner, the Lift Above Poverty Organization, is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

She sells frozen fish at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time and she hopes to expand her business.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 70,000 NGN to purchase more frozen fish to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen fish to sell

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Sandra is a hardworking woman of thirty-five years, who owns a grocery store located in Ishaka town called Diplomatic Pub. She is married and has two children.

Sandra is using the loan to purchase more inventory for her store. She is a dedicated business woman whose future dream is to increase her business.

loans.use: To purchase more items for the purpose of expanding her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is the 36-year-old mother of three children and she is married to O. who sells timber.

Rose sells local gin at retail prices to her customers and also sells soft drinks. She says her expectation is to see her business expand. She is requesting a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more local gin to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Rose is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more local gin to sell

loans.name: Komushana

texts.en:
Mrs. Komushana M. is a courageous lady aged forty-nine years. She has two children schooling. She owns a boutique located in the town of Bushenyi along Liberation Road.

Komushana is using the loan to purchase used clothes (skirts, shirts, dresses, trousers, and so forth) to sell. Her future hope is to educate her children and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Mr. B. Jackson is fifty-six years old and is married with six children.

Jackson owns a stationery shop which he has been operating for over eight years. He is using the loan to purchase stationery items such as pens and pencils, books, files, clip boards, colored pencils, papers, and so forth.

Jackson is a hardworking businessman whose dream is to expand his business and to become a successful businessman in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stationery items for his shop

loans.name: Umukoro

texts.en:
Umukoro is 30 years old and is single. She sells women’s wear very close to her house and has been in this business for ten years now. She is a hardworking lady and focused and is very happy with her business. She puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable.

Umukoro hopes for the loan of 150,000 NGN to purchase more women’s wear to sell. She believes that having an assortment of women’s wear that is both practical and of good quality will increase her sales. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more women's wear to sell

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy O. is 40 years old and is married with four children. Her husband works for a company to support the home.

Christy sells garri (cassava flakes) in a major market in Benin City. She says she expects her business to grow larger from the profits derives from her business. She therefore hopes to improve the standard of living in her home.

Christy is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more garri to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Christy is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more garri to sell

loans.name: Sokhatile

texts.fr:
Madame Sokhatile D. est une femme de 71 ans qui vit dans le quartier de Mbenguene dans la localité de Yoff. Elle est veuve, mère de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 30 et 40 ans mais ayant en charge 4 autres personnes. Elle a une expérience de plus de 50 ans dans son activité  commerciale. Elle est spécialisée dans la vente de couscous. Beaucoup de gens du quartier viennent s’approvisionner auprès d’elle en couscous hebdomadairement. Elle vend aussi des beignets, des oranges des bonbons assez diversifies. Son ambition de début d’activité était d’aider sa mère qui n’avait aucune assistance. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus dans son activité  c’est la réalisation de bénéfices qui l’aident a satisfaire ses besoins actuels et futurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs pour augmenter son fond de roulement. Une partie du financement est prévue pour l’achat de produits destines a renforcer son stock, mais l’autre partie va servir a renforcer sa réserve  en vue de faire face aux dépenses urgentes ou imprévues.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié.
texts.en:
Mrs Sokhatile D., aged 71, lives in the neighborhood of Mbenguene in the town of Yoff. She is a widow and the mother of two children aged 30 and 40. She provides for four additional persons. She has over 50 years' experience in her trade activity. She specializes in the sale of couscous. Many locals come each week to her and buy couscous. She sells also donuts, oranges and candy of various kinds. In the beginning her ambition was to help her mother who had no other support. Nowadays, Sokhatile is above all interested in the profit she makes in her business, which enable her to pay for her current and future needs.

Sokhatile applies for a loan of 100,000 CFA francs to increase her working capital. She will use part of her loan to stock up on various products and part of it to bolster her cash reserve to be able to meet her urgent or unexpected needs.

Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC – with the positive support of lenders – succeeds in supporting people in revenue-generating activities which promote valuable socioeconomic development.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Mrs. T. Monica is a promising lady, forty-three years old. She is married with four children of whom one child is still schooling.

Monica owns a farm and a banana plantation and has been with her plantation for over fifteen years. She is using the loan to purchase drugs and feeds for the farm, fertilizers for the plantation, to pay workers who normally help her with digging in the banana plantation, and so forth.

Monica is a hardworking woman whose future plan is to increase the output of her farm and her banana plantation.

loans.use: To purchase drugs and feeds for her farm, fertilizers for her plantation, and to pay workers

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther owns a shop where she sells articles such as nails, toothbrushes, padlocks, keys and other items. She is 38 years old and married with 5 children.  Esther has been in this business for 7 years and business is now booming. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN. With this loan, she plans to increase and expand her stock. With this volume of business, Esther hopes to increase her earnings in the long run and be able to better provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero sells garri (cassava flakes), wholesale and retail, to her customers at the village market.  She is a 46-year-old married woman with 5 children. She puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. Vero is requesting a loan in the amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase garri (cassava flakes) to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more garri (cassava flakes) to sell

loans.name: Mukiibi

texts.en:
Ms. Mukiibi M. is married and blessed with five children of whom one child is still studying. She is a resident of Tank Hill Cell, Ruti, Mbarara.

Mukiibi is a businesswoman dealing in scrap (waste material) from the community. She is acquiring a loan to purchase more scrap to sell to the factory.

Mukiibi’s future hope is to look forward to opening a retail shop to generate more daily income.

loans.use: To purchase more scrap to sell

loans.name: Jenerous

texts.en:
K. Jenerous is a resident of Kacence Cell, Kakiika, Mbarara district. She is married and is blessed with three children.

Jenerous has owned her plantation for over five years. She is using the loan to purchase and add fertilizer to her banana plantation. She is a promising lady whose dream is to establish another reliable business for more daily income.

loans.use: To purchase and add fertilizer to her banana plantation

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha N. is married with two children of whom one is schooling. She is located at Lowei Cell, Mbarara.

Aisha is a businesswoman dealing in motor spare parts. She is using the loan to purchase and stock as many spare parts as she can in order to meet the daily demands of her customers.

Aisha is a promising businesswoman whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase and stock as many spare parts as she can

loans.name: Humphrey

texts.en:
Humphrey M. M. is thirty years old, is married, and has two children aged ten years and six years.

Humphrey’s business is situated in a busy market within the town of Kakamega, and is known by the name “Golden Rules Tailoring”. He makes men's wear (i.e suits and trousers), something he has done for the last five years. He serves the local people and his major challenge is too many people doing the same business, hence making him lower his prices.

Humphrey is using his loan to buy sewing machines and materials for making suits. In future, he hopes to open a shop for supplying materials. He also has a dream to educate and bring up his children to become independent people. He really enjoys his work and is a faithful and efficient tailor.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines and materials for making suits

loans.name: Aliyu Keturu Draru Group

texts.en:
K. Draru is the chairperson of her group; she is thirty-two years of age and married. She looks after five dependents although she has no child of her own. Three of her dependents are going to school.

Draru has dealt in produce such as cassava flour, groundnuts (peanuts), beans, etc., so far for ten years. She is using the loan to purchase more produce to improve her business stock for much better profits.

Draru is a hardworking businesswoman who is looking forward for prospering and helping her family, especially her parents.

loans.use: To purchase more produce to improve her business stock

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes M. S. is thirty years old, is married, and has a son three years old.

Agnes’s business is located at Juja where she has been engaged in selling men’s and women’s wear for two years. Previously, she was hawking (going door-to-door) secondhand clothes and now she has a dream to grow her business and open many outlets.

In future, Agnes actually wants to be the market leader in this business. Her major challenge is that many people engage in this kind of business and so for her to have an edge over the rest of the people in this business, she feels she has to open more outlets. She is using her loan to increase her stock. She is hardworking and innovative.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Tarangire Group

texts.en:
Hamida T., age 47, is a widow and has four children. She has sold bites (bread-like rolls) and fabrics since 1990 and is able to able to earn a monthly profit of around 280,000 Tanzanian shillings or $210 USD.

This will be Hamida’s first Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. Hamida hopes to obtain the loan to increase her business.
	
Hamida will share this loan with her loan group, which totals seven members. In the photo, Hamida is on the left in the white shirt.

loans.use: To increase her fabric business

loans.name: Aliyu Badaru Nola Group

texts.en:
B. Nola is the representative of this group. She is forty years old and married with seven children of whom four are going to school. More so, she is looking after four siblings who are schooling too.

Nola owns a grocery shop which she has been operating for over four years. Due to her small amount of capital, she is using the loan to improve her business by buying more grocery items such as cassava flour, groundnuts (peanuts), beans, etc., to sell.

Nola is an active businesswoman whose dreams are to educate her children and to obtain a motorcycle for income generation.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Supplies to build a chicken coop

loans.name: Bolivia Group

texts.es:
La señora Graciela Es la presidenta del Banco D. Emprendimiento Bolivia cuenta con la actividad D. comerciante D. ropa americana tiene su puesto fijo en la zona 16 D. julio, ella vive en la zona D. villa Adela casa en alquiler, tiene tres hijos su esposo comercia tambien con ropa americana viajando a distintos  pueblos, la señora es muy responsable , trabajadora y con ganas D. superación.

El señor Saturnino desempeña el rol D. tesorero, el cuenta con la actividad D. venta D. celulares, DVD, accesorios D. celulares tiene su puesto fijo en la AV, Panamericana a unas cuadras D. la multifuncional, su participación en el Banco D. Emprendimiento es por la invitación D. sus vecinos ya que el grupo es D. la misma zona, el vive en casa familiar.

El Reynaldo es secretario del Banco D. Emprendimiento  Bolivia con casa familiar D. sus suegros en la zona D. villa Adela su negocio del rubro D. comercio tienda D. barrio en la misma casa y al mismo tiempo propetario D. un coche caldina, el grupo al cual representan son personas muy comprometidas, responsables y puntuales ellos trabajan en zona las recuperaciones se realiza en la casa D. la señora Lourdes.
texts.en:
Graciela Es is the president of the communal bank "Banco D. Emprendimiento Bolivia." She sells American clothing from a fixed stand in the area of "16 D. Julio" Street. She lives in a rented home in the Villa Adela neighborhood. She has 3 children, and her husband also sells American clothing, traveling to various towns. Graciela is very responsible and hardworking and has a strong desire to succeed. Saturnino fulfills the role of treasurer. He sells cellular phones, DVDs, and cellular accessories from a stand on the Panamericana Avenue, a few blocks from the Multifunctional Sports Center. He was invited to join the communal bank by his neighbors, since the group members are all located in the same area. He lives in his family home. Reynaldo is the secretary of the bank. He lives in the family home of his in-laws in the Villa Adela neighborhood. He also works in traD. with a neighborhood store in the same family home. He is also the owner of a Toyota Caldina. The group who they represent is maD. up of persons who are very committed, responsible and punctual in the repayments that they make in the house of Señora Lourdes.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard W. W. is 26 years old, single and has no children. His business is located at Juja in Thika, where he transports people from one place to another. He has been in this business for two years and his major challenge is too many competitors in the same kind of business. However, he is determined to increase his business and take the lead in the market. He is using this loan to purchase an engine to fix his motorcycle for better performance. He is a hardworking and innovative man.

loans.use: motorcycle engine

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: La Sra. Victoria es una cliente antigua  de nuestra agencia, ha demostrado ser una buena cliente, de manera responsable y con buena actitud, ha cuplido con sus obligaciones. Su esposo es chofer propietario de un radio taxi actualmente sigue en esta actividad en la empresa splendid. La sra. Victoria destina todo su tiempo a la venta de su mercaderia, ella vende en la feria 16 de julio y tambien esta en la ciudad de la paz frente al nuevo mercado lanza en la calle figueroa. Junto a sus hijos la señora se sacrifica para lograr tener con el tiempo su propia casa, ya que por el momento viven el la casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
Ms. Victoria has been a client of our organization for a long time. She has demonstrated herself to be a good client. With a responsible manner and a good attitude, she has complied with her obligations. Her husband is the owner and driver of a radio taxi. He currently follows this activity in La Empresa Splendid (The Splendid Business). Ms. Victoria spends all of her time selling her merchandise. She sells in the feria 16 de julio (July 16 Fair) and also is in the city La Paz, in front of Nuevo Mercado Lanza (New Pole Market) on Figueroa Street. With her children, Ms. Victoria sacrifices in order to have her own house in time, as for the moment, they live in her parents house.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRA DE MERCADERIA

loans.name: Felipa
