texts.es: Doña Felipa es una cliente antigua que esta retornando desde el año 2005, trabajando sola con individuales y oportunos tiene un historial impecable con cero dias de mora y desde el año en que descanso hasta la fecha se pudo constatar el crecimiento que tuvo el negocio de carpinteria que tiene la señora y su esposo Fermin, el negocio tiene contrato con la Caja petrolera y es precisamente para este que necesita el dinero, pues necesita comprar  material (accesorios de muebles) y asi terminar los muebles y proceder a la entrega de 18 escritoios y 3 mesas de reuniones  segun el pedido de la institucion.
texts.en:
Felipa is an old client who has been returning for loans since 2005 and has an impeccable history always paying her loans back on time. The carpentry business that she has with her husband Fermin has been growing every year. Their business has a contract with the petroleum company and this is why they need the loan. They will use it to purchase materials to finish 18 desks and three meeting tables according to the company's order.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to make furniture

loans.name: Las Cenzontles Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cenzontle está integrado por tres mujeres ellas son Paula R., María Félix H. y María G..  El lema de estas formidables féminas es seguir adelante y progresar.

R. se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de manera ambulante enfrentando el arduo sol de la mañana y los peligros que asechan a la ciudad. De la misma manera trabaja María G. quien comercializa cosméticos por catalogo.

Mientras H. trabaja realizando y vendiendo cajetas, cosa de horno y pozol en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
The Cenzontle is made up of three women: Paula R., María Félix H., and María G.. The motto of this formidable females is to keep moving forward and progressing. R. works selling makeup door-to-door in the arduous sun and the dangers that exist in the city. María G. does the similar work selling makeup through catalogues. Meanwhile, H. works making and selling candies, baked goods, and pozole (a traditional stew/soup).

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Moussa M. est un jeune homme âgé de 29 ans qui habite dans le quartier de Layenne dans la localité de Yoff. Il est marie et père de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 2 et 4 ans. Il est membre de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC Yoff depuis octobre 2009 et n’a jamais bénéficie  de prêt. Il évolue  depuis 2003 dans le secteur de la couture et.ses services sont destines aux enfants, aux hommes et aux femmes.Il a choisi le métier de tailleur par passion et a commence par être  apprenti-tailleur. Ce qui le passionne le plus dans son activité c’est le fait de confectionner de beaux habits. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs pour élargir son salon de couture et installer des accessoires pour rendre plus confortable l’accueil des clients. Il envisage aussi d’acheter une nouvelle machine pour rendre plus compétitive son activité, accroitre ses bénéfices  et mieux assister sa petite famille et ses parents.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié.
texts.en:
Mr Moussa M. is a young man aged 29, who lives in the neighborhood of Layenne in the town of Yoff. He is married and the father of two children, aged 2 and 4. He became a member of the Yoff branch of the microfinance institution U-IMCEC in October 2009 and had never got a loan. Since 2003 he operates in the dressmaking business and provides his services to children, men and women. He chose to become a tailor because he had a passion for dressmaking, and began as an apprentice tailor. His greatest passion in his business is creating beautiful dresses.

He applies for a loan of 300,000 CFA francs to expand his salon and install accessories to make his store more comfortable for his customers. He wants also to buy a new sewing machine to become more competitive, increase his profit and better provide for his small family and his parents.

Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC – with the positive support of lenders – succeeds in supporting people in revenue-generating activities which promote valuable socioeconomic development.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in his dressmaking salon

loans.name: Claudina

texts.es:
La señora Claudina H. O. tiene 39 años está casada con el señor Florencio Herrera por más de 10 años, tienen 3 hijos de (10, 8, y 4) años son una familia de escasos recursos económicos. La señora Claudina se dedica a la producción de la leche cruda, actualmente cuenta solamente con 4 cabezas de ganado lechero, cuyo producto entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de diferentes productos lácteos, el esposo se dedica a la construcción (Albañil), trabaja en la misma zona donde vive.

La señora Claudina vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la comunidad de playa ancha, tienen una pequeña casa en la cual solo hay 2 habitaciones,  doña Claudina hace todo lo posible para que sus tres hijos estén cómodos en la casa.

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de una cabeza de ganado lechero con lo cual incrementara la producción de leche, de esta manera aumentara el nivel de ingresos y mejorara el nivel de vida de ella y de su familia, ya que uno de los sueños de la señora Claudina es aumentar la cantidad de cabezas de ganado lechero y con ello la producción. Entre sus sueños y metas también es realizar una ampliación y construcción de su casa, que tenga por lo menos una habitación para cada uno de sus hijos, y que los tres hijos estudien una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Mrs. Claudina H. O. is 39 years old and has been married to Florencio Herrera for more than ten years. They have three children (10, 8, and 4) and are a family of limited financial resources. Claudina works in milk production. Currently she has four dairy cows whose milk she sells to company that makes different dairy products. Her husband works in construction as a mason and works in the same area as where they live. Claudina lives in the city of Cochabamba in the community of Playa Ancha. She has a small two-room house, and she does her best to make her three children comfortable in the house. The loan will be used to purchase a dairy cow which will increase the milk her cows produce. Growing her dairy cow herd is one of Claudina's dreams, and it will help her improve her family's quality of life. She also dreams of being able to build an addition to her house, so that her children can each have their own room. She also helps all three will become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is thirty-six years old, is single, and has no child. She lives alone in a rented apartment in a commercially dominated community. She is a hardworking young woman.

Comfort is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey (fermented corn and cassava dough, wrapped in corn or banana leaves). She hawks to sell (goes door-to-door) and also sells by the roadside in her community.

Comfort procures bags of maize (corn) and other ingredients from nearby communities. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure maize in bulk.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is the thirty-five-year-old married mother of two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercially dominated community. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family.

Sabina is a trader, trading in printed textiles. She hawks to sell in her community (goes door-to-door) and also treks to nearby towns to sell. She procures bales of printed cloth from Accra. She has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to procure textiles in bulk.

loans.use: To buy printed fabrics in bulk

loans.name: Josefina Irene

texts.es: La señora Josefina es una cliente antigua que trabajo sus ultimas secuencias con el banco  Trebol de Achumani, El banco estaba con muchos dias de mora por problemas internos del grupo, la señora Josefina fue quien asumio la deuda  pagando el saldo que restaba perdiendo sus ahorros.                                                                                                  La señora vive con una hija pequeña pero tambien cuida a sus nietos por las tardes, segun el asesor de bancos la señora Josefina era una de las mas responsables en el gupo y es por eso que se atendio a la señora ya que necesita este credito para comprar mercaderia para su tienda, ella compra en la ciudad de Oruro los Dvd s y los fardos de peluches, tambien se abastecera de material escolar para el mes de Enero, ya que estas fechas empiezan las clases en las escuelas y colegios de nuestro Paiz
texts.en:
Mrs. Josefina is an old client who previously worked with the Trebol de Achumani Bank. The bank was many days behind in their payments because of internal problems with the group. Mrs. Josefina assumed the debt and paid the rest off with her savings. She lives with her small daughter but she also takes care of her grandchildren during the afternoon. According to the bank assesor Josefina was one of the most responsible members of the group and because of this he accepted the application. She needs the loan to purchase merchandise for her store. She buys her supplies in the city of Oruro. With the loan she will buy DVDs, stuffed animals, toys, and school supplies for the month of January because that is when school begins in our country.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of goods

loans.name: Rosa Blanca Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rosa Blanca está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras que desde muy jóvenes les a tocado ganarse el pan de cada día. Ellas son  Mercedes G. quien destaza cerdo, María S. tiene una repostería y Meylin A. vende pan.

Estas señoras tienen fe en que este año nuevo será mejor y que pondrá todo de su parte para que sus negocios prosperen.
texts.en:
The White Rose group is made up of three hard-working women who have had to earn a living since a very young age. They are: Mercedes G., who butchers pigs, María S., who runs a bakery, and Meylin A. who sells bread. These women believe that this new year will be better than the last and they will put all their efforts into assuring that their businesses prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pigs

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is thirty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to two children who are both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercially dominated community.

Grace is a hardworking young woman. She is a food vendor who prepares and sells rice with stew which she sells on a table by the roadside in the mornings.

Grace procures bags of rice and other ingredients from nearby towns. She has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to procure rice and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice in bulk

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en: Emilia is thirty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to four children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercially dominated community. Emilia is a hard working young woman. She works hard to support her husband. She trades in soft drinks, selling them in her community. She procures crates of drinks from nearby towns. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure drinks in bulk.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El señor Mario es un cliente nuevo que vive en la zona Rosales, el cliente llego por consejo de vecinos de la zona, Actualmente el señor Mario vive con su esposa  y dos hijos, la mayor ya se mantiene sola y solo llega a dormir. La señora Benita, esposa de don Mario trabaja como empleada del hogar en obrajes y juntos ayudan con sus gastos al hijo mayor que tiene una beca de estudio en la carrera de medicina en el Paiz de Venezuela.                                                                                                                            La familia aparte del trabajo que tienen tambien tienen un negocio de crianza de perros de raza Labrador y Coquer, este negocio les ayuda a salir de apuros ya que un cachorro esta cotizado entre 300 a 350 dolares.El Sr. Mario solicita este credito porqe necesita comprar una computadora para ayudar a su hijo con sus estudios y estar al tanto de su salud, asi como tambien estar en contacto con clientes que el hijo contacto en el pais vecino.
texts.en:
Mario is a new client who lives in the zone of Rosales. He joined us through a recommendation from his neighbors. Currently, Mario lives with his wife and two children, the oldest of whom takes care of herself and only comes home to sleep. Mario's wife, Benita, works as a housekeeper, and together they help with their son's expenses, who has a scholarship for medical school in the country of Venezuela. Aside from this job, they also have a business in which they raise labradors and cocker spaniels. This business helps them get through hardships, since a puppy costs between 300 and 350 dollars. Mario is requesting this credit because he needs to purchase a computer to help his son with his studies and keep after his health, as well as staying in contact with his son's clients in the neighboring country.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a computer

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a forty-seven year old married mother of one child who is in school. She lives with her husband and son in a rented apartment in a commercially dominated community. Margaret works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells porridge from a table top by the roadside in her community. Margaret procures her goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for over thirteen years and wants a loan to procure maize and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy maize.

loans.name: María Elsa

texts.es:
La señora María Elsa S. de 48 años empezó a trabajar siendo muy joven junto con su madre la cual le enseño darle esa sazón que hace la diferencia entre una comida y otra. Ella poco a poco le tomo amor y aprecio al arte culinario ya que le encanta hacer una comida gustosa y el hecho de que sus clientes estén satisfechos la hace sentir feliz.

S. invertirá el crédito en la compra de ingredientes como granos básicos, carne, verduras, frutas y legumbres para realizar exquisitos platillos.
texts.en:
María Elsa S. is 48 years old. She started working with her mother when she was very young. It’s from her that she learned special techniques to flavor food the right way. Little by little she learned to love the art of cooking as she loves to make tasty food and please her customers. S. will invest this loan in the purchase of ingredients such as basic grain, meat, vegetables, fruit and legumes to make delicious dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grain, meat, vegetables, fruit and legumes

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is thirty years old. She is divorced and has one child who attends school. She lives with her daughter in a rented apartment in a community where the major occupation is trading. Dorcas works hard to be able to provide for her daughter. She is a trader. Dorcas runs a provisions store by the roadside in the community. She procures her goods from Accra. Dorcas has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy provisions in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy provisions.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa is sixty years old. She is a widowed woman and has given birth to six children. All of her children are out of school. She lives with some of her children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. Adwoa is a trader. She trades in cereals - maize. She procures bags of maize from nearby communities and supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. She also treks to other towns to supply. Adwoa trades in firewood as well. She has been in business for over thirty years and wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy maize.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is thirty-seven years old. She is married and has five children who attend school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a community where the major occupation is trading. Rebecca works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Rebecca runs a provisions store by the roadside in the community. She procures her goods from Accra. She has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to buy provisions in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy provisions.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is thirty-seven years old. She is a married woman who has given birth to five children. All of her children are in school. Grace lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. 

Grace sells pastries. She prepares the pastries and supplies them to retailers in her community. Grace buys bags of flour from nearby communities. She has been in business for over twelve years and wants a loan to buy more flour, and other ingredients, in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is thirty years old. She is married and has given birth to two children. Both of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. 

Grace sells plantains (cooking bananas) and porridge. She buys the plantains from nearby farming communities and supplies them to food vendors and retailers in her community. She also treks to other towns to sell to suppliers. She has been in business for five years and wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy plantains to sell

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is an entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. She sells clothing in a local market called “Yubileinyi.” Nadezhda offers assorted clothing items of different sizes and styles. She has her own loyal clientele. Nadezhda has been in this business for 5 years. Presently, she has 50,000 Grivnyas of working capital. 

Nadezhda loves working in this sphere of commerce because it brings her a stable income and helps her to meet people’s needs. She would like to continue expanding her venture. This time, Nadezhda is requesting a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to increase her turnover capital, which she believes will help her be successful in maintaining continued growth in this business.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is forty years old. He is married and has three children. All of his children attend school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment. The majority of the people in their community are traders (they sell things). 

Frank sells ready-made clothes, such as jeans and t-shirt, for both genders. He buys goods from the capital city and sells the in a kiosk by the roadside in his community. He also treks to other places to sell. Frank has been selling clothes for four years. He wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy ready-made clothes to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a thirty-year-old married mother of three children who are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. Elizabeth works hard to help her husband to provide for their family. 

Elizabeth prepares and sells porridge on a table top by the roadside in her community. She buys her goods from nearby communities. Elizabeth has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy maize and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana sells women's footwear in a small market called “Borodinskyi” in her home town of Zaporozhye. Oksana has been in this business for 7 years. Now, she has about 170,000 Grivnyas of working capital.  

Oksana is requesting a 12,000 Grivnya loan to diversify the assorted merchandise that she offers for sale in her kiosks. She loves working with this type of merchandise and always tries to stock her vending locations with the latest trends in high quality shoes and boots. Oksana has a perfect credit history as a borrower. She has repaid all her previous loans without any delinquencies.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Zuela

texts.en:
Zuela is forty-one years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. 

Zuela sells rice. She buys bags of rice from Accra and supplies it to food vendors and retailers in her community. She also treks to other towns to sell to suppliers. Zuela also deals in textiles, especially lace. She has been in business for twelve years and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is an entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. She owns a small business in “Osipenkovskyi,” a local market, where she sells items such as purses, wallets and gloves. Tatyana is an experienced market vendor. She started her business 5 years ago. Currently, she has 60,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. 

Tatyana is a high-achiever. She is seeking stability in life and wants to achieve success in her business. This time, Tatyana is requesting a loan of 5,000 Grivnyas to increase her turnover capital and and increase her income as a result of better sales.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is thirty-five years old. He is a married man and the father of four children who are all in school. He lives with his family in a rented apartment in a commercial community. Raphael is a hard-working young man. He is a carpenter by profession and he is training two apprentices.

Raphael works in a shop by the roadside in his community. He has been in business for eight years and wants to buy wood and other working materials in bulk to be able to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Ada Lyla

texts.es:
Con mucha alegría, en el municipio de San Rafael la señora Ada Lyla se dedica a trabajar diariamente con el propósito de obtener los ingresos para apoyar a su hijo que actualmente está terminando de estudiar en la universidad. 
Al estar su hijo terminando sus estudios universitarios, ella solicita un crédito porque quiere apoyarlo con el pago del título y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar dicho crédito y así hacer realidad su sueño de que su hijo al que tanto ha invertido en sus estudios sea un profesional de éxito para orgullo de ella y toda su familia.
texts.en:
Ada Lyla works happily every day around the municipality of San Rafael to make a profit to help her son who’s finishing his college degree. For this reason, she would like to request for a loan to pay for his graduation fees. She came to Ceprodel to request for that loan, and therefore, make his son’s dream come true, who has invested so much in his studies to be a successful professional and make his family proud.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her son's graduation fees

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has two children who attend school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a community where the major occupation is trading. Sakina works hard to help her husband to provide for their family. 

Sabina runs a grocery store by the roadside in her community. She buys her goods from Accra. Sakina has been in business for fifteen years and wants a loan to buy groceries in bulk so she can increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora is a 35-year-old woman. She is married and has three children who are currently in school. She lives with her family at Effiduase in the Ashanti region of Ghana. 

Dora sells food, such as rice and stew. She sells at a strategic location in the community, but she has insufficient working capital to take advantage of her opportunities. She has been producing food for eight years. She works all day, but still she is unable achieve more than just to increase her output. 

Dora wants to use her loan to buy meat and rice in bulk, so she can to increase her efficiency and produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help her to expand her business and increase her income so she can help her husband to provide support for her family and their education.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetables, meat, firewood etc.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is fifty years old. She is a widowed mother of five children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. 

Vida sells maize and onions. She buys bags of maize from nearby communities and sells them to food vendors and retailers in her community. She also treks to other towns to sell. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 55-year-old woman. She is widowed and has two children who are currently in school. She lives with her family in Effiduase in the Ashanti region of Ghana. 

Janet serves food, such as rice and stew. She also sells used clothing in bulk. She buys the used clothing at the Kumasi Central Market. However, she would like to buy from “Foss line,” a place where they sell used goods in larger quantities than in the Kumasi Market. She has been in business for six years. 

Janet is requesting a loan to buy goods in bulk for both her food and used clothing businesses. She hopes to pay back the loan in time.

loans.use: To buy rice, vegetables, meat, firewood, etc. and used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 39-year-old trader. She is married and has two children who are in school. She is a very resourceful woman whose hard work brings livelihood to the family. 

Janet supports her family by selling used clothing and by farming. Used clothing has a very big market share in Ghana, because brand new clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor. Janet has been in this business for the past two years. She travels to the nearby city of Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory. She believes this loan will help her to get a good return on her business investment, and thereby, increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Independence I Group

texts.en:
A. is a fifty-five year old married mother of three children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. 

A. prepares and sells porridge. She is the leader of a trust bank group called Independence I. The members of the group are mainly traders. They are hardworking, trust themselves, and want the loan to invest in their businesses. A., the group leader, is seated in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Aida Luz

texts.es:
La señora Aida Luz G. se ha destacado en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur por ser una vendedora de cosa de horno que consiste en productos comestibles derivados del maíz y que son ofertados por ella misma en las calles del municipio todos los días.

También ella se ha dedicado a vender verduras con el fin de obtener mejores ingresos para mantener su hogar compuesto por sus dos hijos en edades escolares ya que ella es madre soltera. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de algunas verduras ya que ahorita no cuenta con ellas y también para continuar con la venta de cosa de horno derivadas del maíz. Por este motivo  espera que Ceprodel le brinde el crédito para continuar con su venta en su municipio.
texts.en:
Aida Luz G. has been recognized in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur for being an excellent sales woman of oven based products, such as corn derivatives, that she offers all around town every day. She also sells vegetables to increase her sales. With the earnings, she has managed to support her two children who go to school, as she’s a single mom. This loan will be used to buy vegetables to restock her business and to continue selling corn based products. For this reason, Ceprodel is granting her this loan to continue selling around town.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables and make corn based products

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married. She lives in Zaporozhye. Victoria sells men’s outerwear in the “Yubileinyi” local marketplace. She offers a nice selection of men’s clothing at affordable prices. Victoria has many years of experience working in this sphere of trade and is very friendly to customers, which has helped her gain loyal clients. 

Victoria has been in this business for 9 years. Presently, she has about 80,000 Grivnyas in inventory. This time, Victoria is requesting a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional stylish inventory to sell in her kiosks. Victoria has never had any problems with loan repayment. She can be characterized as a stable and trustworthy borrower.

loans.use: To purchase additional stylish inventory to sell in her kiosks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bulk supply of yam, vegetable oil, vegetables, charcoal and fish etc.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is an entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. She runs a small business selling plastic dishware in “Yubileinyi,” one of the local markets. Valentina sells a variety of assorted merchandise and has her own loyal clientele. She has been working in this market niche for 7 years. Currently, she has about 20,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. 

Valentina is seeking a 12,000 Grivnya loan to increase her turnover capital. She is hoping to expand her business and open additional vending locations in the future. Valentina likes working with disposable items and believes this business will continue bringing her stable income.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Independece Group Ii

texts.en:
Maame is thirty years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. 

Maame prepares and sells kenkey (corn dumplings steamed in banana leaves) with fried fish. She is the leader the Independence II trust bank. The members of the group are mainly traders. They are hard-working, trust themselves, and want the loans to invest in their businesses. 

Maame, the group leader, is seated in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa, as she is popularly called by her numerous customers, is a 38-year-old local restaurant operator. She is divorced and blessed with two children who are in school. She provides for the children through the proceeds from her business. In her restaurant, she prepares and sells local food like "fufu" and has been in business for two years now. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, and taken with all kinds of soup. Yaa says that the prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to meet her production expenditures. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials, like bags of baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios, pertenecen al banco comunal “La Amistad” y viven en la ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Los socios se reúnen cada 30 días en la oficina central de la Asociación Arariwa. En el video se ve que la junta directiva esta verificando que la documentación de los socios este correcta.      

Nuestras socias alternan sus diversas actividades del hogar con la venta de boletos de pasajes, comestibles, llantas de autos y comida. Otros socios se dedican a brindar servicios como transportes y llamadas a celulares.     
La socia Fanny tiene 34 años y tiene que madrugar para atender a sus dos hijos y preparar desayuno de quinua para los transeúntes que se van a trabajar. La socia saca adelante a su familia pues no cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja, ella se dedica a la venta de desayuno en una esquina desde las 5 de mañana hasta la 1pm.  Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como leche y quinua. 

Los socios requieren el préstamo para comprar más productos como comestibles, llantas, etc., así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mayores ingresos y darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

(Los socios Marlene y Juan pidieron permiso a la junta directiva por motivos de salud y no aparecen en el video)
texts.en:
Our members belong to the La Amistad Communal Bank. They live in the city of Cusco in the Cusco department. The members meet every 30 days in the Arariwa Association’s central office. In the video the governing board is verifying that the members’ documentation is correct. Our members alternate their activities between the home and selling tickets for trips, food, tires for cars, and meals. Other members offer transportation services and cell phone calling services. Fanny, 34, has to get up at dawn to take care of her two children and prepare a quinoa breakfast for the people passing by on their way to work. The member gets her family ahead. She does not have the support of her life partner. She sells breakfast on a corner from five in the morning until one in the afternoon. She has been in this business for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business. The member needs the loan to buy more supplies like milk and quinoa. The members need the loan to buy more products like food and tires, etc. That way they will be able to increase their business capital and have greater earnings. Then they will give their children a better quality of life. The members are grateful for and value the loan given through this medium. They promise to make their payments on time. (The members Marlene and Juan asked the governing board for permission to not appear in the video for health reasons.)

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more products like food and tires, etc.

loans.name: Liahona Group

texts.en: Kingsley is a 47-year-old man. He is married and has three children. All of his children are in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a commercially-dominated community. Kingsley is a trader. He runs a cold store where he sells fish. He is the leader of a trust bank group called Liahona. The members of the group are mainly traders. They are hard working, trust themselves and want the loan to invest in their businesses. Kingsley, the group leader, is seated in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy more stock for his store

loans.name: Georgina Olimpia

texts.es:
Como toda madre responsable, la señora Georgina C. se ha dedicado arduamente a trabajar para llevar el sustento a su familia y así beneficiar a sus hijos con sus estudios y con un techo digno donde habitar.
Se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y ha tomado la decisión de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción porque así lo requiere. Ella espera muy confiadamente que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta manera lograra mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda ampliándola para llegar a tener un techo digno donde vivir en conjunto con sus hijos.
texts.en:
As any responsible mother, C. has devoted her life to working to support her family and provide her children with an education and a roof over their heads. She has excelled as a working woman and is determined to improve her living conditions. For this reason, she came to Ceprodel to request for a loan to purchase construction materials that she needs. She is confident she will receive this loan, and therefore, be able to expand her house and have a better home for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Daniel Group

texts.en: Eric is a 39-year-old man. He is married and has two children. Both of his children are in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a mostly commercial community. Eric is a poultry farmer. He is the leader of a trust bank group called Daniel. The members of the group are mainly traders. They are hard working, trust themselves and want the loan to invest in their businesses. Eric, the group leader is seated in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy more poultry

loans.name: Jairo Uriel

texts.es:
El señor Jairo C. se dedica a la venta de granos de trigo en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur habiéndose dedicado a esta actividad desde hace 25 años pero actualmente no cuenta con dichos granos de trigo porque requiere hacer una inversión en esta actividad por medio de la recolecta de la cosecha del trigo.
Es importante destacar que él es casado y con cuatro hijos a los que debe de mantener y llevar el sustento a su hogar para que estos se desarrollen y puedan continuar estudiando ya que todos están en edades escolares. Con el crédito logrará mejorar las condiciones del almacenamiento del grano del trigo y así esperar para venderlo por lo que espera que su crédito sea otorgado y así llevar a cabo dicha actividad.
texts.en:
Jairo C. sells wheat grains around the municipality of San Rafael del Sur. He's being doing this job for 25 years, but right now he doesn’t have any grains because he wants to make an investment in this activity through the wheat harvesting process. It is important to mention that he’s married and has four children that he has to support and also cover household expenses, so they can continue to study good living conditions. With this loan, he will be able to make improvements in his wheat grain storage facility, so he can wait to sell his products. He hopes to do that with his loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in wheat harvesting

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is 40 years old. She is married and the mother of four children. All her children are currently in school. She is very humble and committed to her work and the family's needs, because she believes the children are her only asset. Yaa sells smoked fish in bulk at the community market where she lives, and has years of experience in the fish-selling trade. She takes stock of goods from Yeji, in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana, and then retails the goods to her customers. Yaa travels very far to buy the dried fish, and she says this prevents her from traveling frequently. She requests the loan to buy increased stock to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of smoked fish.

loans.name: Modesta Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Yolanda es casada, tiene 47 y 4 hijos, Yolanda vende zapatos y zapatillas, sus ventas los realiza a pedido en diferentes lugares y son al crédito su cobranza los realiza diariamente, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Yolanda necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatos.
Yolanda sueña que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una tienda de zapatos.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Triumph Communal Bank. Yolanda is married, 47 years old and has 4 children.Yolanda sells shoes and slippers. She takes credit orders for her sales in different places and collects payments daily. She acquires her products in the city of Lima. Yolanda needs a loan of 1600 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of shoes. Yolanda hopes that her children will become professionals and that she will have a shoe store someday.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale

loans.name: Nkabom Group

texts.en: Abena is a 30-year-old married mother of seven children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercially-dominated community. Abena is a food vendor. She prepares and sells 'kenkey', a traditional staple food made with corn and cassava. Abena is the leader of a trust bank group called 'Nkabom', literally meaning unity. The members of the group are mainly traders. They are hard working, trust themselves and want the loan to invest into their businesses. Abena, the group leader is seated in the middle in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Carla Carolina

texts.es:
Carla es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Carla es soltera, tiene 22 años y vive con sus padres, estudia Industrias Alimentarias, Carla vende harina de cereales que procesa en su casa, cuenta con un molino, los cereales los compra de personas que le llevan a su casa, y sus productos los comercializa en tiendas a través de pedidos.
Carla necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Los sueños de Carla son tener una empresa grande, terminar su carrera y obtener su titulo.
texts.en:
Carla is a member of the Triumph Communal Bank. Carla is single, 22 years old and lives with her parents. She is studying Food service. Carla sells cereal flours that she processes in her house. She relies on a mill, purchasing the cereals from people that carry it to her house and marketing her products to stores that place orders. Carla needs a loan of 1400 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of cereals. The dreams of Carla are to have a large business, to finish her career studies and to obtain her degree.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals to grind into flour.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
El señor José Manuel G. es un caballero que del municipio de San Rafael del Sur y que se ha preocupado por el mejoramiento del nivel de vida de su amada familia compuesta por su cónyuge y sus tres hijos.
Se ha destacado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas de superar en su familia. Actualmente ha decidido brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a ellos y para ello ha iniciado a comprar los enseres necesarios para el hogar y esta vez comprará electrodomésticos para el hogar y por este motivo solicita el crédito en Ceprodel para obtener dichos electrodomésticos y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su amada familia.
texts.en:
Señor José Manuel G. is a gentleman of the municipality of San Rafael del Sur who is concerned about the improvement of the standard of living of his beloved family, composed of his spouse and his three children. He is known for being a very hard-working person with many aspirations for his family. At present he is determined to offer them better living conditions and for this he has begun to buy some necessary household goods for the home. At this time he would like to buy electrical appliances for the home and for that reason he requests a loan from Ceprodel to obtain said electric appliances and thus to improve the living conditions of his beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electrical appliances for the home

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou H. est une yoffoise de 46 ans qui habite dans le quartier de Ngaparou. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 10et 25 ans. C’est une nouvelle adhérente de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC a Yoff.
Les revenus  de son mari ne sont pas suffisants pour prendre en charge l’intégralité des  charges  de la famille. C’est ce qui l’a motive a exercer une activité lucrative génératrice de revenus pour ainsi pouvoir  assurer une partie des dépenses. Et c’est l’aspect lucratif qui l’intéresse le plus dans son activité.Par conséquent elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs  destine a l’achat de chaussures d’hommes et de femmes en cuir, ceci dans le but de diversifier  ses marchandises et d’accroitre son stock. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices lui permet même de prendre en charge  la scolarité de son enfant.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  a exercer des  activités 
 lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié.
texts.en:
Mrs Fatou H., aged 46, lives in the neighborhood of Ngaparou in the town of Yoff. She is married and the mother of five children, aged 10 to 25. She is a recent member of the microfinance institution U-IMCEC in Yoff. Her husband's income is insufficient to provide for all the needs of his family. This led Fatou to get a lucrative activity which enabled her to pay for part of the family expenses. It is precisely the earned profit which motivates her most in her business.

Therefore Fatou applies for a loan of 100,000 CFA francs to buy leather shoes for men and women, so that she can diversify her inventory and stock up. The additional profit will even enable her to pay for the school fees of her child.

Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC – with the positive support of lenders – succeeds in supporting people in revenue-generating activities which promote valuable socioeconomic development.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 45 years old. She is married and the mother of six kids. Currently three are in school. Cecilia is very resourceful in providing food and paying the bills for her family. She is a food vendor and sells kenkey and pepper sauce with fried fish. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers, since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Maria es soltera, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Maria tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, artículos de librería, además vende cosméticos por catálogos, y en época escolar vende útiles escolares en el mercado.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, cerveza y cosméticos.
Los sueños de Maria son hacer crecer su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Triunfo (Triumph) community bank. Maria is single. She is 38 years old and has 2 children. Maria has a store in her house where she sells general groceries and stationery items; in addition, she sells cosmetics through catalogs, and during the school season, she sells school supplies in the market.

Maria needs a loan of 1200 PEN, which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, beer, and cosmetics. Maria's dreams are to increase her business and offer a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, beer, and cosmetics

loans.name: Jose Marcial

texts.es:
El señor José A. es casado y con tres hijos a los que debe mantener y  proporcionarles excelentes condiciones de vida ya que ellos están en edades escolares y necesitan una vivienda en perfectas condiciones para que se desarrollen.

Se ha caracterizado por ser un caballero muy trabajador y ha tomado la decisión de invertir en el mejoramiento de su vivienda y para ello solicita un crédito en Ceprodel con el fin de obtener los materiales de construcción y de esta manera brindarle a sus hijos un techo digno donde habitar y vivir en familia juntos en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Señor José A. is married and has three children whom he must support and whom he must furnish with excellent living conditions since they are of school age and need a dwelling in faultless condition so that they may develop.

He has characterized himself as a very hardworking gentleman and has made the decision to invest in the improvement of his housing. For that, he is soliciting a loan from CEPRODEL with the aim of obtaining the construction materials and in this way offering his children a decent roof over their heads and a home where they can live together as a family.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction material

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Reyna es casada, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos, Reyna tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días, además junto a su esposo tienen una imprenta en un local alquilado.
Reyna necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, azúcar, arroz.
Los sueños de Reyna son tener una imprenta mas grande y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Reyna is a member of the Triunfo (Triumph) community bank. She is married, is 32 years old, and has 3 children. Reyna has a store in her home where she sells general groceries, an activity that she carries out every day. In addition, she and her husband have a printing shop in a rented space.

Reyna needs a loan of 2000 PEN, which will be invested in the purchase of milk, sugar, and rice.

Reyna's dreams are to have a bigger printing shop and for her children to have careers.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy milk, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur, el señor Juan G. se ha destacado por ser muy trabajador ya que ha logrado llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación compuesta por su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en edades escolares. Se ha dedicado al negocio de la venta de ropa el cual es comercializada por él mismo pero la situación que atraviesa es que actualmente no posee la mercadería para ofrecerla en estos momentos.
El señor Juan G. ha logrado salir adelante poco a poco gracias a sus esfuerzos y ha mejorado las condiciones de vida de su familia. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de la ropa ya que no cuenta con ella y al adquirirla lo hará con la finalidad de continuar en esta actividad y así mejorar circunstancialmente su negocio.
texts.en:
In the municipality of San Rafael del Sur, Señor Juan G. is known for being a very hard worker since he has managed to make a living for his household, composed of his spouse and his two school-age children. He has been dedicated to the business of clothing sales which he has marketed by himself, but the situation that he is presented with at present is that he does not possess the merchandise to offer. Señor Juan Garcia has managed to do well little by little, thanks to his efforts, and he has improved the living conditions of his family. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of the clothes, since he does not have sufficient merchandise. On acquiring the clothes he will be able to continue in this activity and thus to improve the circumstances of his business.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Bo Woho Mmoden Group

texts.en:
Margaret is 65 years old. She is divorced and a mother with three children. All of her children are now independent, but she occasionally takes care of her grandchildren when her children are on vacation. She operates a drinking spot where she sells all kinds of soft drinks such as canned malts, and canned and bottled drinks like Coke, Pepsi etc. She is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to provide for her business. She has been running the drinking spot for five years now, and she needs the loan to buy assorted drinks to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

Margaret is the leader of a trust bank group called 'Bo Woho Mmoden' which literary means 'strive in life'. She is the one standing second from the left in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders and food sellers, respectively. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral to access the loan and provide peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy assorted drinks like Coke, Pepsi and canned drinks to upgrade her inventory.

loans.name: Laura Consuelo

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur, la señora Laura G. se ha destacado por ser una dama muy trabajadora que ha logrado salir adelante gracias a sus múltiples esfuerzos por mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. Ella es casada y tiene dos hijos en edades escolares a los que debe de mantener y brindarle las perfectas condiciones para que estos se desarrollen y así mejoren su nivel de vida.

El crédito solicitado lo utilizará en la compra de cemento, cuartones, hierro y zinc para realizar un anexo a su vivienda ya que así lo requiere porque por medio de esto mejorará las condiciones de vida de sus pequeños hijos a los que tanto ama.
texts.en:
In the municipality of San Rafael del Sur, Laura Garcia is noted for being a very hardworking woman who has managed to get ahead, thanks to her many efforts to improve her housing conditions. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. She must support them and provide the perfect conditions they need to develop so that they can improve their standard of living. This loan will be used to buy cement, lumber, iron and corrugated metal sheeting in order to build an extension to their house which they need because it will improve the living conditions of their small children, who they love so much.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cement, lumber, iron and corrugated metal sheeting

loans.name: Ofelia Diamantina

texts.es:
Ofelia G. es una dama muy trabajadora que vive en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur donde vende verduras a sus clientes pero hoy atraviesa la necesidad de no tener dichas verduras pero busca la manera de cómo obtenerlas para así comercializarlas en su localidad.

Es por esta razón que solicita un crédito con el propósito de obtener las verduras para comercializarlas y de esta manera obtener los ingresos para llevarlos a su casa de habitación y así mantener a sus dos hijos ya que ella es madre soltera y necesita el apoyo con el crédito.
texts.en:
Ofelia G. is a very hard-working lady that lives in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur, where she sells vegetables to her clients. However, today she is confronted with the need of not having said vegetables. She is searching for a way to obtain them so that she can market them in her locality. For this reason she requests a loan for the purpose of obtaining the vegetables to market them. In this manner she will obtain the income to maintain her household and her two children, since she is single mother and she needs the support of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Saye

texts.en: Ms. Saye D. lives in the town of Bambey, about 100 km from Dakar. She began selling palm oil only last year, when her husband was able to give her 10,000 XOF to launch her business. She quickly found the activity to be profitable and quite enjoys it as it gives her something to do. With the loan of 50,000 XOF, she would like to replenish her stock of palm oil. This is her first loan from UIMCEC.  Ms. D. is married, with four children between the ages of three and seven.

loans.use: Replenish her stock of palm oil

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es: Flor De Maria tiene 32 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa hace mas de 4 años que ella recorre los diferentes lugares a ofrecer sus productos. Ella inicio esta actividad cuando anteriormente se dedicaba a impartir clases como maestra en un colegio público y su salario era my bajo esto no lograba cubrir los gastos de su familia, por lo que tiene 2 hijos a su cargo y son menores de edad, por lo que al inicio no tenía mucha experiencia pero compro lo que sus clientes más le solicitaban como trajes para niños, vestidos, pantalones entre otras cosas así fue que poco a poco ella fue progresando con este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es proporcionarles una  muy buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Flor De Maria is 32 years of age. She has been dedicated to the sale of clothes for more than 4 years. She travels through different places to offer her products. When she began this activity she was giving classes as a teacher in a state school and her salary was very low and failed to cover the expenses of their family. She has 2 children in her care and they are under age. At first she did not have a lot of experience, but she purchased what her clients most requested, such as outfits for children, dresses, and pants, among other things. In this way she was able to progress with her business little by little. The financing that she requests is for the purchase of merchandise. Her wish is to provide a very good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Silvano Aquiles

texts.es:
El señor Silvano Aquiles A. como todo padre responsable se ha preocupado por el bienestar de su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos a los que debe de mantener y brindarle las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen ya que están en edades escolares y requieren excelentes condiciones de vida.
Ha decidido mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda que por mucho tiempo han estado falladas y por este motivo es que no duda en solicitar un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de los materiales de construcción. Es importante destacar que él ha sido fiel cliente de la institución y con crédito anteriores logró comprar el terreno de su casa y ahora necesita continuar con la obra de construcción para brindarle un techo digno a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Silvano Aquiles A., like all responsible fathers, has worried about the well being of his life partner and their four children. He needs to support them and provide them with the necessary conditions to develop. They are school-aged and require excellent living conditions. He has decided to improve the house’s conditions. It has been failing for a long time. That is why he has not hesitated to ask for a loan with Ceprodel to buy construction materials. It is noteworthy that he has been a loyal client of the institution. With previous loans he was able to buy the land for his house. Now he needs to continue the construction work to give his children a decent roof.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.en:
Mr. Ibrahima D. has been farming cereals and raising livestock for over thirty-five years in Bambey, a rural area about one hundred kilometers from Dakar. Farming has been a family tradition and an important part of the local culture. UIMCEC opened a branch in Bambey in July to serve the rural clientele.

With the loan of 150,000 FCFA, Mr. D. would like to purchase two male goats. After the Tabaski celebration, in which each family must sacrifice a male goat, many vendors are eager to sell off their remaining herd before returning home. Mr. D. will keep the goats until the prices have risen and he can resell them.

With the revenue from this activity, Mr. D. would like to save towards buying land for building a small house which he could rent out. Mr. D. is a widower and has one child, who is now an adult.

loans.use: To purchase two goats

loans.name: Medimafo Tease Group

texts.en:
Alice is 55 years old. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband in the Effiduase in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Alice is a trader and trades in fresh fish, a business she has done for over eighteen years now. She takes her stock of fresh fish from Kumasi and supplies it to her customers. She says she occasionally buys on credit because she does not have enough money to buy from the suppliers. She has enjoyed a good market share since she started this business. She needs the loan to buy bulk supplies of fresh fish from the market. She is requesting a loan to buy a fridge and more fish to increase her stock. This she believes would help her save much to support her home.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called 'Medimafo Tease' which literally means 'my redeemer lives'. She is the one standing in the middle of the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders and food sellers, respectively. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral to access the loan and provide peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish in bulk to sell

loans.name: Anigye Group

texts.en:
Christiana, a 41-year-old trader, is married and the mother of three children. All her children are in school. She is a very resourceful wife and mother. She supports her children through the sale of used shoes (second-hand shoes). Selling of used shoes is a very big market in Ghana as brand new cloths are very expensive for the economically active poor. In addition, second hand shoes are seen as being of higher quality and more durable than the store shoes. Therefore selling used shoes has created a market for many Ghanaian women like Christiana. She takes stock of her goods from the nearby city center called Kumasi and she started her business two years ago. She wants to use the loan to buy more shoes to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her to save more for her children’s education and to rent a store for her business.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Anigye’ which literally means joy. She is the one standing in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders and foods vendors. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy used shoes in bulk.

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.en:
Ms. Sokhna T., aged 60, runs a small convenience shop in the town of Bambey, about 100 km from Dakar.  U-IMCEC recently opened a new branch in Bambey to better serve its more rural clientele.  Previously, Ms. T. was a client with the branch in Diorbel, about 30km away.
She explains she chose her trade because she does not have any training or qualification, so commerce was one of the only choices for her.  With her loan of 150,000 FCFA, she is looking to diversify her revenue by purchasing earrings, bracelets and watches for sale to her customers.  She is widowed and has two adult children.

loans.use: To replenish her stock of jewelry

loans.name: Cruzpata Group

texts.es:
Nuestras socias, pertenecen al banco comunal “CRUZPATA” y viven en la ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Las socias se reúnen cada 30 días en la oficina central D. la Asociación Arariwa y esta conformado por 17 socias. En el video se ve que están en una D. las reuniones que ellas tienen. La asesora Carmen les esta indicando las fechas D. pago del préstamo y las socias están tomando nota. Nuestras socias son puntuales en la asistencia D. todas las reuniones que se acuerdan, pues si una socia llega tarD. paga una multa e igual si se falta a la reunión.         

Nuestras socias alternan sus diversas actividades del hogar con la venta D. productos D. belleza, ropa, cueros para zapato, comestibles, verduras, comida, carne, productos D. plastiqueria y D. animales menores, Otras socias se dedican a brindar servicios D. contabilidad y costura. 
     
La socia Milder Silvia tiene 27 años, es casada y tiene un hijo. La socia se dedica a pintar cuadros cusqueños. La socia dibuja los paisajes D. la sierra del Cusco y a campesinos en sus chacras. Ya son 8 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales D. pintura. 

Las socias requieren el préstamo para comprar más productos como comestibles, verduras, telas, ropa y mucho más,  así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mayores ingresos y darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad D. vida.

Las socias valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

(En el video a parecen algunas amigas D. las socias).
texts.en:
Our members belong to the Cruzpata Communal Bank. They live in the city of Cusco in the Cusco department. The members meet every 30 days in the central office of the Arariwa Association. There are 17 members. In the video you can see them in one of their meetings. The treasurer, Carmen, is showing the dates to make loan payments, and the members are taking notes. Our members are punctual in attending all of the agreed upon meetings. If a member arrives late, she pays a fine. The same is true if a meeting is missed. Our members alternate their activities between their diverse household chores and selling things like beauty products, clothes, shoe leather, food, vegetables, meals, meat, plastic goods, and small animals. Other members offer services like accounting and sewing. One member, Milder Silvia, is 27. She is married, and has one child. She paints pictures of Cusco. She draws the mountain scenery of Cusco and the country people on their farms. She has been doing this for eight years. It has gone very well for her thanks to all of the effort she puts into her business. She needs a loan to buy more materials for painting. The members need a loan to buy more products like food, vegetables, fabric, clothes, and much more. Then they can increase their business capital, get greater earnings, and give their children a better quality of life. The members value and are grateful for the loan from this medium. They promise to make their payments on time. (Some friends of the members appear in the video.)

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more products like food, vegetables, fabric, clothes, and much more

loans.name: Ahotefo Group

texts.en:
Grace is 42 years old. She is married and the mother of eight children. She lives with her husband and the children. Currently all her children are in the junior and the primary school level. She has been a local manufacturer of soap called Azuma Blows for five years now. Her soap is named after a former international boxer who is a Ghanaian with the name of Azuma Nelson. She combines materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil to obtain her soaps. She is not able to produce in large quantities due to lack of funds. She wants to take advantage of the loan facility to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up production. She also sells local and rich kente cloth. She takes stock of kente from suppliers from Bonwire,  a home of kente. She hopes to raise her income to support her children's education. It is her desire to provide quality education to the children and would be grateful for that support.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Ahotefo’, which literally means Saints. She is the one standing third from the left in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders and food vendors respectively. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil etc.

loans.name: Silvia Del Carmen

texts.es: Silvia es una mujer muy responsable y luchadora por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar en un sin número de actividades económicas esto le ha dado la experiencia necesaria que ha tenido con su negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de salud, hace más de 10 años que tiene de obtener este medio de vida. Ella tiene 2 hijos los son mayores de edad pero algunas veces ayudan a su abnegada madre, por lo que esta sería la única soluciona a los problemas económicas que enfrenta. Ella ha tenido muchas dificultades como son problemas de salud ya que tiene asma y esto le dificulta cuando tiene que caminar largos trechos para visitar a sus clientes lo le ocasiono gastos para ella, pero esto no la detuvo a seguir con el negocio adelante. Ella solicita un financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de materia prima necesaria. Ella sueña que su negocio sea auto sostenible para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Silvia is a fighter and a very responsible woman. She has always likes working in an infinite number of economic activities. This has given her the necessary experience for her business. For over ten years she has been selling health products. She has two grown children. Sometimes they help their self-sacrificing mother, as this would be the only solution to the economic problems she faces. She has had many health problems because she has asthma. This makes it difficult for her to walk long distances to visit her customers, which causes her losses. But, this has not stopped her from getting ahead in her business. She is asking for a loan for working capital to buy basic needs materials. She dreams that her business will be self-sustaining in order to improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ahuehuete Group

texts.es:
La localidad de San Juan Ahuehuéyo está situada en el Municipio de Ayala (en el Estado de Morelos). Tiene 2255 habitantes. San Juan Ahuehuéyo está a 1160 metros de altitud.
Contiene una población indígena de 262, las lenguas indígenas NAHUATL Y MIXTECO, Su población es económicamente activa. El significado de ahuehuéyo viene del árbol que tiene por nombre en náhuatl “AHUEHUETE” Y asi es como se llama el grupo de quien vamos hablar.

Lo integran 4 personas,  sus nombres son: 	MARIA CONCEPCION G. G., MARINA DE JESUS S. S., GINA REBECA L. G., EMILIA H. C.. De esta ultima es de quien vamos hablar.

Se llama Emilia Hernández Carreño y no tiene ningún significado su nombre su edad es de 33 años, curso hasta el tercer año de secundaria la cual lleva por nombre LICENDIADO BENITO JUAREZ en  su misma localidad.

El crédito que ella solicita es para la compra de materia prima, como son: bultos de soya natural y compra de de bolsas de trigo por kilo, ya que ella se dedica a la elaboración de productos naturales como son: MILANEZA DE TRIGO, LONGANIZA DE SOYA, CHICHARRON DE SOYA, HAMBURGUESAS DE SOYA Y ALBONDIGAS DE SOYA y otros mas, ella mismo los elabora sin ningún químico todo es natural.

     Aun no cuenta con nombre propio su negocio, actualmente lleva 15 años dedicada a la elaboración  y venta de este producto natural. Ella aprendió junto con su esposo cuando estuvieron trabajando en un restaurante conocido al centro de cuautla, ahí aprendieron este oficio y producto., antes de empezar con la producción de alimentos de soya, se dedicaban a la venta de yogurt natural y  fruta, y  venta de granola  y que no les fue muy bien ya que no contaban con el capital para poder seguir su producción de lácteos, pero al aprender hacer los productos como la milanesa, longaniza. Etc. Ellos vieron que esto si les era redituable y que no se invertía mucho y obtenía mas ganancias

Su negocio esta en su propia casa, ahí es donde elaboran su producto, les es importante ya que no le agregan conservadores, todo lo que utilizan es natural. 

Ella tiene una gran satisfacción por lo que hace y que su esposo le ayude en el negocio, su clientela son sus vecinos su mejor promocion que tiene donde vive, también vende sus productos a los mercados de la zona, cuenta con dos compradores muy buenos ya que ellos le consumen por mayoreo y tiene el deseo de que alguien los conozca para que puedan exportar sus  productos a otros estado y se den a conocer.

Los desafíos que han presentado en su negocio son:  la alza de precios en el mercado con respecto a su materia prima que utiliza y mucho les afecta cuando hay periodo vacacional por que no venden igual.

Emilia es casada desde hace 18 años con el sr. Mariano Vázquez Acevedo tiene 4 hijos el primero lleva el nombre de: DOMINGO VAZQUEZ H. es el mayor de los hermanos cuenta actualmente con 17 años de edad y trabaja independiente, el segundo se llama EMILIO VAZQUEZ H., el estudia el primer año de secundaria junto con su hermano, MARIANO VAZQUEZ H. son cuates de nacimiento ambos van a la misma secundaria.

Y la pequeña que lleva por nombre GEMA VAZQUEZ H. cuenta con 7 años de edad y va en segundo de primaria.

     Emilia describe a su localidad donde hay mucha vegetación, campo, cultivos de maíz, cebolla, caña y fríjol,  al entrar a su comunidad podemos observar toda esta naturaleza.

Su casa es pequeña, cuenta con 3 cuartos, le falta repillar por que esta en rustico tanto paredes como suelo, pero cuenta con un pequeño jardín muy bonito y fresco. Ella quiere para un futuro darles la mejor educación a sus tres hijos pequeños y darle una mejor calidad de vida, estaba dudosa sobre el crédito que ya se le fue otorgado por que no creía que fuera cierto.

Quiere expresarles con sus propias palabras lo siguiente: "estoy muy agradecida con la institución FUNDACION REALIDAD, A.C. ya que sin su apoyo no podríamos lograr este pequeño avance en nuestro negocio y que es muy bueno que también apoyen a mujeres o madres solas por que ellas son las que mas luchan por mejorar su calidad de vida ya que no cuentan con alguien con quien luchar hombro a hombro."

Ella se integro al grupo por invitación de la sra. Marina de Jesús S. Sánchez actualmente ella es la representante del grupo y es quien le pone sal y limón al grupo.  Son muy unidas. Le sigue la sra. Gina rebeca López gatita, ella se dedica a la venta de dulces en su localidad, continuo con la sra. Maria concepción González garcía ella  vende antojitos mexicanos (Tortas) en la cooperativa de la escuela primaria cercana a su comunidad y para finalizar esta la sra. Emilia de quien hablamos, Ellas conforman el grupo Solidario (flat)  “ ahuehuete”.
texts.en:
San Juan Ahuehuéyo is located in the Ayala Municipality (in the state of Morelos). It has 2,255 inhabitants. San Juan Ahuehuéyo is at 1,160 meters in altitude. It has an indigenous population of 262. The indigenous languages are Nahuatl and Mixteco. The population is economically active. The meaning of “Ahuehuéyo” comes from tree and its name in Náhuatl is “Ahuehuete”. That is the name of the group that we will talk about. The four members are María Concepció González García, Marina de Jesús S. S., Gina Rebeca L. G., and Emilia Hernández Carreño. The last one is who we will discuss. Emilia Hernández Carreño’s name does not have any significance. She is 33, and she went to school until the third year of high school. The school’s name is Licendiado Benito Juarez, and it is in the same area. The loan she is requesting is to buy raw materials like bulk natural soy and bags of wheat by the kilo. She makes natural products like wheat milanesa, soy chicharron, soy hamburgers, soy meatballs, and others. She makes them herself without any chemicals. Everything is natural. Her business does not yet have its own name. She has been making and selling natural products for 15 years. She learned together with her husband when they were working in a well-known restaurant in the center of Cuautla. There they learned the job and the product. Before starting the production of soy food they sold natural yogurt, fruit, and granola. It did not go very well for them because they did not have the money to continue producing the dairy products. But, upon learning to make the products like milanesa and sausages, etc. they saw that this was profitable. They did not invest much, and they got more earnings. Her business is in her house, where she makes her product. It is important to them to not add preservatives; everything they use is natural. She has a great satisfaction from what she does and that her husband helps her in the business. Her customers are her neighbors, and they are the best promotion she has where she lives. She also sells her products in the area markets. She has two very good buyers who buy wholesale. She has the desire that someone will get to know them so that they can export their products to other states and they get to know the products. The challenge in her business is the rise in prices of the raw material she uses. This greatly affects her at vacation time because things don’t sell the same then. Emilia has been married to Mariano Vásquez Acevedo for 18 years. They have four children. The first is Domingo Vazquez H.. He is the oldest sibling, is 17, and he works independently. The second is Emilio Vazquez H.. He is in the first year of high school with his brother, Mariano Vazquez H.. They are twins, and go to the same high school. The little one is Gema Vazquez H.. She is 7, and she is in the second grade. Emilia describes her area as a place where there is lots of vegetation, fields, and corn, onion, sugar cane, and bean crops. Upon entering her community we can observe all of this nature. Her house is small; there are three rooms. They need to finish the walls and the floor, but it has a small garden, which is very pretty. In the future she wants to give her three small children a good education and a better quality of life. She was doubtful about the loan, and then it was granted. She did not believe it was true. She wants to use her own words to say the following, “I am very grateful to the Fundación Realidad A.C. institution because without their help we would not be able to make this small advance in our business. It is also very good that they support women and single mothers because they are the ones who fight more to improve their quality of life. They do not have anyone to join in this battle shoulder to shoulder.” She joined the group by the invitation of Marina de Jesús S. Sánchez. She is currently the group’s representative, and she is the one who puts pizzazz in the group. They are very united. She is followed by Gina Rebeca López Gatita. She sells sweets in her area.
