Then there is María Concepción González who sells Mexican snacks (sandwiches) in the primary school cooperative, which is close to her community. Finally, there is Emilia, who we have discussed. They form the “Ahuehuete” Communal Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soy and wheat

loans.name: Margarita De Los Santos

texts.es: La señora Margarita de los Santos C. C., tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y el esposo trabaja como conductor apoyando a los gastos del hogar ellos tiene 4 hijos de los cuales tres de ellos estudian la escuela primaria, el mayor logro de la familia seria el poder tener los recursos necesarios para ofrecerles los estudios profesionales a todos sus hijos. Ellos se dedican desde hace 21 años, a la agricultura al cultivo de la piña con el tiempo planean diversificar sus cultivos con otros rentables, de manera que para lograr esto, solicitaron un préstamo con el objetivo de comprar fertilizantes y brindarle las condiciones apropiadas al siembra de la piña y de esta forma venderla a un buen precio por ser piña de calidad y así poder diseminar otros tipos de frutas que se vendan a un buen precio y que logren una mejor estabilidad económica para la familia.
texts.en:
Margarita de los Santos C. C. is 37 and married. Her husband works as a driver, and he helps with the household expenses. They have four children. Three of them are in elementary school. The greatest achievement of the family would be to be able to have the necessary resources to give all of their children the education to become professionals. They have been growing pineapples for 21 years. In time they plan to diversify their crops with other profitable crops. In order to do this they are asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. That will provide the appropriate conditions for planting pineapple. This way they will sell it for a good price because it will be good quality pineapple. Then they will be able to disseminate other types of fruits and sell then at a good price. This will give them more economic stability for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers for crop maintenance

loans.name: Señor De Ecce Homo Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR D. ECCE HOMO” y viven en la ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Los socios se reúnen cada 30 días en la oficina central D. la Asociación Arariwa y esta conformado por 15 socios. En el video se ve que están en una D. las reuniones que ellos tienen.        

Algunas D. nuestras socias alternan sus diversas actividades del hogar con la venta D. artesanía, comida, comestibles y ropa.  Las socias Dominga y Jovita hacen tejidos y bordados. Otros socios se dedican al servicio D. secretariado, contabilidad y docencia. La socia Monica se dedica a la fabricación D. chocolates.           
     
La socia Benecia tiene 43 años, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos. La socia se dedica a la producción y venta D. velas. La socia se levanta muy temprano para hacer las actividades del hogar y después se va a vender velas a la puerta del Templo D. “La Merced” del Cusco.  Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos para seguir produciendo velas. 

Los socios requieren el préstamo para comprar más productos como comestibles, materiales para la artesanía, ropa muchas más y así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y tener mayores ingresos y darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad D. vida.

Las socias valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the Señor D. Ecce Homo Communal Bank. They live in the city of Cusco in the Cusco department. The members meet every 30 days in the central office of the Arariwa Association. There are 15 members. In the video you can see them at one of their meetings. Some of our members alternate their activities between their diverse household chores and selling handicrafts, meals, food, and clothes. Dominga and Jovita are members who make weavings and embroidery. Other members proviD. services like secretarial, accounting, and teaching. Monica is a member who makes chocolates. Benecia is a 43 year old member. She is a single mother, and she has three children. She makes and sells candles. She gets up very early to do her household chores. Later she goes to sell candles at the doorway of the La Merced Temple of Cusco. She has been in this business for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She needs the loan to buy more supplies to continue making candles. The members need the loan to buy more products like food, materials for handicrafts, clothes, and much more. That way they will be able to increase their business capital, get greater earnings, and give their children a better quality of life. The members value and appreciate the loan given through this medium. They promise to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more products like food, materials for handicrafts, clothes, and much more

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es: El Sr. Benedicto tiene su salón de billar en la zona de Pampahasi, se dedica ya siete años a esta actividad, su esposa tiene su restaurant en Villa Salome donde el Sr. benedicto le ayuda por las mañanas, y por las tardes atiende el salón, tiene una pequeña hijita que tiene un año, ambos se apoyan para los gastos de la casa y tiene muchos proyectos para el futuro, uno de ellos es abrir un restaurant en la Plaza Ergueta ya que con esta actividad les va muy bien. El crédito será invertido en la compra de una mesa de billar que le están ofreciendo a menor precio.
texts.en:
Benedicto has a pool hall in the Pampaza area. He has had this business for seven years. His wife has a restaurant in Villa Salome. Benedicto helps her in the mornings, and in the afternoons he works in his pool hall. He has a small, one year old daughter. Both he and his wife help with the household expenses. He has many projects for the future. One of them is to open a restaurant in the Plaza Ergueta because this type of work is going very well for them. The loan is to buy a pool table that is being offered at a lower price.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a pool table

loans.name: Severina

texts.es: La sra. Severina tiene un pequeño restaurant ubicado en la Av. Circunvalación de la zona de Pampahasi, atiende por las noches con platos sencillos, como silpancho, chorizo y asado, tiene ya mucho tiempo en esta actividad, es muy conocida por la zona, vive con sus hijos que estudian y trabajan para ayudar en los gastos de la casa a su mamá, ya que su papá los dejó, y no vive con ellos, doña Severina se ocupa sola de sus hijos. Tiene también su minibús que trabaja en el transporte público. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de una caja para la movilidad, hacerla reparar para que trabaje con un chofer del sindicato en el que está inscrito.
texts.en:
Señora Severina has a small restaurant located on Circunvalación Ave. in the zone of Pampahasi. She serves simple dishes, like silpancho (a dish made with meat, potatoes, rice & eggs), sausage and barbeque in the evenings. Sh has been doing this activity for a long time and is well known in the area. She lives with her children who are students and work to help their mother with the household expenses, since their dad left them and he does not live with them. Señora Severina takes care of her children alone. She also has a minivan and works providing public transportation. The loan that she requests will be invested in the repair of the minivan so that she can work as a chauffeur of the union in which she is a member.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain her minivan so she can provide taxi services

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es: La sra. Ingrid es una cliente antigua de la institución, trabaja desde el año 2005 y solo tiene crédito en nuestra institución. Tiene se restaurant ubicado en en la zona de Villa Copacabana donde ofrece ricos platos como lechón que es cerdo cocido al horno con ensalada, papa, camote y plátano; fricasé que es cerdo cocido en su caldo con ají amarillo acompañado de mote y chuño (papa deshidratada); chicharrón que es cerdo fritado acompañado de mote, chuño y llajhua (salsa picante hecha con locoto, tomate, y hierbas) estos últimos fines de semana está también preparando picante mixto que contiene carne molida, lengua de vaca, pollo en ají, también esta acompañado de tunta (papa deshidratada) rebosada con maní molido, El restaurant es muy conocido en la zona, ella vive con su esposo que se dedica al servicio técnico y tiene un hijo a su cargo ya que los otros ya son independientes. El crédito será invertido en la conexión de gas domiciliario para el restaurant.
texts.en:
Señora Ingrid is a long-standing client of the institution. She has worked since the year 2005 and only has loans with our institution. She has her own restaurant located in the zone of Village Copacabana where she offers rich dishes such as lechón, which is oven-cooked pork with salad, potatoes, sweet potatoes and banana, fricasé which is pork stewed in its broth with yellow chili accompanied by white corn and potato starch (dehydrated potato), and chicharrón which is fried pork accompanied by white corn, potato starch and llajhua (spicy sauce made with hot chilis, tomato, and herbs). The last few weekends she has also prepared a spicy mixed that contains shredded meat, cow tongue, chicken in chili, also accompanied by tunta (dehydrated potatoes) rimmed with crushed peanuts. The restaurant is very well known in the area. She lives with her husband, who is dedicated to technical service, and has a son still in her care, since the other children are already independent. The loan will be invested in the connection of gas service for the restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To connect gas service for the restaurant

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El sr. Luis trabaja con nuestra institución desde el año 2005, es un cliente muy responsable, se dedica al rubro del transporte tiene su movilidad propia con la que trabaja como taxi, también trabaja en una orquesta(grupo musical) donde toca la batería, su orquesta es muy conocido por la zona, tiene su esposa que trabaja como tramitadora y sus hijos que están en colegio. El crédito que solicita es para comprar una cámara de eco y efectos para la orquesta y así mejorar la calidad de sonido.
texts.en:
Señor Luis has worked with our institution since the year 2005. He is a very responsible client. He is dedicated to providing public transportation. He has his own vehicle with which he works as a taxi driver. He also works in an band (musical group) where he plays the drums. His band is very well known in the area. His wife works as a clerk and his children attend school. The loan that he requests is to buy sound equipment for the band and thus to improve the quality of sound.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sound equipment for his band.

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es: El señor Marvin Antonio G. M., tiene 43 años de edad es casado y sus esposa se dedica  a la venta de mariscos, él trabaja en el cultivo del café  y por esta razón solicito este préstamo para poder comprar fertilizantes y fungicidas que le brinden un mejor mantenimiento a la cosecha del café, esto le beneficiaría por que podría vender a un buen precio la cosecha  del café, logrando a largo plazo los recursos necesarios para poder comprar un tramo en el mercado y así su esposa pueda instalar una pequeña tienda de mariscos esto les traería una fuente de trabajo mas segura, en donde les cambiaria sus niveles de vida.
texts.en:
Señor Marvin Antonio G. M. is 43 years of age. He is married and his wife is dedicated to the sale of shellfish. He works in the cultivation of coffee and for this reason requests this loan to be able to buy fertilizers and fungicides to offer better maintenance to the coffee crop. This would benefit him because he would be able to sell the coffee crop for a good price, achieving the necessary resources to be able to purchase a place in the market. In this way his wife could build a small store for shellfish which would bring them a more secure source of income, which would change their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fungicides to improve his coffee crop.

loans.name: Bella Besnarda

texts.es: La. Sra. Bella vive en la urbanizacion el Guapuru zona del plan 3000, en el lugar vive como cacera hace 8 años, la actividad que realiza es  trabajos D. costura, hace camisas, pantalones, sabanas, cortinas y edredones. Ella trabaja con esta actividad hace aproximadamente 10 años,  actualmente vive sola hace unos años atras que su esposo fallecio, tiene 3 hijos los cuales ya son mayores D. edad y tienen sus propios hogares. El capital solicitado es para la compra D. material para raelizar sus trabajos. ella cuenta con tres maquinas D. costura dos singer y una over. es una persona D. caracter humilD. y tiene muchas ganas D. seguir trabajando, y D. esa manbera mejorar su calidad D. vida
texts.en:
Señora Bella lives in the Guapuru housing project of the 3000 plan. She has lived in this place as a housing agent for 8 years. The activity that she carries out is the work of dressmaking. She makes shirts, pants, sheets, curtains and comforters. She has worked at this activity for approximately 10 years. At present she lives alone. Some years ago her husband passed away. She has 3 children who are already of legal age and they have their own homes. The requested capital is for the purchase of material to create her works. She relies on three sewing machines; two singer and one over. She is a person of humble character and she has much desire to continue working, and in this way to improve her quality of life

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material for making clothing, curtains, comforters, etc.

loans.name: Esperanza Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Esperanza Del Rosario Hernández R. es maestra de secundaria en casco urbano de Estelí, doña Esperanza va usar el crédito para la compra de dos puertas ya que necesita mejorar su vivienda.
Esperanza es soltera y tiene dos hijo a su cargo, este es el primer crédito con Ceprodel Esperanza expreso que el crédito le ayudado mucho ya que mejoro su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Esperanza Del Rosario H. R. is a secondary school teacher in the urban area of Esteli. She is going to use this credit for the purchase of two doors, which she needs to improve her home. Esperanza is single and has two children whom she cares for. This is her first credit with Ceprodel, and she says it will help her a lot.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase two doors

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nelsa Abigail

texts.es: La señora Nelsa Abigail M. A. tiene 59 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de 35 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y lácteos ella se sobrevive  a desde hace 6 años gracias a su esfuerzo y a la ayuda de los fondos Kiva con un pequeño comedor (venta de comida), los principales problemas que le han aquejado en estos años han sido las pocas comodidades que posee el local de su empresa, esto le ha impedido el poder tener mayor captación entre los clientes es por esta razón que ella solicita este préstamo para poder comprar materiales de construcción y comenzar con la primera etapa de ampliación de su local, ellos son una familia humilde, que viven en Esquipulas, desean que se les brinde este préstamo para poder tener mayores ingresos y de esta manera mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Nelsa Abigail M. A. is 59 years old, is a single mother and has a 35 year old son who sells groceries and dairy products. She has survived the past 6 years thanks to her efforts and with the help of funds from Kiva for a small canteen (selling food). The main problem that she has suffered from in these years has been that her business premises are not very comfortable. This has prevented her from gaining more clients and it is for this reason that she requests a loan to be buy construction materials and begin the first stage of expanding the premises. They are a humble family who live in Esquipulas. They wish that you will offer them this loan so that they can have greater income and in this way improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Kutimuy Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Kutimuy que significa Regresa en Quechua, inicia su 41 ciclo con  14 socias.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. verduras, abarrotes en general, pescado, artesanía, golosinas, chicha, verduras, vino, comida, tuna.

Como es el caso D. la señora Aurea que es soltera, tiene 59 años y 3 hijos, Aurea venD. refrescos que prepara ella misma, sus ventas los realiza ambulatoriamente, además junto a sus hijos realizan artesanía en piedra D. Huamanga.

Marcelina es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Marcelina se dedica a la compra y venta D. tuna que compra D. los productores y los venD. en la ciudad D. Lima, también compra tara y cochinilla.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles, 1000 soles  haciendo un total D. 8,300 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. frutas, tuna, tara, azúcar, arroz, fideos, pescado, piedra D. huamanga.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener casa propia, un negocio estable, sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The communal bank Kutimuy, which means "return" in Quechua, starts is 41st cycle with 14 members.

The members run different businesses such as selling vegetables, general groceries, fish, crafts, candies, a local drink, wine, foods, and prickly pear.

. One example is Aurea, who is single, 59 years old, and has three children. Aurea sells soft drinks, which she makes herself. She sells her product in the streets. Also, together with her children, she makes crafts in the Huamanga stone.

Marcelina lives with her partner, is 40 years old, and has two children. Marcelina buys and sells prickly pear which she buys from the producers and sells in the city of Lima. She also buys grasshoppers and the beetles that make red food and fabric dye.

The members need different loan totals such as 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles, making a total of 8,300 soles ($2,875) in loan from the communal bank.

Their loans will be invested in buying fruits, prickly pear, grasshopper, sugar, rice, noodles, fish, and local stone.

The members dream of having their own houses, stable businesses, and that their children will be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits, prickly pear, grasshopper, sugar, rice, noodles fish, and local stone

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: El señor Francisco Jose M. tiene 49 años de edad, es casado y su esposa tiene una pequeña pulpería esto le genera lo necesario para poder aportar a los gastos del hogar, el señor M. tiene 5 años de ser conductor , lo principales problemas que afectan a la familia M., es que ellos radican en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla este es un lugar que no aporta a un ambiente familiar optimo, brindando inseguridad ciudadana y una mala higiene a la comuna, es por esta razón que el señor Francisco solicita un préstamo con el objetivo de comprar materiales de construcción para comenzar con la primera etapa de construcción y remodelación de su vivienda esto le aportaría un lugar más optimo, seguro para él y toda su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco Jose M. is 49 years old and married. His wife has a small store, which generates enough income to be able to cover their household expenses. Also, Mr. M. has been a driver for 5 years now. The main problem that affects the M. family is that they live in the Reparto Juan Ramon Padilla, an area that does not offer an ideal family environment. There is a lack of safety for the citizens and poor sanitation. It is for this reason that Francisco is requesting a loan, for the purpose of purchasing construction materials to begin with the first stage of construction and remodeling of his home. This will provide him with a more ideal home, safe for him and all of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Maritza Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora  Maritza E. L. es trabajadora de la fabrica de puro INAXA Estelí  ella trabaja en el área de empaque.
Maritza va utilizar el crédito para la compra de un electrodoméstico un equipo de sonido, ella espera que el equipo le sirva para entretenerse en los días de descanso.
Maritza es soltera y tiene tres hijo todo en edad escolar es primera vez que trabaja con Ceprodel.
texts.en:
Martiza E. is a worker in the cigar factory in Estelí. She works in the packing department.

Maritza will use the loan to buy a stereo. She hopes that the stereo will entertain her on her rest days.

Maritza is single and has three children of school age, and this is the first time that she has worked with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a stereo

loans.name: Cristóbal Evaristo

texts.es: El señor Cristóbal Evaristo M. A. tiene 40 años de edad es casado y su esposa se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, ellos tienen tres hijos de las edades  de 18, 16 y 10 años de edad el mayor trabaja y apoya a la economía del hogar y los otros dos pequeños estudia la secundaria, ellos se dedican a la agricultura al cultivo de la piña, con este préstamo podrán comprar fertilizantes que le brinden  a la siembra un mejor mantenimiento y que la cosecha sea de primera calidad pudiendo aumentar las ganancias  y ofrecerles mejores niveles de vida, esto a largo plazo les significaría el poder realizar cambios significativos en la estructura del hogar pudiendo brindarles a sus hijos mejores condiciones y un lugar más seguro que convidar a sus familias.
texts.en:
Mr. Cristobal Evaristo M. A. is 40 years old and married. His wife works selling fruits and vegetables. They have three children; ages 18, 16, and 10. Their oldest son works and helps support the household, and the two younger children are in secondary school. The family works in agriculture, cultivating pineapple. With this loan, they will be able to purchase fertilizers that will provide better maintenance to their crop, and therefore their harvest will be of the highest quality. In this way, they will be able to increase their earnings, which will offer them a better living standard. In the long run, this would mean being able to realize significant changes in the structure of their home, which would provide their children with better living conditions and a safer place to offer their families.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase agricultural materials to help maintain the harvest

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
La Licenciada Ana Patricia F. C. es trabajadora de la fabrica de puro tabaco Jhon ubicada a 1 km fuera del casco urbano de Estelí el cargo que desempeña es contadodora general de dicha fabrica.
Ana Patricia va utilizar el crédito para la compra de ropa y cosmético.
Ana es asalariada pero ella vende ropa y cosmético en su centro de trabajo siendo los compañeros de trabajo su mismo cliente.
Su negocio empezó después de seis meses de trabajo y actualmente tiene el negocio. Ella espera de este crédito invertirlo en la compra de ropa y cosmético para asi mantener su  otros ingreso.
Ana es soltera y tiene dos hijo ambos menores de edad  ha trabajado con Ceprodel 2 años y lleva 3 crédito.
Ana dijo que su crédito con Ceprodel le han ayudado mucho ya que mantiene su negocio y este le genera otros ingresos más.
texts.en:
The lawyer Ana Patricia F. C. is an employee of the Jhon cigar factory located one mile outside the city of Estelí. She works as a general accountant in the factory.

Ana Patricia is going to use the loan to purchase clothing and cosmetics. She is a salaried worker, but she sells clothing and cosmetics in her workplace, her co-workers also being her customers.

She began her business after working six months, and she is currently operating it. She plans to invest this loan in the purchase of clothing and cosmetics in order to supplement her salary.

Ana is single and has two small children. She has worked with Ceprodel for 2 years and has had 3 loans. Ana said that her loans with Ceprodel have helped her a lot since they support her business and this gives her more supplemental income.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Geraneos Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Geraneos inicia su cuarto ciclo con 17 socias.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. loceria, cristaleria, artesanía, pan, lácteos, quesos, cereales, comidas, verduras, leñas y también el servicio D. carpintería.

Como es el caso D. L. señora Anatolia que es casada, tiene 52 años y 8 hijos, Anatolia venD. leña en su casa, además se dedica a L. crianza D. animales en su casa como gallinas, cerdos, cuy, anteriormente tenia un pequeño restaurante el cual cerro porque se fracturo L. mano.

Mientras que Gladis es soltera, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo, estudiante D. enfermería, Gladis tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en un local alquilado.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles, 750 soles, 1000 soles  haciendo un total D. 13,300 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. quesos, cereales, lácteos, arroz, azúcar, carne, animales, comida para animales.

Los sueños D. las socias son construir una casa mas granD., ampliar su galpón, sus hijos sean profesionales, terminar su carrera y mejorar su tienda.
texts.en:
The Geranios communal bank starts its fourth cycle with 17 members. The members are involved in a variety of commercial activities like: sale of tableware, glasses, crafts, bread, dairy products, cheeses, grains, prepared meals, vegetables, firewood and carpentry services. Anatolia, 52, is married and the mother of 8 children. She sells firewood from her home and also raises small farm animals like chickens, pigs and guinea pigs. She used to have a small restaurant but had to close it when she fractured her hand. Gladis, on the other hand, is single, 26 years old, and has one son. She is a nursing student and runs a small grocery store in a rented locale. The members need various amounts like 300, 600, 750, and 1000 soles totaling 13,300 soles to the communal bank as a whole. Their funds will be used to buy cheeses, dairy products, rice, meat, animals, and animal feed. Among the members' dreams are: building a larger home, enlarging their farmworker's sleeping quarters, that their children become professionals, to finish their professional training, and to improve their store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheeses, grains, dairy products, rice, sugar, meat, animals, and animal feed.

loans.name: Aurelia Guadalupe

texts.es:
La venta de fritanga es el negocio al que se dedica la señora Aurelia H. desde hace quince años en el departamento de León ofreciendo todo tipo de alimentos como hot dogs y las riquísima fritanga elaborada y comercializada por ella misma.
El crédito que está solicitando lo utilizará para la compra de la materia prima como los platanos, yuca, pan, entre otros. Ella espera que su crédito sea otorgado satisfactoriamente para así continuar manteniendo su negocio que tanto le ha costado y generar utilidades para su familia.
texts.en:
Aurelia H. has sold fried food for the last 15 years in León department. She offers all kinds of food llike hot dogs and the delicious fried up meals she makes and sells herself. The funding she is asking for will be used to buy ingredients like bananas, yucca and bread, among others. She hopes her loan will be approved so that she can continue maintaining her business, which she has struggled so hard to set up, and producing profits for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bananas, yucca, bread.

loans.name: Belkis Josefina

texts.es:
La joven Belkis Josefina V. trabaja de secretaria en un buffet de abogados en Estelí, Belkis va utilizar este crédito para gasto universitario ella es estudiante de tercer año de Licenciatura en derecho en la UPONIC.
Quiere pagar su mensualidad en la universidad para no tener problemas en la universidad con su estudio, Belkis es soltera y tiene una niña a su cargo y vive con sus padres.
Este es su cuarto crédito con Ceprodel en dos años, Belkis dijo que con sus crédito a podido continuar estudiando y a si mejora su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
The young Belkis Josefina V. works as a secretary in a law office in Esteli. Belkis is going to use this credit for her college expenses, since she is a student in her third year of law school at UPONIC. She wants to make her monthly payment to the university in order to not have problems with her studies. Belkis is single, lives with her parents, and has a daughter who depends on her. This is her fourth loan with Ceprodel in two years, and she says that with these credits she has been able to continue studying and therefore improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make her monthly tuition payment

loans.name: Roling  Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Roling Antonio E. R. es trabajador de la fabrica de puro Nicaprosa ubicada a un kilometro de Estelí, Roling va usar el crédito para pagar mano de obra de remodelación de su vivienda.
El espera que con la remodelación de su casa se va sentir bien ya que su vivienda anteriormente estaba un poco deteriorada.
Roling es soltera pero tiene su conyugue y un hijo a su cargo.
Este es su primer crédito con Ceprodel y espera seguir trabajando con  Ceprodel.
texts.en:
Roling Antonio E. R. works at the Nicaprosa cigar factory, which is located a kilometer away from Estelí. Roling will use his funds to pay for labor costs to remodel his home. He hopes that the home remodel will help him feel better since his home is in a pretty deteriorated condition. Roling is single but has both his life partner and a son dependent on him. This is his first loan with Ceprodel and he hopes to continue to collaborate with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay home repair labor costs.

loans.name: Estefania

texts.es:
Estefanía tiene 62 años, es madre de tres hijos ya emancipados y vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Motupe, ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Debido a que su esposo ya es de edad avanzada y no puede trabajar, hace año y medio Estefanía se vio en la necesidad de adquirir una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) con la que sustenta los gastos familiares. Este vehículo es trabajado por uno de sus hijos y cubre rutas entre Motupe, sus caseríos y el cercano distrito de Olmos.

Los caminos de la zona son muy accidentados y, debido al tiempo de uso, el vehículo ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas en el motor que requieren de urgente reparación, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.

Estefanía es una mujer responsable, trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Su más grande anhelo es poder adquirir otra mototaxi para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su marido
texts.en:
Estefanía, 62, has three adult children. She lives with her husband in Motupe district, which is an hour and a half from Chiclayo. Because her husband is of an advanced age and no longer able to work, a year and a half ago, Estefanía was faced with the necessity to acquire a mototaxi (a motorized vehicle used in the transportation of passengers and cargo) with which she earns income to meet family expenses. This vehicle is driven by one of her sons and it covers the routes between Motupe, its surrounding settlements, and the neighboring Olmos district. The roads in this area are heavily damaged and, due to the long time it's been in use, the vehicle is beginning to show signs of wear and tear that require urgent repair. This has led to call upon Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to request an 800 new sol loan. Estefanía is a responsible, hard-working, family oriented woman. Her greatest wish is to have a second mototaxi in order to improve both her own and her husband's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for mototaxi service and repair.

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La joven María De los Ángeles M. G. es trabajadora del centro de salud Leonel Rugama en Estelí desempeñándose como enfermera.
María va usar el crédito para compra de electrodoméstico como lavadora y una cocina. Quiere la lavadora ya que quiere gastar menos tiempo lavando.
Ella espera que la lavadora y la cocina le ayuden mucho debido a que pasa el mayor de su tiempo trabajando.
María es soltera y solo convive con su hermana, ha trabajado con Ceprodel por 4 años y 4 créditos.
María expreso que sus créditos con Ceprodel han ayudado mucho a comprar su electrodoméstico que necesitan en su casa.
texts.en:
Young María De los Ángeles M. G. works as a nurse in the health center Leonel Rugama in Estelí. She will use this loan to buy home appliances such as a washing machine and a kitchen range. She wants the washing machine because she would like to spend less time washing. She expects that the washing machine and the range will help her a lot, since she spends the majority of her time working. Maria is single and lives only with her sister. She has worked with Ceprodel for 4 years and through 4 loan cycles. Maria says that the loans from Ceprodel have been a big help, allowing them to buy the appliances that they need in their house.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy household appliances (washing maching and kitchen range)

loans.name: Sembrando Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEMBRANDO” y viven en la ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Los socios se reúnen cada 30 días en la oficina central de la Asociación Arariwa y esta conformado por 12 socios. En el video se ve que la junta directiva a cargo del señor secretario Erasmo, da la bienvenida a los nuevos socios al banco comunal y la asesora da unas palabras de saludos por las fiestas navideñas y por el año nuevo a los socios.           

Algunas de nuestras socias alternan sus diversas actividades del hogar con la venta de panes, venta producto de belleza y venta de productos de limpieza. Otros socios dan servicio de transportes en sus propios taxis. Los socios Erasmo y Carlos son docentes. La socia Tania es psicóloga.            
     
La socia Antonia tiene 52 años es casada y se dedica al negocio de producción de panes. La socia se levanta de madrugada de  4 a.m. a 5 a.m. para hacer las actividades del negocio como preparar la masa del pan y calentar el horno. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos para seguir produciendo panes. 

Los socios requieren el préstamo para comprar más productos para sus negocios y así de esta forma aumentar el capital del negocio y tener mayores ingresos y darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.

Las socias valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the Sembrando Communal Bank. They live in the city of Cusco in the Cusco department. The members meet every 30 days in the central office of the Arariwa Association. There are 12 members. In the video you can see the governing board. The secretary, Erasmo, is greeting the new members of the communal bank. The treasurer says a few words of greetings for the Christmas and New Year’s holidays. Some of our members alternate their activities between their diverse household chores and selling bread, beauty products, and cleaning products. Other members provide services like driving their own taxis. Erasmo and Carlos are teachers. Tania is a psychologist. Antonia is a 52 year old member. She is married, and her business is making bread. She gets up between 4 a.m. and 5 a.m. to do work for her business. She makes the bread dough and heats the oven. She has been in this business for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She needs the loan to buy supplies to continue making bread. The members need the loan to buy more products for their businesses. That way they will be able to increase their business capital, get greater earnings, and give their children a better quality of life. The members value and appreciate the loan given through this medium. They promise to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more products for their businesses

loans.name: Elmo Marcelo

texts.es:
El señor es trabajador del centro de salud Leonel Rugama de Estelí el trabaja desde hace unos 18 años desempeñando el cargo de responsable de epidemiologia.
Elmo va usar el crédito para la compra de un electrodoméstico (equipo de sonido) y para gasto de estudio de su hija.
El espera del crédito pagar los gasto de su hija en la universidad ya que es de primer ingreso y con el equipo de sonido divertirse en su tiempo libre.
Elmo es casado y tiene una hija a su cargo. Este es su crédito número 6 Elmo expresa que su crédito con Ceprodel le han ayudado mucho en mejora su casa, comprar algunos electrodomésticos y gasto familiares.
texts.en:
Elmo works in the health care center Leonel Rugama de Estelí. He has worked there since he was 18 in epidemiology. Elmo is going to use the loan to buy an electrical appliance (sound system) and to spend on his daughter's studies. He hopes the loan will pay for his daughter's freshman university tuition and with the sound equipment he will have a good time in his free time. Elmo is married and is responsible for his daughter. This is his sixth loan. Elmo says his loans with Ceprodel have helped him a lot in improving his house, buying electronic equipment and paying family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sound system and to pay for his daughter's studies

loans.name: Rocio Jaqueline

texts.es:
Rocío es una madre de familia de 35 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el sector Ucupe, distrito de Lagunas, ubicado a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza desde que tenía 20 años de edad, empezó ofreciendo estos productos por catálogo. Actualmente esta actividad le ayuda a solventar los gastos de su hogar ya que los ingresos que su esposo percibe como obrero agrícola no le son suficientes para mantener a la familia. 

El tiempo que lleva ofreciendo sus productos a sus habituales clientes ha hecho que se haga conocida por la zona y, poco a poco, ha instalado un pequeño establecimiento donde ofrece exclusivamente cosméticos. Rocío se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la ampliación de su negocio.

Rocío es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, sus vecinos la consideran una madre de familia ejemplar. Su más grande anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rocío, 35, lives with her husband and their two children in the Ucupe sector of the Lagunas district. It is located a half hour from the city of Chiclayo. She has been selling beauty products since she was 20. She started offering her products by catalog. Currently, this activity helps pay the household expenses. Her husband’s income as an agricultural work is not sufficient to support the family. The time that she has spent offering her products to her regular customers has made her well known in the area. Little by little, she has set up a small establishment where she sells cosmetics exclusively. For the first time, Rocío is asking Edpyme Alternativea for a loan for 1,000 PEN to use to expand her business. Rocío is a hard-working and enterprising woman. Her neighbors consider her to be an exemplary mother. Her greatest goal is to keep growing as a businesswoman and to get her children ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics to expand her business

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Mrs. Hem P. helps contribute to her family’s living expenses by working as a garment worker. She is 26 years of age, married, and the mother of two children, who attend school. (Hem P. was busy working when the photo was taken so her husband is pictured instead.)  She is married to Chantha, 28, a construction worker. Hem P. wants to acquire more revenue to support her family and has therefore requested a loan to buy rice in bulk for resale at a profit.

loans.use: To order rice in bulk

loans.name: Sothear

texts.en: Mrs. Sothear M. is 24 years old. She is married to Mr. Lyhov Ping (at right) and they live in Prey Buy village in Takeo province. Mrs. Sothear M. is a farmer and her husband breeds ducks so that they can support their family.  These two businesses now face a problem, so Mrs. Sothear M. is seeking a loan from AMK to buy rice seeds, fertilizer, and ducks to support these two businesses.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizer and ducks.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Reht

texts.en:
Mrs. Reht S. is 35 years old and she lives in Prey Buy village in Takeo province with her husband, Mr. Lot Vith.  They have three children:  One is a student, while the others are too young to work or study. 

Mrs. Reht S. is a farmer.  Her husband provides wedding materials to rent to people who host gatherings such as weddings, funerals and birthday parties.   Because the rice field has infertile soil, she has asked for a loan from AMK to buy fertilizer to support the field.  She will use the rest of the loan to buy rice seed and pesticides for the field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed and pesticides

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sergio Noel

texts.es:
El señor Sergio Noel A. R. vende accesorio para celulares y reparación de celulares en Estelí del supermercado las Segovia ½ cuadra al sur.
Sergio va utilizar el crédito para comprar repuesto de celulares.
Anteriormente el señor Sergio era trabajador de  ENACAL desempeñándose como cobrador, su negocio comienza con la venta de repuesto de celulares su capital inicial era de 700 dólares y luego fue creciendo su negocio.
Sergio alquila un local el cual tiene 1 trabajador permanente y la ayuda de su esposa, el es casado y tiene un hijo en edad escolar.
Este es su crédito número 3 el cual dijo que sus crédito con Ceprodel le han ayudado mucho ya que mantiene su negocio y mejora los ingreso de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr Sergio Noel A. R. sells accessories for cellphones and repairs cellphones 50 meters south of the supermarket Las Segovia in Estelí. He will use his loan to buy spare parts for cellphones. Previously Sergio worked as a conductor with the water company Enacal. He started his business with the sale of spare parts for cellphones. His initial capital amounted to US$700 and then his business grew. He rents premises where he works with one permanent worker. His wife helps him. He is married and the father of one child of school age.

This is Sergio's third loan. He says that his loans from Ceprodel helped him a lot, since they enabled him to keep his business and improve his family's income.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy accessories for cellphones (freehand, memories, screens, chargers, etc.)

loans.name: Yang

texts.en:
Mrs. Yang M. is 31 years old and she lives with her husband, Mr. Vireak Chet in Prey Buy village in Takeo province. They have five children.  Three of the children attend school; the others are too young to work or study. 

Mrs Yang M. is a farmer, but she does not now have enough money to buy rice seed. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed.  She plans to use the rest of the loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers to make her crop more productive. Her husband is a laborer, and makes a small income to support the family.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, pesticide and fertilizer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vandeth

texts.en:
Mrs Vandeth D. is 39 years old.  She lives in Run village in Takeo province and is married to Mr. Von Thy (right).  Their children who are all too young to work or study. 

Mrs Vandeth D. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice for a living. Her husband is a bread seller who can make a small income to support the family. Although they work hard, they still need to earn more income to support the family. Thus, Mrs Vandeth D. is asking a loan from AMK to buy cows and pigs, as well as food to support the new bread-selling business.

loans.use: To buy cows and pigs as well as food to support a new bread-selling business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ky

texts.en: Ky I., 40, is a determined and hardworking man who resides in  Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  Ky I. owns a small store inside the local market where he sells fresh fish.  He is married to Sokchea, age 40, who assists him in selling fish. This couple was married a long time ago and has three children. One child is married,  the other two are single and go to school. Ky I. needs a loan to improve his enterprise by becoming more efficient. He will use his loan to build up the financial capital to improve in his fish-selling business.

loans.use: To build up financial capital to improve the business

loans.name: Srey Aun

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Aun P. is 35 years old and she is a farmer who lives in Rayak village in Takeo province. She has three children, one of whom attends the local school, while the others are too young to work or study. She owns a 0.5 hectare field to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Soviet Ouch, (shown on the right of the photo) is a motorcycle taxi driver who earns a little money to support his family. In his business, he now faces a problem because it costs him a lot of money to buy petroleum to support his old motorbike. Thus, Mrs. Sreyaun P. is asking for a loan from AMK to buy a new motorbike to replace the old one in order to save money on petroleum.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike to replace the old one

loans.name: Phea

texts.en: Mrs. Phea S. is 31-year-old widow without any children. She is a farmer living in Kdei Tnaot village in Takeo province. Although she works hard, she still does not earn enough income to support herself. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding.  She would also like to build a piggery and to buy food for her pig breeding.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for breeding

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Mrs. Chantha N. is 44 years old and she lives in Trapaing Tonle village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Pen Sem, are farmers who own a 2-hectare field to cultivate rice. They have a problem because they do not have enough money to buy rice seeds for cultivating. Thus, Mrs. Chantha N. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seeds; she plans to use the rest of the loan to buy pesticides. Mrs. Chantha N. has six children: three are students, two are farmers and one is a labourer. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds for cultivating

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Mrs. Ry O. lives in Trapeang Tonle village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who cultivates rice on land that she owns. Her husband, Mr. Nin Noun, is farmer who owns a rice mill and breeds pigs. Since pig breeding is going well, he wants to expand the business so his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for his business. Mrs. Ry O. has four children: one works at TPC, a small company, two attend the local school and one stays home to help with housework.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for her husband's business

loans.name: Edilberto's Group

texts.en:
Edilberto P. is from the village of Natappian East Solana, Cagayan. He is 49 years old. Edilberto is the leader of an 8-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Edilberto P.'s Group.

Edilberto is married and has 5 school-aged children. Edilberto owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Edilberto has been in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Edilberto joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edilberto has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to to purchase raw ingredients to make products for sale. Edilberto is requesting a new loan which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Edilberto from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Math

texts.en:
Math S. is 57 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh, the capital city. She is a good housewife: she cooks very good meals for her family and cares for her children. She is mother of a child who is already married and lives separately and works slaughtering animals to sell.

Currently Math S. depends on the income from her husband’s commerce. He owns a car which he uses to supply a taxi service for a profit.

Math S. is applying for a loan to use as capital to invest in a new business. She will use her loan to order beef to sell at the market. This will provide her with additional income and she will use it to ensure that her family attains a better standard of living.

loans.use: To order beef to sell

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Mrs Aun T. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. She is 40 years old and lives in Prey Mien village in Takeo province. Her husband, Mr Hun Chou, is a fisherman who makes a small income to support his family (he is shown on the left in the photo). Mrs Aun T. is the mother of four children: one is a construction worker, while the others are in school except for the youngest who is too young for school (this child is only two years old).

Although they work hard, they still do not earn enough money to support the family, so Mrs. Aun T. decided to ask for a loan from AMK to buy a cow to start a new breeding business.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start new breeding business

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar T.'s main source of income comes from selling bread and coconut wine (tuba) in her community. She is 66 years old, married and has 10 grown-up children. She is from the village of Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Pilar has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Pilar joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Pilar is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sin T. is 52 years old and she lives in Trapeang Tonle village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice for a living. She faces an obstacle with her business, so she is seeking a loan from AMK to buy fertilizer. Her husband, Mr. Phy Hoy (at right) helps her with the farming. 

Mrs. Sin T. has four children. One is employed by a small company and the others are students.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the rice field.

loans.name: Yann

texts.en: Mrs Yann P. and her husband, Mr Sok Som, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice. She is the mother of five children who are all students. She lives in Prey Buy village in Takeo province. They now face a small problem because they do not have enough rice seeds, so she decided to ask for a loan from AMK to buy rice seeds. She will use the rest of the loan to buy more fertilizers and pesticides to support her field.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pesticides

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine N. is from Gango Ozamiz City. She is 43, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a business where she makes and sell snacks in the market. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which she will use to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en:
Daylinda B. is from the village of Hasaan Lopez, in Jaena Misamis Occidental. She is 51, married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Daylinda owns & operates a general store, where she sells canned goods (sardines), shampoo, sugar, toothpaste and other daily use products for the local community. Daylinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Daylinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daylinda repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Daylinda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which she will use to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong C., 27, is married and has a three-year-old child. They live in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. Thak has been employed at a private company (City Lighting Company)  since 2002. He is able to earn an income of USD 8 per day to help cover the family expenses. His wife is a hairdresser at a local market, and she has been with this business since 2003, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Thak and his wife try to work hard every day to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They want to improve their businesses as well. As a result, he is requesting a loan of US $600 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. He will use the loan to purchase equipment to facilitate his wife’s business. This is his first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: buy hairdressing equipment

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: Mrs. Sophal N., 35, has a 3.5-hectare plot for farming in Kor village, Takeo province. She earns a little income from farming. She is married to Mr. Pem Kim, who is a construction worker and pig breeder. Her husband also helps her in farming. Since her rice field has a lot of insects, she decided to ask for a loan to buy pesticides to kill insects and make her crops more productive. In addition, she would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers and fuel, and to fix her watering machine for her farm. She will also buy pig food and piglets for her husband's business.

loans.use: To buy pesticides to kill insects to make her crops more productive.

loans.name: Sareth

texts.en: Mrs. Sareth E. is 45. She is a widow with two children; one is a student and one is 3 years old. They live in Soumbour village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot where she cultivates rice. With her rice yield, she sells some for an income. Aside from this farming, she is a laborer who sells for a pig seller. In her rice farming, she now faces a problE. because her field has infertile soil, which affects  her crop. To solve this problE., she needs a loan to buy fertilizers and she will use some of the loan to buy fuel and rice seeds, and  the rest to hire laborers to work on the field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, fuel and rice seeds

loans.name: Noen

texts.en:
Miss Noen C., 47, is a farmer. She is a single woman who lives in Soumbour village in the Kandal province. She owns 1-hectare of land on which to cultivate rice for a living. Aside from this, she is a sesame seller. When she has free time from farming and selling sesame, she works as a laborer for an income to support herself. 

In her rice field, she now has an obstacle because she does not have enough money to buy fuel to support a water machine to water her crops while the irrigation system is far from her rice field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fuel for her water machine and pesticides to kill the insects in order to make her crops more productive.

loans.use: To buy fuel for her water machine and pesticides to kill the insects in order to make her crops more productive

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en: Shiela A. is from the city of Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 34 years old. Shiela is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Shiela operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling motorcycle spare parts and accessories in the local community. Shiela has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2007, Shiela joined GDMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shiela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from GDMPC. Shiela is requesting a new loan of 13,061 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Shiela from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chheung

texts.en:
Chheung S., 36, is married and lives with four children in Battambong town, Cambodia. S. is engaged in a business of selling bread, meatballs, and grilled eggs. He is able to earn an income of $4 per day to help cover the family expenses. His wife buys fish from local farmers in her village for resale at a local market, also earning an income of $4 per day. 

S. and his wife try to work hard every day to ensure a good standard of living for the family. And they are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, he is requesting a loan of $1,100 from CREDIT, a Kiva partner. He wants to use the expected loan to purchase more fish to sell. This is his second loan from CREDIT. (S.'s husband is pictured here)

loans.use: Buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Noeurn

texts.en:
Mr. Noeurn N. is 32 years old and lives in Preaek Khmaer village in the Kandal province. He is the husband of Mrs. Tai Cham, who is a garment-factory worker. They have two children, who are 8 and 5 years old. They are both in school. 

Mr. Noeurn N. and his wife are farmers. This month is a season for cultivating rice but he does not have enough money to grow rice. Thus, he requested his third loan to buy vegetable seeds and rice seeds for cultivating in his own field.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds and rice seeds for cultivating in his own field

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeurn T. is 46 years old. She is a widow with three children. The elder child is 24 years old, while the second child is 20 and the youngest one is 17. Two of them are garment-factory workers and the other is a motorcycle taxi driver. Nowadays, they all live in Cheung Prey Bei village in the Kandal province.

Mrs. Saroeurn T. is a farmer. The business of the third child has a problem because his motorbike is very old, which makes him use more money for petroleum T. support that motorbike. Mrs. Saroeurn T. requested a loan for a new motorbike for her child.

loans.use: A new motorbike for her son's business

loans.name: Alan

texts.en:
Alan U.'s main source of income comes from providing motor services to community members. He is 43 years old, married and has seven school-age children. They are from the village of Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Alan has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Alan joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Alan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Alan is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in his business. This will be his second loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Tum

texts.en:
Mrs. Tum H. is 46 years old. The name of her husband is Mr. Pea Hieng. This couple has three children. Their first child is twenty-two years old. Their second child is fifteen years old. Their third child is six years old. Two of the children are attending the local school while the other is a garment factory worker. This family lives in the Preaek Ta Sau village, in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Tum H. is a farmer who owns a 0.5 hectare field of land on which she cultivates rice, in order to earn for living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil. She decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to cultivate the rice and she would use rest of the loan to buy fuel, rice seed, and to hire the laborers to plow the field. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the rice, to buy fuel, rice seed, and to hire laborers to plow the field.

loans.name: Phangheng

texts.en: Mrs. Phangheng S. is 33 years old. She lives in Preaek Ta Sau village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to support the rice field. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Phangheng S. and her husband decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, rice seed, and fuel. Her husband, Mr Chat Seng, helps her to do farming and also for supporting their family. Mrs. Phangheng S. is mother to three children, two of whom are attending the local school. The third child is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, rice seed, and fuel.

loans.name: Chou

texts.en: Chou S., 26, is married and lives with five children in Battambong town, Cambodia. Chou is engaged in the agriculture sector, raising ducks and pigs. He is able to earn an income of USD10 per day to help cover the family expenses. His wife sells vegetables at a local market in the town, earning an income of USD 6 per day. S. and his wife try to work hard and to help each other every day to ensure a good standard of living for their family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, S. is requesting for a loan of US $1200 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. He wants to use this loan to purchase duck food and more piglets to raise for sale. This is his first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy duck food and piglets to raise for sale.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mr. Sok T. is a villager of Preaek Ta Sau, in Kandal province. He is 57 years old. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which to grow crops. In his farming, he faces an obstacle because his field has infertile soil. Mr. Sok T. has decided to ask for a third loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, fuel, and plastic bags to support the growing of crops. His wife is Mrs. Soeurn Chan. She helps him cultivate the vegetables. This couple has three children, one of whom is a garment factory worker and the others help their family to do farming. His wife is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, fuel, and plastic bags to support the growing crops.

loans.name: Ek

texts.en: Ek S. is a widow and lives with three children in Battambong town, Cambodia. S. is engaged in the business of selling various kinds of vegetables at a local market. She is able to earn an income of USD 4 per day to help cover the family’s expenses. The family is also assisted by three of her children, who are all employed at the neighboring country, earning USD 100 per month each. S. and her children try to work hard every day to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, S. is requesting a loan of US $250 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase groceries to sell at her stand. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy groceries to stock the store.

loans.name: Mil

texts.en:
Mrs. Mil P. is a farmer who owns a 2 hectare field of land to grow rice. She is 42 years old and the mother of six children: one is employed in a garment factory, three others are laborers, and the rest are attending the local school. They live in Tuol Svay village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Mil P. faces a problem because her field has infertile soil. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for a laborer to plow the field. Her husband, Mr. Orey Se, helps her with the farming. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides and pay for a laborer to plow the field

loans.name: Nharn

texts.en: Mrs. Nharn T. lives in Tuol Svay village in Takeo province. She is 27 years old and she is a farmer. She owns 1.5-hectare field to cultivate rice to earn her living. Her husband, Mr. Sareurn Gnorng, is a farmer and laborer. In addition, he is a fisherman who can make a small income to support the family. Although they try to work hard, they still don’t earn enough money to support their family. In order to improve the living conditions, Mrs. Nharn T. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her rice field. Mrs. Nharn T. is a mother of two children: one of whom is attending the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, and pesticides for her rice field.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey N. is 30 years old. She lives in Chambak Tuem village and Takeo province. She is a farmer and she owns a plot of land to grow crops. The irrigation system is far away from her field and she does not have enough moN. to build an irrigation system. So, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a water machine to water her crops. She will use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers and vegetable seeds for farming. Her husband, Mr Soly Chhoem, helps her on the farm. This couple has three children: two of whom are attending the local school, which is nearby their home, while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a water machine to water her crops. The rest of the loan will buy fertilizers, and vegetable seeds for farming.

loans.name: Ham

texts.en: Ham N., 49, is a widow and lives with one school-aged-child in Battambong town, Cambodia. N. is engaged in weaving Cambodian traditional mats made from grass. She also grows rice and sells vegetables and groceries. She is able to earn an income of USD 5 per day to help cover the family’s expenses. N. and her family members try to work hard every day to ensure a good standard of living for their family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, N. is requesting a loan of US $700 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase seeds for rice and vegetables to expand her rice and vegetable productions. This is her second loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To purchase rice and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Mrs. Lon Chan Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Lon C., who is the leader of 12 members in this village, is the village bank president in Pump Edth village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 3-hectare field to cultivate rice. Since her rice field is huge, she cannot harvest the crops by herself. She has decided to ask for a loan to hire laborers to harvest the crops. Mr. Samorat Nget is a vice village chief and he is a cow middleman. Mrs. Lon C. is a mother of three children: two are students and the youngest one is an immigrant working as a laborer in Thailand.

loans.use: To hire laborers to harvest the crops.

loans.name: Natividad's Group

texts.en:
Natividad C. is from the village of San Miguel. She is 59 years old. Natividad is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Natividad C.'s Group.

Natividad is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Natividad owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. Natividad has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Natividad joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Natividad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Natividad is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Natividad from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the group’s businesses. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand inventory and product variety.

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Alice B.'s main source of income comes from selling fruits and vegetables. She is 49 years old, married and has 10 grown-up children. She is from the village of Sta. Maria, Cauayan City, Isabela. Alice has been in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Alice joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Alice is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This will be her second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income.

Alice is the leader of a 10 member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members, if someone is delinquent or defaults.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Smas

texts.en: Smas R., 46, is a humble mother who has three children. All three children are studying at the local public school. Currently, Smas R. stays at home to care for the children and to do housework. This family is supported, financially, by Smas R.’s husband. He sells a variety of merchandise from province to province. He also buys items in bulk, on credit, from market sellers in Phnom Penh. He then supplies his products to people who are sellers in small markets in each province. Smas R. finds that her husband’s enterprise is a very profitable one and he is able to earn enough money to meet what her family needs. She would like to ask for a loan for her husband to accrue business capital.

loans.use: To accrue his business capital.

Maria Rosario is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more materials needed to provide services such as nailpolish, cotton, and acetone. This will be the third loan taken out by Maria Rosario from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.
