Margarita es una persona muy responsable y honesta y esta muy agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado al otorgarle el prestamo.						
						
						
						
						
						
						
						
						
						
						
						
						
						
Ii
texts.en:
Margarita lives in her own house, and there she operates her hardware store. She has shown herself to be very responsible and hard-working.

Margarita is divorced and after the separation she struck out on her own. It was difficult for her and her children and she had no choice but to work hard if she was going to advance her minor children. Margarita is a very responsible and honest person and is very thankful to her banking institution for its help in obtaining this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO INCREASE INVESTMENT IN HER HARDWARE STORE

loans.name: Vicenta Isabel

texts.es:
Vicenta S. de 25 años, tiene una casa mixta de caña y cemento con agua y luz como servicios básicos esta ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su esposo trabaja de guardia de seguridad en una empresa tiene 2 hijos uno de 5 años y otro de 11 años los dos estudiando en una escuela fiscal.

Vicenta hace ya 5 años atrás comenzó en su casa con la venta de bolos y banano empastados, fue así creciendo poco a poco su clientela por lo que pusieron una cancha de futbol frente a su casa  ahora ella vende también colas y hielo trabaja de lunes a domingos, una de las mayores complicaciones son las lluvias porque suele inundarse su sector.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar leche, azúcar, fundas para poder incrementar su negocio y adecuarlo mejor. En el futuro quiere poner su propia tienda con productos bien surtidos.
texts.en:
Vincenta S. is 25 years old, and has a house built of reeds mixed with cement that has the basic services of light and water. It is located in the Paraíso neighborhood of Guayaquil. Her husband works as a security guard for a company. She has 2 children, aged 5 and 11, who are studying in public school. Vincenta started her business selling bolos (similar to a popsicle, but the frozen product comes inside a plastic tube) and chocolate covered bananas 5 years ago, and her customer base has grown little by little because they put a soccer field in front of her house. Now she also sells soft drinks and ice, and she works every day. One of her biggest problems has been the rain, because it tends to flood in her area. With the loan she wants to buy milk, sugar, and to have the funds to increase her business and supply it better. In the future she wants to have her own store that is well stocked with merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar and other items.

loans.name: María José

texts.es: La joven María José T. M. de 25 años tiene un bar-restaurante el cual tiene un estilo campestre muy agradable. Ella en este año nuevo desea hacer algunas reformas al local para proporcionar a sus clientes un mejor servicio  y está segura que con su esfuerzo, dedicación y trabajo se hará realidad.
texts.en:
The young Maria Jose T. M. is 25 years old and has a restaurant and bar, which has a very pleasant, country style. In the new year, she wishes to make some alterations to the business, in order to provide her clients with better service. She is sure that with her effort, dedication, and hard work, this will be achieved.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase premium materials, such as liquor, basic grains, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Adela Efigenia

texts.es:
Adela A. de 45 años, vive en una casa de ladrillos con agua y luz como servicios básicos esta ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, esta casada hace  9 años su esposo trabaja como carpintero y constructor tiene una niña de 3 años.

Adela hace ya un año atrás fue invitada por una amiga a ser parte de las vendedoras Yanbal así comenzó después de tener unos ahorros invirtió en ropa para venderla con los productos Yanbal. Ahora Adela trabaja en cualquier horario en que les pidan los productos  vende perfumes, cremas, lociones, ropa, maquillajes, una de las mayores complicaciones es cuando da crédito de sus productos por lo que no les cancelan rápido para poder invertir ese dinero.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yanbal y ropa para tener más variedad en sus productos. En el futuro quiere poner su propio gabinete de belleza y poder terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Adela is 45 years old and lives in a brick home with basic services, including electricity and running water. Her home is located in Paraíso de Guayaquil. She has been married for nine years. Her husband works as a carpenter and construction worker. They have a three year-old daughter. A year ago a friend invited her to sell Yanbal beauty products. This allowed her to save up some money, which she invested in clothing, which she sold alongside the Yanbal items. Adela now works anytime her customers request her products. She sells perfumes, creams, lotions, clothing, and makeup. One of her biggest complications is when her customers do not cancel orders in a timely manner and she must then pay for the items herself. She will use the money from this loan to invest in other Yanbal products and clothing in order to be able to offer a wider assortment. In the future she would like to have her own shop and to finish her home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing and Yabal beauty products

loans.name: Felipe Santiago

texts.es: El señor Felipe Santiago R. S. tiene 47 años de edad, es casado y habitan en el Reparto Juan Ramon Padilla la esposa se dedica al comercio y juntos tiene 2 hijos, ellos han trabajado arduamente con el objetivo de poder brindarles a sus hijos las comodides necesarias para que ellos tengan una vida digna y segura para esto el señor R. desde el año pasado ha solicitado prestamo con el objetivo de realizar mejoras en la infraestructura de su hogar, ellos continuaran con una sagunda etapa de su proyecto de construccion, pero solicitaran un prestamo para reinvertirlo en su negocio el cual es un Aserradero con el prestamo compraron materia prima, esto le trara mejores condiciones de vida a ellos y la satisfaccion como padres de poderles ofrecer a sus hijos un futuro mejor, logrando a un largo plazo la posibilidad de darles una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Felipe Santiago R. S., 47, is married and the father of two children. His wife is a merchant. Together, they work hard toward providing their children with the comforts required so that they can have a worthy and safe life. To achieve this, since last year, he has asked for funding to bring about some improvements to his home's infrastructure. They will continue with the second phase of their building project but the loan will be used to invest in raw materials for their business, which is a sawmill. This will improve their living conditions and give them the satisfaction of knowing that, as parents, they are offering their children a better future hoping, in the long run, to provide them with a worthy home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en: Grace S. is the group leader of a fourteen-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Grace is from the village of Dipacamo, San Guillermo, Isabela. She is 36 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Grace owns and operates a business selling fruits and vegetables. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Grace joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Roberto Isaias

texts.es: El señor Roberto Isaias M. tiene 49 años de edad vive en el Barrio la Borgoña, es casado y su esposa se dedica  a la venta de frutas, aportando a  los gsatos del hogar, ellos son una familia muy humilde pero trabajadora tienen tres hijos los cuales son independientes, se han dedicado desde hace 22 años al cultivo de la piña, los cuales se han presentado con escazes por los problemas de sequia, ellos han solicitado este prestamo con el objetivo de comprar materiales agricolas que cuiden sus cosechas tales como los fertilizanet y pestizidas, esto les beneficiaria a gran medida por que podrian producir una cosecha de primera, que la lograrian vender a un buen precio, esto a futuro les daria la oportunidad de diversificar sus siembras y proveerles mejores condiciones economicas para la familia.
texts.en:
Roberto Isaias M., 49, lives in the la Borgoña neighborhood, is married and sells fruit to support his household. They are a very humble but hard-working family. They have three independent children. For the past 22 years he has farmed pineapple. However, due to the prevailing draught conditions, crop yields have been poor. They are requesting funding to buy agricultural supplies, like fertilizers and pesticides, that will help them produce better crops. This will be of great help in that they will be able to produce a top quality crop to sell at a good price. This will mean, in the future, an opportunity to diversify their crops and provide better living conditions for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Minerva's Group

texts.en: Minerva G. is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Minerva G.'s Group. Minerva is from the village of Carikkikan Norte. She is 29 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Minerva owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Minerva joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Luciano Antonio

texts.es: El Señor Luciano Antonio M. tiene 66 años de edad, es casado y su esposa se dedica a la venta de comida aportando a los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen 3 hijos los cuales viven de forma independiente, la familia se dedica al cultivo de la piña desde hace 21 años el problema que esto le a generado ha sido las largas distancias que tiene que recorrer para ir a su finca, el anhela algun dia tener las posibilidades de poder construir una pequeña casa cerca de la finca para cuidar de los cultivos, pero para esto la familia M. tiene fijado el objetivo de trabajar laboriosamnete en las cosechas de piña, de manera que solicitaron este prestamo para invertirlo en la comprar de materiales agricolas que le birinden un mantenimiento optimo a la produccion y que se produzca una cosecha de calidad que se venda de forma rapida y les genere una recuperacion de lo invertido, esto a futuro les podria brindar la posibiliad de construccion de la casa en su pequeña finca.
texts.en:
Luciano Antonio M., 66, is married; his wife sells prepared meals to help meet family expenses. They have three children who are independent. The family has farmed pineapple for the past 21 years. The problem inherent in this is the long distance he must cover to reach his farmlands. He hopes some day to be able to build a small house close to the farm so that he can care for his crops. With this end in mind, the M. family works hard in pineapple farming. They need funding to buy agricultural products that will help provide the optimum crop yields and the best quality of product so that it will sell quickly and at a price that will recoup the investment. This would allow them, in the future, to be able to build the house on the farm.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for pineapple crop maintenance.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en: Criselda A. is from the village of Cabisera 27. She is 38 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Criselda owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. Criselda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Criselda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Ana Carolina

texts.es:
La  Sra. Ana O. es trabajadora del centro de insumos para la salud en el departamento de contabilidad.
Ana va usar el crédito para comprar cemento, arena y piedra para la construcción de un muro en la parte de atrás de su vivienda.
Quiere construir ese muro para que los niños puedan jugar con más seguridad.
Ella es casada y madre de dos hijos los que a la vez se encuentran en edad escolar.
Este es el segundo crédito que Ana ha tenido con CEPRODEL. Ha trabajado con ceprodel 2 años.
Ana dijo que sus créditos con Ceprodel le han ayudado mucho por lo que ha mejorado su casa de habitación
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana O. works in the accounting department for a health supplies center. She is going to use this credit to purchase cement, sand, and stones for the construction of a wall in the back part of her home, so that her children can play with greater safety. She is married and the mother of two school-age children. This is the second credit that Ana has had with CEPRODEL, and she has worked with us for two years. She says that her loans through Ceprodel have helped her a lot in improving her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cement, sand, and stone

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine B. is from the village of Sta. Barbara. She is 42 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Geraldine owns and operates a business preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Geraldine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz  tiene  21  años, vive con su esposo y su bebé de 8 meses en casa de sus suegros.Se dedica a la venta de vacas, toros y ovejas desde hace 2 años, en la actualidad posee 3 vacas que en los próximos días  venderá en la feria ganadera de su ciudad, para lograrlo debe cuidarlas mucho, además de alimentarlas adecuadamente.  Este trabajo es bien rentable a pesar de  los riesgos de todo negocio, como por ejemplo el robo de los  animales por lo que Luz esta  pensando en  el futuro mejorar la raza, además  quiere tener mas animales para tener mayor capital de trabajo.Es la tercera oportunidad que esta solicitando un crédito con  MFP, y  tiene grandes deseos de continuar adelante en el banco comunal al que pertenece y así aumentar sus ventas.Con el dinero adquirido comprará mayor cantidad de ganado vacuno  para su establo y empezará a mejorar la raza.
texts.en:
Luz, 21, lives with her husband and 8-month-old baby in her in-laws' house. She has raised cattle and sheep for the last 2 years. She currently owns 3 cows which she intends to sell in the city's cattle fair in the next few days. In order to have successful sales, she needs to care for them well and feed them properly. This work is profitable despite the pitfals inherent in all work, such as the theft of the animals. Luz is looking to improve her livestock and she wants to have more animals. This is her third loan request with MFP and her wish to continue forward in her communal bank and to increase her sales is big. With the funding she will buy more cattle for her cowshed and she will start to improve her livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Antonio G. es trabajador del centro de insumos para la salud en el departamento de seguridad.
Antonio  va usar el crédito para comprar cemento, arena y piedrín para la construcción de una pared en unos de los cuartos de la casa por lo que antes era cerrado con madera.
Quiere construir esa pared para que los niños puedan tener más seguridad.
El es casado y padre de dos hijos los que a la vez se encuentran en edad escolar.
Este es el segundo crédito que Antonio ha tenido con CEPRODEL. Ha trabajado con ceprodel 2 años.
Antonio dijo que sus créditos con Ceprodel le han ayudado mucho por lo que ha mejorado su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Sr. Antonio G. is a labourer at the centre for health supplies in the Department of Security. He plans to use the loan to buy cement, sand, and stone to build walls for some of the rooms of his house. Formerly they were made of wood. Antonio wants to build the walls to provide greater safety for his children. He is married and has two school-aged children. This is his second loan with Kiva partner CEPRODEL, and he has worked with them for two years. He commented that his loans with Ceprodel have helped him greatly to improve his house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement, stone, and sand

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en: Rogelia V. is from the village of Cabisera 27. She is 24 years old, is married, and has three infant children. Rogelia owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. Rogelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her fourth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn S. is from the village of Cabisera 27. She is 44 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Marilyn owns and operates a business providing rice processing to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her fourth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 43 años, vive con sus hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde su niñez realiza lindos bordados en faldas,todos los días trabaja en su casa y luego vende sus diseños  en el mercado de su ciudad, su trabajo dura varias semanas, además también lleva su mercadería terminada a los vendedores de trajes típicos, este trabajo es de su agrado ya que disfruta realizándolo por eso  quiere seguir  en esta actividad  hasta donde pueda continuar con sus fuerzas.Es la décima vez  que esta solicitando un crédito con  MFP.Con el dinero del préstamo María comprará mayor cantidad de  materiales para sus bordados; como hilos y telas.
texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old and lives with her children in her own home. Since she was young she has made lovely embroidery for traditional skirts from her region. Everyday she works at home and then sells her designs in the artisans market in her city. Her workload lasts various weeks. Furthermore, she also takes her finished merchandise to sellers of traditional suits. This work is pleasurable for her since she enjoys doing it. This is why she wants to continue this activity for as long as she can with her efforts. This is the tenth time she requests a loan with MFP. With the loan Maria will buy a greater quantity of materials for her embroideries such as thread and fabrics.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a greater quantity of materials for her business.

loans.name: Wilmer Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Wilmer se dedica a laborar arduamente en una empresa en el departamento de bodega y almacenamiento.El crédito que solicita es para el mejoramiento de su vivienda por lo que va a usar el crédito para comprar zinc y clavos para el techo de su casa por lo que antes se encontraba en mal estado y el agua se pasaba en invierno.
 
Ha trabajado con Ceprodel 2 años y afirma que sus créditos con Ceprodel le han ayudado mucho por lo que ha venido mejorando su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Wilmer works hard in a company in their grocery and storage department. He will use his funding to buy zinc metal sheeting and nails to repair his house's roof, which is in very poor condition and let in a lot of rain water during winter. This is his second loan with CEPRODEL; he has collaborated with CEPRODEL for two years. Wilmer states that the funding from CEPRODEL has been of great help to him with his home repairs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy zinc metal sheeting and nails.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie M. is from Sta. Barbara, llagan, Isabela. She is 35 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Rosemarie owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. Rosemarie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her sixth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cement, gravel, sand and ceramic tile.

loans.name: Milda

texts.es: Milda tiene  32 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la fabricación de tejas y ladrillos  en los terrenos que arrienda con  su esposo; ellos mismos extraen la tierra arcillosa que es la materia  prima básica  en la fabricación, también se abastece de los materiales indispensables para realizar este trabajo, es de esta manera que siempre trabaja  todo el día para aumentar su producción, las mejores épocas de rentabilidad son durante el  verano, y cuando bajan las ventas es durante el invierno. Tiene planes de incrementar la extensión de su fábrica  para tener mayor producción.Es la cuarta oportunidad que  tiene un crédito con  MFP, y  ha demostrado ser una las mejores socias más emprendedoras de su  banco comunal.El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de  aserrín para aumentar de esta manera la producción de fabricación de ladrillos y tejas.
texts.en:
Milda, 32, lives with her husband and three children in her own home. For the last 4 years she has manufactured roof tiles and bricks on land that she and her husband lease. They, themselves, extract the clayey soil which is the prime ingredient in manufacture of their products and they stock up on the other indispensable materials needed for their work. This is the manner in which she works all day to increase production. Summer is her best selling season and Winter is when sales drop the most. She aims to enlarge her factory. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she has proven to be one of her communal bank's most enterprising members. The funds will be used to buy sawdust which will be used to increase roof tile and brick production.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sawdust.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia C. is from the town of Tumauini, Isabela. She is 47 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Amalia owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the public market. She earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. Amalia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Amalia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 47 años y su familia esta conformada por ella y sus hijos que viven en su propia casa. Desde que era niña, creció y se formó bajo una cultura agrícola y ganadera, habiéndolo aprendido bien por sus padres, le ha servido mucho ya que ahora se dedica al cuidado de sus vacas, ovejas, así como sembrar extensos terrenos de papa, maíz, alverja, habas, entre otros, por lo que se ha convertido en su fuente principal de ingreso económico, además de su propio consumo. Sus hijos que son su orgullo, la ayudan constantemente en las labores, ya que lo que más anhela es restaurar su establo para ofrecerle un mejor cuidado a su ganado e intensificar su crianza. Esta es su onceavo crédito con MFP, y se le considera como una mujer muy activa y colaboradora dentro de su grupo comunal, además demuestra compromiso en el pago de sus deudas. Con el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar alfalfa como forraje para sus vacas, además de comprar un toro de raza.
texts.en:
Antonia is 47 years old and her family is made up of herself and her children; they all live together in their own home. Since she was a little girl, she was raised in an agricultural and cattle raising milieu, learning her trade well from her parents. Now that she cares for her own cattle and sheep, what she learned from them as served her well. She also farms potato, corn, peas, and flat beans, among others; this has become her primary source of income as well as provided for her family's own consumption. Her children, who are her pride and joy, constantly help her with her chores. Her greatest wish is to restore her cowshed so that her cattle can have the best care in order to strengthen their growth. This is her eleventh loan with MFP. She is considered to be a very active and cooperative member of her group. Besides, she is always committed to repaying her loans on time. This funding will be used to buy sacks of natural fertilizer for alfalfa planting as well as for fodder for her cows and to buy a bull.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fodder for her cattle.
